exsufflator: <entryFree id="n17280" type="main" key="exsuffla_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exsufflātor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">exuf-</orth>), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>exsufflo</etym>, <sense id="n17280.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who blows at;</hi> trop., <hi rend="ital">a despiser</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mocker</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Christi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>August.</author> in Joann. Tract. 11, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exsufflo: <entryFree id="n17281" type="main" key="exsufflo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-sufflo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">exuf-</orth>), <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n17281.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To blow away</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 4:3:57" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 4, 3, 57</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,045:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Agg. 1, 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n17281.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To blow at</hi> or <hi rend="ital">upon</hi> a person or thing (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Idol. 11 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">radios igneos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Sir. 43, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">infantes (as a charm against the devil),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 105" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 105 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">quem (daemonem) eminus exsufflans, se exsufflari existimans, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sulp.</author> Sev. Dial. 3, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exsugeo: <entryFree id="n17282" type="main" key="exsu_geo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exsūgeo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">exūg-</orth>), <itype>ēre</itype>, v. exsugo <sense id="n17282.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
exsugo: <entryFree id="n17283" type="main" key="exsu_go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-sūgo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">exūg-</orth>), <itype>xi, ctum, 3</itype> (anteclass. forms of second conj., <sense id="n17283.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">imper.</hi> exsugeto, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 156, 3</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">fut.</hi> exsugebo, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:2:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 5</bibl>), <pos>v. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to suck out</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">umorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:4:15" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 4, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">liquorem de materia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 8, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguinem alicui (alicujus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:2:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 3, 2, 37</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:2:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulnus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:27:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 27, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">venena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 1, 27, § 57</bibl></cit>. —Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">exsuctus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">exuct-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">sucked out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dried up</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">segetes exsuctiores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:7:11" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 7, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">infirmum corpus et exsuctum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 30:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 30, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exsul: <entryFree id="n17284" type="main" key="exsul"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-sul</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">exul</orth>, <itype>ŭlis</itype>, <gen>comm.</gen> <etym>usual. referred to solum; one who is banished from his native soil; but prob. from root sal-, Sanscr. sar, to go; Lat. salire, saltare; cf.: praesul, consul, subsul, Corss. Ausspr. 2, 71</etym>, <sense id="n17284.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a banished person</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wanderer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exile.</hi> </sense><sense id="n17284.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes scelerati atque impii, quos leges exsilio affici volunt, exsules sunt, etiamsi solum non mutarint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:4:2:31" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Par. 4, 2, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">civitas exsulem regem (Tarquinium) esse jussit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 25 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exsules damnatique,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:55:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 55, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">capitis damnati exsulesque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:110:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 110, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum Hannibal Carthagine expulsus Ephesum ad Antiochum venisset exsul,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:18:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 18, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum vagus et exsul erraret atque undique exclusus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:62:175" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 62, 175</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exsules restituti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 1, 1, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:12" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">reducere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 1, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 28, 45</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dives, inops, Romae, seu fors ita jusserit, exsul,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:1:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 1, 59</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">patriae quis exsul se quoque fugit?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:16:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 16, 19</bibl></cit>.—With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc vero exsul patriā, domo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 14:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 14, 17</bibl></cit>.—Prov.: exsuli ubest nusquam domus est, sine sepulchro mortuus, Publ. Syr. 155 (Speng.).—</sense><sense id="n17284.2" n="b" level="4"> As <hi rend="ital">fem.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">exsul Hypermnestra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:14:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 14, 129</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 63</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Latona) exsul erat mundi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:189" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 189</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">exul adhuc jacet umbra ducit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:8:837" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 8, 837</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n17284.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">exsul mentisque domusque,</quote> <trans><tr>deprived of reason</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:409" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 409</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">erret per urbem pontis exsul et clivi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:5:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 5, 3</bibl></cit>: ciconia avis exsul hiemis, i. e. <hi rend="ital">that leaves us in winter</hi>, Publ. Syr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 55</bibl> (Com. Fragm. p. 304 Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
exsularis: <entryFree id="n17285" type="main" key="exsu^la_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exsŭlāris</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">exul-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>exsul</etym>, <sense id="n17285.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to exile</hi> or <hi rend="ital">to exiles</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">poena,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 15, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maeror,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 14, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exsulatio: <entryFree id="n17286" type="hapax" key="exsu^la_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exsŭlātĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">exul-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>exsulo</etym>, <sense id="n17286.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">banishment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exile</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">exsulatione multare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:22:3" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 22, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exsulator: <entryFree id="n17287" type="main" key="exsu^la_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exsŭlātor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">exul-</orth>), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n17287.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a banisher</hi>, <hi rend="ital">expeller</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">primi hominis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> Chrysol. p. 123</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exsulatus: <entryFree id="n17288" type="hapax" key="exsu^la_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exsŭlātus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">exul-</orth>), <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n17288.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">banishment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exile</hi>, M. Corvin. de Prog. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:29" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> 29</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
exsulo: <entryFree id="n17289" type="main" key="exsu^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exsŭlo</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">exŭlo</orth>, also arch. <orth extent="full" lang="la">exsŏlo</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">exŏlo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n17289.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [exsul]. </sense><sense id="n17289.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be an exile</hi> or <hi rend="ital">banished person</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to</hi> <cb n="EXSU" /> <hi rend="ital">live in exile</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">qui Romam in exsili um venisset, cui Romae exsulare jus esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:39:177" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 39, 177</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut exsulares,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:4:2:32 sq" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Par. 4, 2, 32 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aptissimus ad exulandum locus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 4, 8, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Volscos exsulatum abiit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:35:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 35, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exsulans atque egens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:18:39" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 18, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apud Prusiam exsulans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:24:52" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 24, 52</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:Spect. 4:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> Spect. 4, 5</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">alii exolatum abierant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 134</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 4, 3, 18</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n17289.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">perii, nam domo exulo nunc: metuo fratrem, Ne intus sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:5:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 5, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum omnes meo discessu exsulasse rem publicam putent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:4:2:30" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Par. 4, 2, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">peculatus ex urbe et avaritia si exulant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 4, 4, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">etiam cum manent corpore, animo tamen exsulant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:4:7" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 4, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quousque in regno exsulabo,</quote> <trans><tr>be a stranger in my own country</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:8:11" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 8, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17289.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to banish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exile</hi> a person (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">tunc iterum exulatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 26" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 26</bibl></cit>; Dict. Cretens. 4, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
exsulor: <entryFree id="n17290" type="main" key="exsu^lor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exsŭlor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">exul-</orth>), <itype>āri</itype>, <sense id="n17290.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">a.</hi>, = exsulo, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 5, 21, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 26 al" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 26 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
exsultabundus: <entryFree id="n17291" type="main" key="exsulta_bundus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exsultābundus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">exult-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>exsulto</etym>, <sense id="n17291.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">leaping for joy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exulting</hi> (postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">maesta ac lugentia castra velut exsultabundus intrare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:18:7:10" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 18, 7, 10</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 5, 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
exsultans: <entryFree id="n17292" type="main" key="exsultans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exsultans</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">exult-</orth>), <itype>antis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from exsulto.</entryFree>
exsultanter: <entryFree id="n17293" type="main" key="exsultanter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exsultanter</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">exult-</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos>, v. exsulto, <sense id="n17293.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
exsultantia: <entryFree id="n17294" type="main" key="exsultanti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exsultantĭa</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">exult-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>exsulto</etym>, <sense id="n17294.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a springing up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an attack</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">hostilis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Carm. 21, 564</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">trop.: morbi dolorisque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:5:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 12, 5, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exsultatio: <entryFree id="n17295" type="main" key="exsulta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exsultātĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">exult-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n17295.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a springing up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">leaping</hi>, <hi rend="ital">frisking</hi> (post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n17295.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">puerilis nimia exsultatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:3:18" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 3, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:2:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 2, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:215" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 54, 80, § 215</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n17295.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">excessive rejoicing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exultation</hi>: gaudium enim exsultatio, exsultationem tumor et nimia aestimatio sui sequitur, Sen. de Ira, 2, 21; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">laetitia dicitur exsultatio quaedam animi gaudio efferventior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:27:31" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 27, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Tranq. 15" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Tranq. 15 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:72 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 72 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
exsultativus: <entryFree id="n17296" type="main" key="exsulta_ti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exsultātīvus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">exult-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n17296.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">triumphant</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">conclusio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> in Psa. 37</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exsultim: <entryFree id="n17297" type="hapax" key="exsultim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exsultim</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">exult-</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>exsilio</etym>, <sense id="n17297.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">leaping about</hi>, <hi rend="ital">friskingly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ludit exsultim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:11:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 11, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exsulto: <entryFree id="n17298" type="main" key="exsulto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exsulto</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">exult-</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <sense id="n17298.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. freq. n.</hi> [id.], <hi rend="ital">to spring vigorously</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to leap</hi> or <hi rend="ital">jump up</hi> (class.; esp. in the trop. signif.). </sense><sense id="n17298.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">equi ferocitate exsultantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:26:90" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 26, 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eum. 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exsultantes loligines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:70:145" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 70, 145</bibl></cit>: pisciculi, id. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 66, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecora exsultantia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:364" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 35, 88, § 364</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">taurus in herba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:864" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 864</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:11:79" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 79</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(curetes) in numerum exsultant,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>dance</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:631" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 631</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17298.2" n="B" level="2"> Of inanimate subjects: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguis emicat exsultans alte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:195" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 195</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pila exsultat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 6:10" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 6, 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exsultant aestu latices,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:464" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 464</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 10, 46, § 114</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">exsultant vada atque aestu miscentur harenae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:557" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 557</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">glaebae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:179" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 19, 49, § 179</bibl></cit>: densiores circa pampini exsultant, <hi rend="ital">spring up</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">come up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grow up</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:180" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 17, 22, 35, § 180</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">breves (syllabae) si continuantur, exsultant,</quote> <trans><tr>to skip</tr>, <tr>hop</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:91" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 91</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17298.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n17298.4" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to gambol about</hi>, <hi rend="ital">move freely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">expatiate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic (in pectore) exsultat pavor ac metus,</quote> <trans><tr>riot</tr>, <tr>gambol</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 141</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum sit campus, in quo exsultare possit oratio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 35, 112</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in reliquis (orationibus) exsultavit audacius (Demosthenes),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:8:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 8, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">assurgendi exsultandique in laudando licentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:2:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solidos novus exsultabis in actus,</quote> <trans><tr>will undertake with alacrity</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4:4:38" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 4, 4, 38</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17298.5" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to exult</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rejoice exceedingly; to run riot</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to revel; to vaunt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">boast</hi>: exsultantem te et praefidentem tibi repriment legum habenae, Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:41:166" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 41, 166</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">rex ille (Tarquinius) victoriis divitiisque subnixus, exsultabat insolentiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 25</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">exsultasse populum insolentiā libertatis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exsultare eam (partem animi) in somno immoderateque jactari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:29:60" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 29, 60</bibl></cit>: exsultare voluptate, id. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 301, 7</bibl> (Rep. 3, 36 ed. Mos.): <cit><quote lang="la">laetitiā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Clu. 5, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 6, 16</bibl> (with temere gestiens); <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Att. 15, 21, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 2, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">gaudio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:27:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 27, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">victoriā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:6:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 6, 16</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">successu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:386" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 386</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gestis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vana spe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:4:17" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 4, 17</bibl></cit> et saep.: in ruinis alicujus,<pb n="706" /> <cb n="EXSU" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:26:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 26, 58</bibl>: in omni crudelitate, id. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 300, 26</bibl> (Rep. 2, 41 ed. Mos.): <cit><quote lang="la">Graeci exsultant, quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Att. 6, 1, 15</bibl></cit>: dum histrio in cubiculum principis exsultaverit (= <foreign lang="greek">e)corxh/saito</foreign>, Gronov.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 28</bibl> (al. insultaverit).—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">illa theatra (i. e. spectatores) exsultant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:15:39" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 15, 39</bibl></cit> Mos. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">furorem exsultantem reprimere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:44:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 44, 95</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">exsultantem laetitiam comprimere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:22:86" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Top. 22, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laus in qua maxime ceterorum exsultat oratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:16:54" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 16, 54</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-sultans</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">exult-</orth>), <itype>antis</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> * </sense><sense id="n17298.6" n="A" level="2"> (Acc. to I. B. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>) Of short syllables, <hi rend="ital">skipping</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hopping</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">paululum morae damus inter ultimum ac proximum verbum ... alioqui sit exsultantissimum et trimetri finis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:108" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 108</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17298.7" n="B" level="2"> (Acc. to II. B.) </sense><sense id="n17298.8" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Boastful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vain-glorious</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">turbati aut exsultantis animi motus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 17</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17298.9" n="2" level="3"> Of an orator or an oration, <hi rend="ital">diffuse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prolix</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fiunt pro grandibus tumidi ... laetis corrupti, compositis exsultantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:2:16" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 2, 16</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 10, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:56" default="NO">8, 3, 56</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:69" default="NO">9, 4, 69</bibl> (with remissae); <cit><quote lang="la">10, 4, 1: Cicero supra modum exsultans et superfluens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,003:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Dial. 18</bibl></cit>.— Hence, * <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">exsultanter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">diffusely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">at large;</hi> only <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae hilarius et quasi exsultantius scripsi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:18:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 18, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exsuperabilis: <entryFree id="n17299" type="main" key="exsu^pe^ra_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exsŭpĕrābĭlis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">exup-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>exsupero</etym>. <sense id="n17299.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that may be overcome</hi>, <hi rend="ital">surmountable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">superable</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">non exsuperabile saxum (Sisyphi),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenium mortale,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:214" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 214</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n17299.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that overcomes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">overpowering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">irresistible</hi>: opera, Quadrig. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:2:14" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 2, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
exsuperans: <entryFree id="n17300" type="main" key="exsu^pe^rans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exsŭpĕrans</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">exup-</orth>), <itype>antis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from exsupero.</entryFree>
exsuperantia: <entryFree id="n17301" type="main" key="exsu^pe^ranti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exsŭpĕrantĭa</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">exup-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>exsupero</etym>, <sense id="n17301.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pre-eminence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">superiority</hi> (rare but class.): an hoc non ita fit omni in populo? nonne omnem exsuperantiam virtutis oderunt? * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:36:105" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 36, 105</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingens Scipionis (with fiducia),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:18:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 18, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">splendoris vel altitudinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:14:1:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 14, 1, 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exsuperatio: <entryFree id="n17302" type="main" key="exsu^pe^ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exsŭpĕrātĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">exup-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n17302.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">exaggeration</hi> as a fig. of speech, the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">u(perbolh/</foreign>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 53, 67</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 6, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
exsuperator: <entryFree id="n17303" type="gloss" key="exsu^pe^ra_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exsŭpĕrātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n17303.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a conqueror</hi>, Num. Constant. ap. Eckhel. D. N. V. 8, p. 83.</sense></entryFree>
exsuperatorius: <entryFree id="n17304" type="main" key="exsu^pe^ra_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exsŭpĕrātōrĭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">exup-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>exsuperator</etym>, <sense id="n17304.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">conquering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">victorious</hi>: mensis, <hi rend="ital">the month of November</hi>, <hi rend="ital">called after the conqueror</hi> (<hi rend="ital">Commodus</hi>), <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Commod. 11</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">Calendae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exsupero: <entryFree id="n17305" type="main" key="exsu^pe^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-sŭpĕro</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">exup-</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum</itype> (<sense id="n17305.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. plur. part. sync.</hi> exsuperantum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=18" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 18</bibl> Müll.), <itype>1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <hi rend="ital">a.</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose). </sense><sense id="n17305.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to mount up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">appear above</hi> (very rare). </sense><sense id="n17305.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: exsuperant flammae; <cit><quote lang="la">furit aestus ad auras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:759" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 759</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17305.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to get the upper hand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to overcome</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prevail</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excel</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sol et vapor omnis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:385" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 385</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arma capessant, Et si non poterunt exsuperare, cadant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:372" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 372</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praesens dolor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1277" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1277</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quantum ipse feroci Virtute exsuperas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hannibal exsuperans astu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:57" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 1, 57</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17305.4" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to project</hi> or <hi rend="ital">tower above</hi> any thing, <hi rend="ital">to surmount</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rise above</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exceed.</hi> </sense><sense id="n17305.5" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">vites exsuperant ulmos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 1, 3, § 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exsuperat jugum,</quote> <trans><tr>passes over</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:905" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 905</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clivum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 31" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amnem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 17, 21, § 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Nilus exsuperavit sedecim cubita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:168" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 18, 18, 47, § 168</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">binas libras ponderis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 17, 30, § 64</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17305.6" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n17305.7" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To surpass</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exceed</hi>: quis homo te exsuperavit usquam gentium impudentiā? Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:36:77" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 36, 77</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes Tarquinios superbiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:11:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 11, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus morum nobilitate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:4:2" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid latitudine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 11, 8, § 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laudes alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:43:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 43, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cuncta exsuperans patrimonia census,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:13" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu vero, pater, vive et me quoque exsupera,</quote> <trans><tr>survive</tr>, <tr>outlive</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:5:9" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 5, 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aestatem,</quote> <trans><tr>to outlast</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 2, 4, § 33</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17305.8" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To be too much for</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to overpower</hi>, <hi rend="ital">overcome</hi>: id summum exsuperat Jovem, Poët. in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:10:25" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 10, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">materia vires exsuperante meas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:5:56" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 5, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caecum consilium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:591" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 591</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multitudo Gallorum, sensum omnem talis damni exsuperans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:24:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 24, 2</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">exsŭpĕrans</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">exup-</orth>), <itype>antis</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> (acc. to I. B.), <hi rend="ital">surpassing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excellent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">supreme</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">mulier exsuperanti forma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:6:8:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 6, 8, 3</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: uter esset exsuperantior,<cb n="EXTA" />  certabatur, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:14:3:11" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 14, 3, 11</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Dogm. Plat. 1, p. 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
exsurdo: <entryFree id="n17306" type="main" key="exsurdo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-surdo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">exurdo</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>surdus</etym>, <sense id="n17306.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to render deaf</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to deafen</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose). </sense><sense id="n17306.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">paniculae flos si aures intraverit, exsurdat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 10, 52, § 141</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17306.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n17306.3" n="1" level="3"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to stun</hi>, <hi rend="ital">overcome with din</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aures curiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:2:3" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 2, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turbida nec calamos exsurdant classica nostros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0830,001:4:131" default="NO"><author>Calp.</author> Ecl. 4, 131</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17306.4" n="2" level="3"> Esp., of the taste, <hi rend="ital">to dull</hi>, <hi rend="ital">blunt</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vina palatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:8:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 8, 38</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exsurgo: <entryFree id="n17307" type="main" key="exsurgo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-surgo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">exurgo</orth>), <itype>surrexi, 3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> (archaic <sense id="n17307.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inf. pres. pass.</hi> exsurgier, Plaut. Ps. prol. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>), <hi rend="ital">to rise up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to get up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stand up</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n17307.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">a genibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:1:5:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 1, 5, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex insidiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:41:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 41, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in plantas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 111:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 111, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de nocte multa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi erit accubitum semel, Ne quoquam exsurgatis, donec, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:4:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 4, 4, 105</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">foras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 2, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum exsurgeret, simul arridens, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:62:265" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 62, 265</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu autem, nisi molestum est, paulisper exsurge,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:60:168" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 60, 168</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">exsurge quaeso,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:42:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 42, 102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acies ita instructa, ut pars in colles exsurgeret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">altior (to strike the more forcibly),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:697" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 697</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n17307.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of things as subjects: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi Taurus ab Indico mari exsurgit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 27, 27, § 97</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:275" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 275</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">inde alii ramuli exsurgunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:173" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 19, 113, § 173</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum jam vertigine tectum ambulat, et geminis exsurgat mensa lucernis, i. e. in the dizzy brain,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:305" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 305</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17307.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to rise up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">recover strength</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne quando recreata exsurgere atque erigere se possent, funditus sustulerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:32:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 32, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(causa) numquam exsurgeret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:18:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 13, 18, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auctoritate vestra res publica exsurget,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 12, 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">grandis oratio naturali pulchritudine exsurgit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 2, 6</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">dolor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Med. 49" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Med. 49</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exsurrectio: <entryFree id="n17308" type="main" key="exsurrectio"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exsurrectio</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>exsurgo</etym>, <sense id="n17308.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an arising</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> 4</bibl> Esdr. 16, 71.</sense></entryFree>
exsuscitatio: <entryFree id="n17309" type="main" key="exsusci^ta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exsuscĭtātĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">exusc-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>exsuscito</etym>, <sense id="n17309.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an awakening</hi>, <hi rend="ital">arousing</hi>, as a fig. of speech, <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 42, 55</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 43, 56</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
exsuscito: <entryFree id="n17310" type="main" key="exsusci^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-suscĭto</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">exusc-</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n17310.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to rouse from sleep</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to awaken</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n17310.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">exsuscitate vostram huc custodem mihi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:1:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 1, 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">te gallorum cantus exsuscitat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:9:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 9, 22</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17310.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of fire, <hi rend="ital">to kindle</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">flammas exsuscitat aurā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:507" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 507</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne parvus ignis ingens incendium exsuscitet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 3, 6</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n17310.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to stir up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rouse up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excite</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae cura exsuscitat animos et majores ad rem gerendam facit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:4:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 4, 12</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">animum omnibus dictis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:15:49" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 15, 49</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">animum clamore,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 3, 12, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">naturalem memoriam hac notatione,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 21, 34</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 3, 22, 36</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
exta: <entryFree id="n17311" type="main" key="exta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exta</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype> (<sense id="n17311.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> extūm, Pac. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:46:155" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 46, 155</bibl>.—Also EXTAE, ārum, Inscr. Fratr. Arv. ap. Marin. Tab. 41, 19; Tab. 42, 12; Tab. 43, 22), <gen>n.</gen> <etym><hi rend="ital">sup.</hi> form for ecista (exista); cf.: exterus, extra; prop., <hi rend="ital">the most prominent</hi> of the internal organs, hence</etym>, <hi rend="ital">the nobler internal organs of the body</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the inwards</hi>, as the heart, lungs, liver, <hi rend="ital">the organs from the appearance of which in the victim the haruspices drew their prognostications</hi> (but <hi rend="ital">viscera</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the entrails</hi>, in gen. includes also the stomach, intestines, etc.): <cit><quote lang="la">alios enim alio more videmus exta interpretari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:12:28" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 12, 28</bibl></cit> (v. the whole passage): <cit><quote lang="la">exta homini ab inferiore viscerum parte separantur membrana,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:197" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 77, § 197</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:56" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 5, 14, § 56</bibl>: EXTA PORRICIUNTO, dies danto in altaria aramve focumve eove, quo exta dari debebunt, Veran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 3, 2</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:29" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 29 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:23:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 23, 8</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">dare Jovi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:57:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 57, 4</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which: reddere Marti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:194" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 194</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per exta inventa praesensio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:20:77 al" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Top. 20, 77 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exta consuluit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,053:21:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Ezech. 21, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">abducunt me ad exta,</quote> <trans><tr>to the sacrificial meal</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 117</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
extabesco: <entryFree id="n17312" type="main" key="exta_besco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-tābesco</orth>, <itype>bŭi, 3</itype>, <sense id="n17312.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to pass away completely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to vanish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disappear.</hi> </sense><sense id="n17312.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: refugere oculi: corpus macie extabuit, Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:12:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 12, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">is fame extabuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:7" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Thren. 4, 9</bibl>.— * </sense><sense id="n17312.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">videmus ceteras opiniones fictas atque vanas diuturnitate extabuisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:2:5" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 2, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
extaediatus: <entryFree id="n17313" type="main" key="extaedi^a_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-taedĭātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>extaedio</etym>, <sense id="n17313.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">worn out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">utterly wearied</hi>, [Hilar.] Anon. in Job, 3, p. 232. <cb n="EXTE" /></sense></entryFree>
extalis: <entryFree id="n17314" type="main" key="exta_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">extālis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>exta</etym>, <sense id="n17314.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the straight gut</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rectum</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 5, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,011:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Reg. 5, 9</bibl> al.</sense></entryFree>
extantia: <entryFree id="n17315" type="main" key="extantia"><orth extent="full" lang="la">extantia</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, v. exstantia.</entryFree>
extaris: <entryFree id="n17316" type="main" key="exta_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">extāris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>exta</etym>, <sense id="n17316.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the entrails</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">aula (i. e. olla),</quote> <trans><tr>for cooking entrails</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:1:2:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 1, 2, 47</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
extasis: <entryFree id="n17317" type="main" key="extasis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">extasis</orth>, v. exstasis.</entryFree>
extemplo: <entryFree id="n17318" type="main" key="extemplo_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">extemplō</orth> (original uncontracted form <orth extent="full" lang="la">extempŭlo</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:1:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 1, 2, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:1:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cist. 1, 1, 98</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 3, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:9:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 4, 9, 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:5:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 2, 5, 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:1:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 1, 1, 55</bibl>), <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>from ex and tempulum, <lbl>dim.</lbl> of templum, in a moment, an instant; hence, like ex tempore</etym>, <sense id="n17318.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">immediately</hi>, <hi rend="ital">straightway</hi>, <hi rend="ital">forthwith</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quickly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">without delay</hi> (mostly ante-class. and post-Aug.; in Plaut. more than sixty times; only once in Cic.; not in Caes. or Quint.; syn.: repente, subito, statim, continuo). </sense><sense id="n17318.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: verrunt extemplo placidum mare, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:26" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 26</bibl> (Ann. v. 377 ed. Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">extemplo me necato et filiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:in Varr. L. L. 7:section=13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> in Varr. L. L. 7, § 13</bibl></cit> Müll.; <cit><quote lang="la">Trag. v. 234 ed. Vahl.): quin occidisti extemplo?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 3, 6, 3</bibl></cit>: erubescit: quid respondeat nescit: quid fingat extemplo non habet, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 3, 8</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">alii gerendum (bellum) extemplo, antequam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec extemplo in invidiam, mox etiam in perniciem verterunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:48:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 39, 48, 1</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so with mox and postremo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:48:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 40, 48, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dixit et extemplo sensit, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:376" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 376</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n17318.2" n="II" level="1"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n17318.3" n="A" level="2"> Corresp. to the temporal and conditional particles ubi, ut, cum, quando, postquam, si.—With <hi rend="ital">ubi</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">eaque extemplo, ubi, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:1:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 1, 80</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:4:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 3, 4, 27</bibl>; Caecil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:23:13" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 23, 13</bibl>. —With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">utque impulit (Turnus) arma: Extemplo turbati animi, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 3</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:55:9" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 55, 9</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">cum</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ... extemplo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:16:8" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 16, 8</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">quando</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">adambulabo ad ostium, ut, quando exeat, Extemplo, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 5, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">postquam introii, extemplo ejus morbum cognovi miser,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 3, 3, 13</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">si</hi>: si umquam ... extemplo, etc., Naev. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:19:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 19, 6</bibl>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 52</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:3:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 2, 3, 74</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:1:24 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 1, 1, 24 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n17318.4" n="B" level="2"> In Plaut. repeatedly: quom (or quoniam) extemplo = <foreign lang="greek">e)pei\ ta/xista</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">as soon as</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aedes quom extemplo sunt paratae ... laudant fabrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 2, 18</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 2, 2, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:2:3:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 2, 3, 70</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:3:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 3, 2, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quom extemplo ad forum advenero, omnes loquentur, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 4, 2, 6</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:2:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 3, 2, 99</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n17318.5" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">At once</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">at first</hi> = primum (very rare), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:12:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 12, 6</bibl> Weissenb. ad loc.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,003:2:88" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Ach. 2, 88</bibl>.—See Hand, Turs. II. pp. 669- 674.</sense></entryFree>
extemporalis: <entryFree id="n17319" type="main" key="extempo^ra_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">extempŏrālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ex tempore, v. tempus, C.</etym>, <sense id="n17319.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">on the spur of the moment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">without preparation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extempore</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extemporary</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extemporaneous</hi> (post-Aug.; <cit><quote lang="la">in Cic.: subitus, fortuitus): oratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:1:54" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 1, 54</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:3" default="NO">11, 2, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dictiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:4:27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 4, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">actio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:7:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 7, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">garrulitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:4:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 4, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facilitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:7:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 7, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">temeritas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:6:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 6, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">audacia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facultas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:84" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">color,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:6:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 6, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">figurae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:20:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 20, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortuna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:6:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">successus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:7:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 7, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rhetor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:54" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contenti extemporali cibo,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>that easily provided</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 4, 6</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">extempŏrālĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">extemporaneously</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the moment</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">scribere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 9, 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
extemporalitas: <entryFree id="n17320" type="hapax" key="extempo^ra_li^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">extempŏrālĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>extemporalis</etym>, <sense id="n17320.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the faculty of extemporaneous speaking</hi> or <hi rend="ital">versifying</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tit.:3" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tit. 3</bibl> (for which: <cit><quote lang="la">extemporalis facultas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:84" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facultas ex tempore dicendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:7:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 7, 1</bibl></cit>).</sense></entryFree>
extemporaliter: <entryFree id="n17321" type="main" key="extempo^ra_li^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">extempŏrālĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. extemporalis <sense id="n17321.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
extempulo: <entryFree id="n17322" type="main" key="extempu^lo_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">extempŭlō</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. extemplo.</entryFree>
extendo: <entryFree id="n17323" type="main" key="extendo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-tendo</orth>, <itype>di, tum</itype> (also extensum, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 47, 145</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:302" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 302</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:902 al" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 902 al.</bibl>; cf. the forms extensio, extensor, etc.), <itype>3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n17323.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to stretch out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spread outextend</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n17323.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">(vincla escaria) quam magis extendas, tanto astringunt artius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 1, 1, 19</bibl></cit>: idem Crassus, <hi rend="ital">Per tuas statuas</hi> cum dixit et extento bracchio paululum etiam de gestu addidit, vehementius risimus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:59:242" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 59, 242</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which: (Zeno) cum extensis digitis adversam manum ostenderet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 47, 145</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:119" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 119</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 23 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cervicem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:70:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 70, 2</bibl></cit>: crura ad <pb n="707" /> <cb n="EXTE" /> longitudinem, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:183" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 64, 84, § 183</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cutem,</quote> <trans><tr>to stretch out</tr>, <tr>smooth out</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 32, 6, 21, § 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">chartam malleo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 13, 12, 26, § 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lineam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:182" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 59, 85, § 182</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">capita tignorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 9, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cornua aciei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:13" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 13 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">agmen ad mare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">majores pennas nido,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 20, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">extendit pectitque comas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:496" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 496</bibl></cit>: labellum, <hi rend="ital">to stretch</hi> as in pouting, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:325" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 14, 325</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">gladios,</quote> <trans><tr>to forge</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:15:168" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 15, 168</bibl></cit>.—Mid.: <cit><quote lang="la">jussit et extendi campos, subsidere valles,</quote> <trans><tr>to extend themselves</tr>, <tr>spread out</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignis extenditur per campos,</quote> <trans><tr>spreads</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:407" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 407</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ad summum palum vitis extenta est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:20:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 20, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fusus humi totoque ingens extenditur antro,</quote> <trans><tr>stretches himself out</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:423" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 423</bibl></cit>.—Prov.: ire per extentum funem, <hi rend="ital">to walk on a tight rope</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to perform a very difficult feat</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 210</bibl> (Gr. <foreign lang="greek">e)pi\ sxoini/ou peripatei=n</foreign>).</sense><sense id="n17323.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to extend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">increase</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enlarge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lengthen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spread.</hi> </sense><sense id="n17323.3" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">epistolam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:5:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 5, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agros (populus Rom. victor),</quote> <trans><tr>to extend</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:208" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 208</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba (opp. corripere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:29" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perculit et multa moribundum extendit arenā,</quote> <trans><tr>stretched out</tr>, <tr>extended</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:374" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 374</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">9, 589</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tam immodice epistulam extendi, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:9:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 9, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:5:20" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 5, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:15:7" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 15, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">famam factis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:468" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 468</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nomen in ultimas oras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:3:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 3, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cupiditatem gloriae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:43:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 43, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spem in Africam quoque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:48:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 48, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">artem suam per hanc successionem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 140</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pretia usque eo extendens, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:38" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">extentis itineribus,</quote> <trans><tr>by forced marches</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:19:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 19, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cursus,</quote> <trans><tr>to proceed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:909" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 909</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">partitionem ultra tres propositiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:5:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">voluntatem suam ad ulteriores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:32:1:33" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 32, 1, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">officium suum ad lapidum venditionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:20:4:21" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 20, 4, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum se magnis itineribus extenderet,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>was exerting himself</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 77 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se supra vires,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:4:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 4, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magis ille extenditur,</quote> <trans><tr>is excited</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:169" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 169</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n17323.4" n="B" level="2"> In partic., of time, <hi rend="ital">to extend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prolong</hi>, <hi rend="ital">continue; to spend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pass</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab hora tertia cum ad noctem pugnam extendissent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">comissationes ad mediam noctem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tit.:7" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tit. 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">labores in horam quintam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:8:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 8, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">luctus suos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:1:1:15" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 1, 1, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">curas venientem in annum,</quote> <trans><tr>extends his thoughts to the coming year</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:405" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 405</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempus epularum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:49:5" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 49, 5</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">consulatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 61:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 61, 6</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">extento aevo vivere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 2, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:95" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 95</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">suam aetatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:3:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 3, 3, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se ad centesimum annum, i. e. vitam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:5:2" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 5, 2</bibl></cit> ext. 4.— Hence, </sense><sense id="n17323.5" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">extentus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">extended</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extensive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wide</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mare, fontes extentaque longe flumina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:230" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 230</bibl></cit> Lachm. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi> (al. externa): <cit><quote lang="la">stagna latius Lucrino lacu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:15:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 15, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculi,</quote> <trans><tr>wide open</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:76" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sonus (lusciniae),</quote> <trans><tr>drawn out</tr>, <tr>prolonged</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 29, 43, § 82</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">castra inter confragosa omnia praeruptaque quam extentissima potest valle locat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:32:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 32, 9</bibl></cit> Drak. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">spatia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 52</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-tente</orth>, <hi rend="ital">widely;</hi> only <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quadratus eminet stilus extentius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 23, 4, 2</bibl></cit> (dub.): <cit><quote lang="la">porrecto extentius brachio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 18, 6, 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17323.6" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">extense</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">at length</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extensively</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">dominus extensius ista disponit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Idol. 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
extense: <entryFree id="n17324" type="main" key="extense_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">extensē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. extendo <sense id="n17324.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> 2.</sense></entryFree>
extensio: <entryFree id="n17325" type="main" key="extensi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">extensĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>extendo</etym>. <sense id="n17325.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A stretching out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extension.</hi> </sense><sense id="n17325.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">chordarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 3, 15, 1</bibl></cit>.—Esp. of the body or limbs: <cit><quote lang="la">corporum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 3:6:63" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 3, 6, 63</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 2:1:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tard. 2, 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:3" default="NO">3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:14" default="NO">14</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">16: crurum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:ib. 2:1:44" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 1, 44</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">alarum,</quote> <trans><tr>a spreading</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:8:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 8, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">membranae (in a water-fowl's foot),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Hexaem. 5, 22, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">follis nostri corporei,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> in Psa. 149</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17325.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n17325.3" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">A swelling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tumor</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">extensiones et tubercula in dorso,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 3, 15, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17325.4" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">An extension</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extended space</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">caelorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Isa. 12, 44, § 24</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17325.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a strain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stretching</hi>: mentis = <foreign lang="greek">e)/kstasis</foreign>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">fury</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 1:5:150" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 1, 5, 150</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
extensipes: <entryFree id="n17326" type="hapax" key="extensi^pes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">extensĭpes</orth>, <itype>pĕdis</itype>, <sense id="n17326.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">another name for</hi> molossus, <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 475</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
extensivus: <entryFree id="n17327" type="main" key="extensi_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">extensīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>extensus, from extendo</etym>, <sense id="n17327.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">extensive</hi> or <hi rend="ital">what may be extended</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">cum verba extensiva sint, poenitentia ejus usque ad annum admittenda est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:17:6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 38, 17, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
