extensor: <entryFree id="n17328" type="main" key="extensor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">extensor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>extendo</etym>, <sense id="n17328.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">he who</hi> <cb n="EXTE" /> <hi rend="ital">stretches</hi> (i. e. upon the rack), <hi rend="ital">a torturer</hi>, Ambros. de Jac. et Vit. Beat. 2, 10, 44.</sense></entryFree>
extensus: <entryFree id="n17329" type="main" key="extensus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">extensus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from extendo.</entryFree>
extente: <entryFree id="n17330" type="main" key="extente_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">extentē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <sense id="n17330.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">widely;</hi> v. extendo, <hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi> 1.</sense></entryFree>
extentio: <entryFree id="n17331" type="main" key="extenti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">extentĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>extendo</etym>, <sense id="n17331.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a stretching out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extension</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">capitis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Theod. Prisc.</author> 2, 1, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7</bibl>, praef. § 11.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:9:1:13 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 9, 1, 13 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
extento: <entryFree id="n17332" type="main" key="extento"><orth extent="full" lang="la">extento</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n17332.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to stretch out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extend</hi> (ante- and post-class.). </sense><sense id="n17332.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">nervos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:490" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 490</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">humeros angustos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 22, 14</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17332.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">vires alieno ostio,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to exert</tr>, <tr>try</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid tu venisti huc te extentatum?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:1:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 3, 1, 66</bibl></cit>, v. Ritschl ad h. l.</sense></entryFree>
extentus: <entryFree id="n17333" type="main" key="extentus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">extentus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from extendo.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n17334" type="hapax" key="extentus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">extentus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>extendo</etym>, <sense id="n17334.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a stretching out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extending</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extent</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">laterum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:619" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 4, 619</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
extenuatio: <entryFree id="n17335" type="main" key="exte^nu^a_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">extĕnŭātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>extenuo</etym>, <sense id="n17335.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a thinning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rarefaction.</hi> </sense><sense id="n17335.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:246" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 26, 39, § 246</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 2:57:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 2, 57, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n17335.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a lessening</hi>, <hi rend="ital">diminution</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extenuation</hi>, as a figure of speech, the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">mei/wsis</foreign> or <foreign lang="greek">e)la/ttwsis</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:53:202" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 53, 202</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:1:28" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 1, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:3" default="NO">9, 2, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
extenuatorius: <entryFree id="n17336" type="main" key="exte^nu^a_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">extĕnŭātōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n17336.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">attenuating</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">virtus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Theod. Prisc.</author> de Diaet. 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
extenuatus: <entryFree id="n17337" type="main" key="exte^nu^a_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">extĕnŭātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from extenuo.</entryFree>
extenuo: <entryFree id="n17338" type="main" key="exte^nu^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-tĕnŭo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n17338.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make thin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fine</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">small</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to thin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reduce</hi>, <hi rend="ital">diminish</hi> (class.; syn.: attenuo, minuo; opp. augeo, amplifico). </sense><sense id="n17338.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">lignum falce,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:40:6" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 40, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aër extenuatus sublime fertur,</quote> <trans><tr>rarefied</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:39:101" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 39, 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dentibus extenuatur et molitur cibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 54, 134</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in pulverem extenuari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 16, 43, § 148</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in aquas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:429" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 429</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mediam aciem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:38:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 38, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:21:14" default="NO" valid="yes">31, 21, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Piceno lapidibus pluisse et Caere sortes extenuatas,</quote> <trans><tr>diminished</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:62:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 62, 5</bibl></cit> Drak. (for which, shortly after: attenuatae sortes; cf. also <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 1, 11</bibl>).—</sense><sense id="n17338.2" n="B" level="2"> In partic., in medic. lang., <hi rend="ital">to diminish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reduce</hi>, <hi rend="ital">weaken</hi>, <hi rend="ital">alleviate</hi> a disease: <cit><quote lang="la">pituitam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:6:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 6, 6, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">destillationes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:155" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 21, 89, § 155</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">albugines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 29, 6, 38, § 127</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">raucitatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 20, 6, 23, § 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scabiem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 32, 10, 51, § 140</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n17338.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to diminish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lessen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">weaken</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque verbis auget suum munus, sed etiam extenuat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:20:70" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 20, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">locupletissimi cujusque census extenuarant, tenuissimi auxerant,</quote> <trans><tr>had made too small</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:55:section=138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 55, § 138</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spes nostra extenuatur et evanescit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:3:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 3, 13, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae cogitatio molestias extenuat et diluit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:16:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 16, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crimen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:40:section=108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 40, § 108</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">famam belli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:37:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 37, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">extenua forti mala corde ferendo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:3:57" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 3, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">curas mora longa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:3:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 1, 3, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vires,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:10:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 10, 14</bibl></cit> et saep.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">extĕnŭātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">thinned</hi>, <hi rend="ital">weakened</hi>, <hi rend="ital">weak.</hi> </sense><sense id="n17338.4" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: (copiolae meae) sunt extenuatissimae, <hi rend="ital">very much thinned</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reduced</hi>, Brut. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 13, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n17338.5" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ratio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 24, 37</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exter: <entryFree id="n17339" type="main" key="exter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exter</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">extĕrus</orth> (both forms only post-class. and very rare), <itype>tĕra, tĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym><hi rend="ital">comp.</hi> form, from ex</etym>, <sense id="n17339.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">on the outside</hi>, <hi rend="ital">outward</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of another country</hi>, <hi rend="ital">family</hi>, etc., <hi rend="ital">foreign</hi>, <hi rend="ital">strange</hi> (syn.: extraneus; alienus, peregrinus, adventicius). </sense><sense id="n17339.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Pos.</hi> (in Cic. and Caes. used in the <number>plur.</number>): <cit><quote lang="la">quod exter heres praestare cogeretur,</quote> <trans><tr>strange</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:31:1:69" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 31, 1, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">emancipatus vero aut exterus non aliter possunt hereditatem quaerere quam si, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:29:2:84" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 29, 2, 84</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:31:1:67:section=4" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 31, 1, 67, § 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tactus corporis est sensus, vel cum res extera sese Insinuat, vel, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:435" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 435</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:277" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 277</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec lex socialis est, hoc jus nationum exterarum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:5:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Div. in Caecil. 5, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exterarum gentium multitudo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:84" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non modo vestris civibus, verum etiam exteris nationibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:11:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Font. 11, 25</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">apud exteras civitates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:34:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 34, 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apud exteras nationes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 43 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">ad nationes exteras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:89" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apud exteros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 3, 5, § 22</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">ab extero hoste atque longinquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 2, 13</bibl></cit>.—In <hi rend="ital">neutr. plur.</hi> with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad extera Europae noscenda missus Himilco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:169" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 67, 67, § 169</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad extera corporum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 23, 49, § 103</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17339.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">extĕrĭor</orth>, <itype>us</itype> (in signif. scarcely differing from its <hi rend="ital">pos.</hi>), <hi rend="ital">outward</hi>,<cb n="EXTE" />  <hi rend="ital">outer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exterior;</hi> opp. interior (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">cum alterum fecisset exteriorem, interiorem alterum amplexus orbem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=7" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 7</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">simul ex navibus milites in exteriorem vallum tela jaciebant ... et legionarii, interioris munitionis defensores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:63:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 63, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">colle exteriore occupato,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:79:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 7, 79, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">circumire exteriores mutiones jubet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 87, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pares munitiones contra exteriorem hostem perfecit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">comes exterior,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>on the left side</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:5:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 5, 17</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17339.3" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi> in two forms, extrēmus and extĭmus or extŭmus [<hi rend="ital">sup.</hi> of ex; cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">e)/sxatos</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:Gr. Etym. p. 387" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> Gr. Etym. p. 387</bibl>]. </sense><sense id="n17339.4" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">extrēmus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype> (which in post-class. lang. is itself compared; <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">extremior,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 105</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">7</bibl>, p. 188; <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">extremissimus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 19</bibl></cit>), <hi rend="ital">the outermost</hi>, <hi rend="ital">utmost</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extreme</hi> (so most freq.; cf.: ultimus, postremus, novissimus, supremus, imus). </sense><sense id="n17339.5" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">extremum oppidum Allobrogum est Geneva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 6, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flumen Axona, quod est in extremis Remorum finibus,</quote> <trans><tr>on the farthest borders</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 5, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:28:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 28, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:29:14" default="NO" valid="yes">45, 29, 14</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ad extremum finem provinciae Galliae venerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:16:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 40, 16, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">impiger extremos currit mercator ad Indos,</quote> <trans><tr>the remotest</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tanaïs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 3, 10, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in extrema fere parte epistolae,</quote> <trans><tr>near the end</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 1, 20</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in codicis extrema cera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:36:section=92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 36, § 92</bibl></cit>; but to denote <hi rend="ital">the last part</hi> of a thing it is used more freq. in immediate connection with the substantive denoting the whole: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus (litteris) in extremis,</quote> <trans><tr>at its end</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 14, 8, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in qua (epistola) extrema,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 45, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in extremo libro tertio,</quote> <trans><tr>at the end of the third book</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:2:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in extrema oratione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:10:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 10, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in extremo ponte turrim constituit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:29:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 29, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ad extremas fossas castella constituit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 8, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab extremo agmine,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 11, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in extrema Cappadocia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 15, 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">extremis digitis aliquid attingere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:12:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 12, 28</bibl></cit> et saep. —In the <hi rend="ital">neutr. absol.</hi> and as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">extrē-mum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">an end</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the end</hi>: divitias alii praeponunt, alii honores, multi etiam voluptates; <cit><quote lang="la">beluarum hoc quidem extremum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:6:20" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 6, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod finitum est, habet extremum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:50:103" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 50, 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">missile telum hastili abiegno et cetera tereti, praeterquam ad extremum,</quote> <trans><tr>at the end</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:8:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 8, 10</bibl></cit>: in "Equo Trojano" scis esse in extremo "sero sapiunt," <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:16:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 16, 1</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quod erat in extremo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 6, 9, 1</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid ad extremum causae reservatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:13:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Deiot. 13, 35</bibl></cit> (cf. infra, 2. a. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">caelum ipsum, quod extremum atque ultumum mundi est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:43:91" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 43, 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab Ocelo, quod est citerioris provinciae extremum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:10:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 10, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">summum gulae fauces vocantur, extremum stomachus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:179" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 68, § 179</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in extremo montis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 37:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 37, 4</bibl></cit>.— In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">extrema agminis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:32:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 32, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">extrema Africae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 10, 10, § 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">extrema Galliae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:3:1" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 3, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:20:12" default="NO">3, 20, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:5:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 5, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 4, 67</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 74</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n17339.6" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n17339.7" n="a" level="4"> In respect to time or the order of succession, <hi rend="ital">the latest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">last</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter prioris mensis senescentis extremum diem et novam lunam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=10" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 10</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">mensis anni Februarius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:21:54" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 21, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempore diei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:15:6" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 15, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eam amicitiam ad extremum finem vitae perduxit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:53:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 53, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">matres ab extremo conspectu liberorum exclusae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:45:section=118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 45, § 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus extrema non accessit operibus ejus,</quote> <trans><tr>the finishing hand</tr>, <tr>the last touches</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:33:126" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 33, 126</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">extremum illud est, ut te orem et obsecrem,</quote> <trans><tr>it remains only</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:13:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 4, 13, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:11:16:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 11, 16, 5</bibl>.—To denote the <hi rend="ital">last part</hi> of a thing (cf. above, 1.): quod eo die potest videri extrema et prima luna, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the end and the beginning</hi>, Varr. L. L. l. l.: <cit><quote lang="la">usque ad extremam aetatem ab adolescentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Cato, 2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Cato, 2, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 10, 3</bibl>; cf.: ita tantum bellum Cn. Pompeius extrema hieme apparavit, ineunte vere suscepit, media aestate confecit, Cic. de lmp. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1321,001:12:35" default="NO"><author>Pomp.</author> 12, 35</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">extremo anno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:64:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 64, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">extremo tempore,</quote> <trans><tr>in the last time</tr>, <tr>at last</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,014:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dat. 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Epam. 9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Epam. 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:5:3 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eum. 5, 3 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">extrema pueritia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Imp. Pomp. 10, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">extremo Peloponnesio bello,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,009:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Con. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: extremus dies, <hi rend="ital">the close of day</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the evening</hi>, Sil 7, 172; 14, 8.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">illum Praeteritum temnens extremos inter euntem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 116</bibl></cit>; cf.: extremi primorum, extremis <pb n="708" /> <cb n="EXTE" /> usque priores, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 204</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">extremus dominorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 42 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">die extremum erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 21:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 21, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">extremum aestatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 90:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 90, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">extremo anni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 11, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub extremum noctis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:88 al" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 4, 88 al.</bibl></cit>—Prov.: extrema semper de ante factis judicant (cf. our <hi rend="ital">wise after the event</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0622,001:163" default="NO"><author>Pub. Syr.</author> 163</bibl> Rib.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">extremum</orth>. </sense><sense id="n17339.8" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">For the last time</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">alloquor extremum maestos abiturus amicos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:3:15" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 3, 15</bibl></cit>: cum diu occulte suspirassent, postea jam gemere, ad extremum vero loqui omnes et clamare coeperunt.—</sense><sense id="n17339.9" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">At last</hi>, <hi rend="ital">finally</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:21:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 21, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">extremum tenues liquefacta medullas Tabuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:431" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 431</bibl></cit>.—Adverb. phrase: <cit><quote lang="la">ad extremum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Phil. 13, 20, 45</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 4, 2</bibl> et saep.; cf., strengthened by <hi rend="ital">tum</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">invenire quod dicas ... deinde ... post ... tum ad extremum agere ac pronuntiare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:19:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 19, 79</bibl></cit>; and strengthened by <hi rend="ital">denique</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad extremum ipsa denique necessitate excitantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:47:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 47, 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">decimo loco testis exspectatus et ad extremum reservatus dixit, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>till the end</tr>, <tr>to the last</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:10:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 10, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad extremum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:9:28" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 1, 9, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 7, 20</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which: in extremum (durare),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:7:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 7, 111</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui extremo mortuus est,</quote> <trans><tr>at last</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:32:1:81" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 32, 1, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">extremo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,022:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Ham. 2, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17339.10" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Extreme</hi> in quality or degree; used, like ultimus, to denote both the highest and the lowest grade. </sense><sense id="n17339.11" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">The utmost</hi>, <hi rend="ital">highest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">greatest</hi>: cum extremum hoc sit (sentis enim, credo, me jam diu, quod <foreign lang="greek">te/los</foreign> Graeci dicunt, id dicere tum extremum, tum ultimum, tum summum: <cit><quote lang="la">licebit etiam finem pro extremo aut ultimo dicere) cum igitur hoc sit extremum, congruenter naturae vivere, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:7:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 7, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">extremam famem sustentare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:17:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 17, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad extrema et inimicissima jura tam cupide decurrebas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 15, 48</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">decurritur ad illud extremum atque ultimum S. C., Dent operam consules, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">extremam rationem belli sequens,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 44, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque aliud se fatigando nisi odium quaerere, extremae dementiae est,</quote> <trans><tr>is the height of madness</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in extremis suis rebus,</quote> <trans><tr>in the utmost</tr>, <tr>greatest danger</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 25 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:6" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">res jam ad extremum perducta casum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">necessitate extrema ad mortem agi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 1</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: si nihil in Lepido spei sit, descensurum ad extrema, <hi rend="ital">to desperate measures</hi>, Pollio ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:33:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 33, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad extrema perventum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:14:14" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 14, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad extrema ventum foret, ni, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:47:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 47, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">compellere ad extrema deditionis,</quote> <trans><tr>to surrender at discretion</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:5" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 5</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">famem, ferrum et extrema pati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plura de extremis loqui,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 47</bibl></cit> al.: <cit><quote lang="la">res publica in extremo sita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 52:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 52, 11</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">Sen. de Ira, 1, 11, 5.—Adverb.: improbus homo, sed non ad extremum perditus,</quote> <trans><tr>utterly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 2, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17339.12" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">The lowest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vilest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">meanest</hi> (perh. not ante-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">mancipia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 70" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 70 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">latrones,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 3, p. 131</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quidam sortis extremae juvenis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:15:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 15, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alimenta vitae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">extremi ingenii est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:29:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 29, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17339.13" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">extĭmus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">extŭmus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">the outermost</hi>, <hi rend="ital">farthest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">most remote</hi> (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">novem orbes, quorum unus est caelestis, extimus, qui reliquos omnes complectitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:17" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">circum caesura membrorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:219" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 219</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:647" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 647</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">promontorium Oceani,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 1, 1, § 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:190" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 78, 80, § 190</bibl></cit>: factus sum extimus a vobis, i. e. <hi rend="ital">discarded</hi>, <hi rend="ital">estranged</hi>, Plaut. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 609</bibl> P.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Apuliae extima,</quote> <trans><tr>the borders</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:217" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 34, 39, § 217</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exterebro: <entryFree id="n17340" type="main" key="exte^re^bro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-tĕrĕbro</orth>, no <sense id="n17340.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to extract by boring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to bore out</hi> (very rare). </sense><sense id="n17340.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex eo auro, quod exterebratum esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:24:48" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 24, 48</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17340.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to extort</hi>, <hi rend="ital">obtain by force</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">numquam hercle istuc exterebrabis tu, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:2:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 2, 2, 55</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
extergeo: <entryFree id="n17341" type="main" key="extergeo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-tergeo</orth>, <itype>si, sum</itype>, 2; also <orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-tergo</orth>, <itype>3</itype> (<sense id="n17341.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> extergere, <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Johan. 13, 5</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">praes.</hi> extergimus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:10:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Luc. 10, 11</bibl>: extergunt, id. Baruch, 6, 12; <hi rend="ital">praes. subj. pass.</hi> extergantur, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:7:12:section=22" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 33, 7, 12, § 22</bibl>), <pos>v. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to wipe out</hi> or <hi rend="ital">off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to wipe dry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wipe</hi> (mostly ante- and post-class.). </sense><sense id="n17341.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">extergeto spongia bene,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 162, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">columnas, pavimenta, podia spongiis, Dig. l. l.: coronas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">baxeas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:3:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 2, 3, 40</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:5:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 5, 2, 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">14</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 1, 3, 110</bibl></cit>: aera extersa rubiginem celerius <cb n="EXTE" /> trahunt, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 9, 21, § 99</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n17341.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to strip clean</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to plunder</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">o Verria praeclara! ... quod fanum non eversum atque extersum reliqueris?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 21 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
exterior: <entryFree id="n17342" type="main" key="exte^ri^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">extĕrĭor</orth>, <itype>us</itype>, v. exter, II.</entryFree>
exterius: <entryFree id="n17343" type="main" key="exte^ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">extĕrĭus</orth>. <sense id="n17343.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj. n.</hi>, v. exter, II.—</sense><sense id="n17343.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>, v. extra, I. A. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
extermentarium: <entryFree id="n17344" type="gloss" key="extermenta_rium"><orth extent="full" lang="la">extermentārium</orth> = linteum quod teritur corpore, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=21" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 21</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
exterminabilis: <entryFree id="n17345" type="main" key="extermi^na_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">extermĭnābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>extermino</etym>, <sense id="n17345.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that may be destroyed;</hi> hence, <hi rend="ital">temporal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perishable</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaestiones,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Hist. Trip. 9, 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exterminatio: <entryFree id="n17346" type="main" key="extermi^na_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">extermĭnātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n17346.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a destruction</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,033:18:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Sap. 18, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
exterminator: <entryFree id="n17347" type="main" key="extermi^na_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">extermĭnātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n17347.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an ejector</hi>, <hi rend="ital">expeller</hi>, <hi rend="ital">destroyer</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 108, 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,007:10:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Cor. 10, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
exterminium: <entryFree id="n17348" type="main" key="extermi^ni^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">extermĭnĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n17348.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a driving away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">expulsion</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">civitatis Jerusalem,</quote> <trans><tr>destruction</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Jud. 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Judith, 4, 10 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
extermino: <entryFree id="n17349" type="main" key="extermi^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-termĭno</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>terminus; qs. to drive beyond the boundaries; hence</etym>, <sense id="n17349.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to drive out</hi> or <hi rend="ital">away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to expel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exile</hi>, <hi rend="ital">banish</hi> (rare, save in Cic. and eccl. Lat.; syn.: expello, eicio, proicio, al.). </sense><sense id="n17349.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">C. Marcellum exterminandum ex illa urbe curavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 4, 9</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">haec tanta virtus (i. e. Milo) ex hac urbe expelletur, exterminabitur, proicietur?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:37:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 37, 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem ex hominum communitate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:6:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 6, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem de civitate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:22:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Balb. 22, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem a suis diis penatibus (with expellere a patria),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:13:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 13, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem urbe atque agro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:23:63" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 23, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">peregrinos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:11:47" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 11, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 3, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fucos in totum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:15:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 15, 2</bibl></cit>: herbam sulcis, id. poët. 10, 149.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi> in mid. force: <cit><quote lang="la">cubiculo protinus exterminatur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 125 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n17349.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to put away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">put aside</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remove</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">auctoritatem vestram e civitate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Prov. Cons. 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaestiones physicorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 41, 127</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic exterminatus animi atque attonitus,</quote> <trans><tr>deprived of senses</tr>, <tr>senseless</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 3, p. 138, 37</bibl></cit> Hildebr.—</sense><sense id="n17349.3" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To abolish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extirpate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">destroy</hi> (late Lat.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: exstirpo, deleo, etc.),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,033:16:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Sap. 16, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,027:11:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Apoc. 11, 18</bibl> et saep.</sense></entryFree>
exterminus: <entryFree id="n17350" type="hapax" key="extermi^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-termĭnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n17350.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">taking one's self off</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">atque hinc exterminus ito,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Carm. de Sodom. 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
externatus: <entryFree id="n17351" type="main" key="externa_tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">externātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <sense id="n17351.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">terrified;</hi> v. exsterno.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n17352" type="spur" key="externa_tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">externātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, false reading in <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 3, p. 138, 37</bibl>, instead of exterminatus).</entryFree>
externo: <entryFree id="n17353" type="main" key="externo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">externo</orth>, v. exsterno.</entryFree>
externus: <entryFree id="n17354" type="main" key="externus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">externus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>exter</etym>, <sense id="n17354.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">outward</hi>, <hi rend="ital">external</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n17354.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">nec enim ille externus et adventicius habendus est tepor, sed ex intimis maris partibus agitatione excitatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:10:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 10, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">externa et adventicia visio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:58:120" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 58, 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:11:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 11, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulsus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 6, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domina rerum externarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:9:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 9, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">commoda vel incommoda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:23:89" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Top. 23, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bona,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:3:35" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 2, 3, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vir rebus externis magis laudandus quam institutis domesticis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:28:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 28, 69</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">externi ne quid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 7, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nos autem illa externa cum multis: haec interiora cum paucis ex ipso saepe cognovimus,</quote> <trans><tr>outward goods</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 2, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17354.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., with respect to one's family or country, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to another country</hi>, <hi rend="ital">foreign</hi>, <hi rend="ital">strange</hi> (syn.: alienus, peregrinus; <cit><quote lang="la">opp. noster, domesticus, oppidanus, etc.): auxilia (opp. domesticae opes),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui (dii) jam non procul ab externo hoste atque propinquo, sed hic praesentes sua templa defendunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:13:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 2, 13, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostis (opp. oppidani),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:37:2" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 37, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">bella (opp. civilia),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:78" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque haec externa vobis est religio neque aliena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:51:section=114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 51, § 114</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">superstitiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam minime peregrina et externa verba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:1:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba (opp. nostra),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:58" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 5, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apud externos populos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:18:64" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 18, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:367" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 367</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in externis locis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gratiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mores,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 16</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">mutatio morum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:5" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amor,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>for a foreigner</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:5:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 5, 102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orbis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Asia and Africa</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 24, 56, § 118</bibl></cit> et saep.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi> in <hi rend="ital">masc.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">neutr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">canum tam amans dominorum adulatio tantumque odium in externos,</quote> <trans><tr>towards strangers</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:63:158" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 63, 158</bibl></cit>: externa libentius<cb n="EXTI" />  quam domestica recordor, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:8:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 8, 26</bibl>: externa armis falsis velare, <hi rend="ital">hostile feelings</hi> or <hi rend="ital">designs</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">moliri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
extero: <entryFree id="n17355" type="main" key="exte^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-tĕro</orth>, <itype>trīvi, trītum, 3</itype>, <sense id="n17355.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to rub out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bring out by rubbing; to remove by rubbing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to rub off</hi> or <hi rend="ital">away</hi> (rare; not in Cic.). </sense><sense id="n17355.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">extritus viribus ignis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1098" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1098</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jumentorum ungulis e spica exteruntur grana,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:52:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 52, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">messem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:298" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 30, 72, § 298</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:9:11" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 9, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">littera extrita,</quote> <trans><tr>elided</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=96" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 96</bibl></cit> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:1:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> R. R. 2, 1, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">gemma politur ex marmore, ut inutilia exterantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:172" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 62, § 172</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opus poliat lima, non exterat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:4:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rubiginem ferro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 6, 33, § 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">congestas exteret ille nives,</quote> <trans><tr>will tread down</tr>, <tr>crush</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:9:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 9, 12</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">anima hominis magno pondere extriti,</quote> <trans><tr>crushed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 57" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 57 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n17355.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to wear out by use</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to use up</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tabes mercium aut fraus Seplasiae sic exteritur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 11, 25, § 108</bibl></cit> Sillig (Jan. taxetur).</sense></entryFree>
exterraneus: <entryFree id="n17356" type="gloss" key="exterra_ne^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exterrānĕus</orth>, ex alia terra. Exter raneus quoque dicitur, qui ante tempus natus vel potius ejectus est. Dictus autem exterraneus, quod eum mater exterrita alvo ejecit, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=79:1 sq" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 79, 1 sq.</bibl> Müll.; cf.: exterraneus <foreign lang="greek">a)llo/fulos</foreign>, Gloss. Labb.</entryFree>
exterrenus: <entryFree id="n17357" type="gloss" key="exterre_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exterrēnus</orth>, <foreign lang="greek">a)po/dhmos</foreign>, Gloss. Labb.</entryFree>
exterreo: <entryFree id="n17358" type="main" key="exterre^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-terrĕo</orth>, <itype>ŭi, ĭtum, 2</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n17358.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to strike with terror</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to frighten</hi>, <hi rend="ital">affright</hi> (class.; in Cic. and Caes. only in the <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>): talia commemorat lacrimans, exterrita somno, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:20:40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 20, 40</bibl> (Ann. v. 37 ed. Vahl.); cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quo aspectu exterrita clamorem sustulit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:36:79" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 36, 79</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">improvisa simul species exterret utrumque,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 6, 11</bibl></cit> (K. and H.; but acc. to Jacobs, externat, i. e. exsternat; <cit><quote lang="la">see exsterno): repentino periculo exterriti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:75:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 75, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">repentino hostium incursu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 41, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vehementius exterreri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeter modum exterreri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:10:37" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 10, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legiones exterruit vultu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vi ac minis alares exterruit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">novitate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:1040" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 1040</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">timuitque exterrita pennis Ales,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:505" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 505</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">(anguis) exterritus aestu,</quote> <trans><tr>roused up</tr>, <tr>made wild</tr>.</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:434" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 434</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">exterritus Aruns laetitia mixtoque metu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 806</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
extersus: <entryFree id="n17359" type="main" key="extersus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">extersus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from extergeo.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n17360" type="main" key="extersus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">extersus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>extergeo</etym>, <sense id="n17360.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a rubbing dry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a rubbing down</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">linteum extersui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:4:4:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 4, 4, 20</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exterus: <entryFree id="n17361" type="main" key="exte^rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">extĕrus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. exter.</entryFree>
extexo: <entryFree id="n17362" type="hapax" key="extexo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-texo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>—<usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <sense id="n17362.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to unweave;</hi> hence trop., <hi rend="ital">to plunder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cheat of one's money</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">extexam ego illum pulcre jam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:2:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 2, 3, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
extillo: <entryFree id="n17363" type="main" key="extillo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">extillo</orth>, v. exstillo.</entryFree>
extimesco: <entryFree id="n17364" type="main" key="exti^mesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-tĭmesco</orth>, <itype>mŭi, 3</itype>, <sense id="n17364.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">a.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be greatly afraid of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to fear greatly; to await with fear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to dread</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n17364.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">equi ipsi gladiatorum repentinis sibilis extimescebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:59:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 59, 126</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">extimui illico,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:5:3:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 5, 3, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de fortunis communibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Deiot. 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne id jure evenerit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 38, 121</bibl></cit>; so with <hi rend="ital">ne</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:174" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 174</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass. impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si filius Arminii in regnum venisset, posse extimesci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 16</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17364.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">patrem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ter.</author> Ph. 1, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil est quod adventum nostrum extimescas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:26:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 26, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cerulas tuas miniatulas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 16, 11, 1</bibl></cit>: nullam rem aliam, Planc. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:18:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 18, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">magistrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:415" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 415</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec ob eam causam fatum aut necessitas extimescenda est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:12:28" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fat. 12, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">periculum ab aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:7:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 7, 1, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
extimulo: <entryFree id="n17365" type="main" key="exti^mu^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">extĭmŭlo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, v. exstimulo.</entryFree>
extimus: <entryFree id="n17366" type="main" key="exti^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">extĭmus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. exter, III. B.</entryFree>
extinctus: <entryFree id="n17367" type="main" key="extinctus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">extinctus</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">extinguo</orth>, etc., v. exstinctus, exstinguo, etc.</entryFree>
extirpo: <entryFree id="n17368" type="main" key="extirpo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">extirpo</orth>, v. exstirpo.</entryFree>
extispex: <entryFree id="n17369" type="main" key="extispex"><orth extent="full" lang="la">extispex</orth>, <itype>ĭcis</itype> (also post-class. ‡ <sense id="n17369.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">extispicus, i,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2302</bibl></cit>), <gen>m.</gen> <etym>exta-specio</etym>, <hi rend="ital">one who prophesies by inspecting the entrails of animals</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a diviner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">soothsayer</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">augur, auspex, haruspex, hariolus, vates),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:11:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 11, 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 18, 42</bibl>; Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 16, 14</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Gen. plur.</hi>: extispicium, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 16, 11</bibl> (R<bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> Trag. Rel. p. 190</bibl>): extispicum, Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:16:29" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 16, 29</bibl> (Trag. Rel. p. 247).</sense></entryFree>
extispicium: <entryFree id="n17370" type="main" key="extispi^ci^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">extispĭcĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>extispex</etym>, <sense id="n17370.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an inspection<pb n="709" /> <cb n="EXTO" />  of the entrails for the purpose of prophesying</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:56" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 56</bibl>; v. l. in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:203" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 56, 57, § 203</bibl> (Jan. auspicia).</sense></entryFree>
extispicus: <entryFree id="n17371" type="gloss" key="extispi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">extispĭcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. extispex <sense id="n17371.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
exto: <entryFree id="n17372" type="main" key="exto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exto</orth>, <itype>are</itype>, v. exsto.</entryFree>
extollentia: <entryFree id="n17373" type="main" key="extollenti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">extollentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>extollo</etym>, <sense id="n17373.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pride</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">oculorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Sirach, 23, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
extollo: <entryFree id="n17374" type="main" key="extollo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-tollo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype> (<sense id="n17374.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pluperf.</hi> exsustulissent, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 1:6:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 1, 6, 4</bibl>), <pos>v. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to lift out</hi> or <hi rend="ital">up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to raise up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">elevate</hi> (class.; esp. freq. in the trop. sense). </sense><sense id="n17374.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n17374.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: (venti) fluctus extollere certant, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 2</bibl> (Ann. v. 425 ed. Vahl.): me in abietem, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 467, 19</bibl> (R<bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> Trag. Rel. p. 188</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">onera in jumenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:10:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 10, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alte cruentum pugionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:12:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 12, 28</bibl></cit>: lumbos surgite atque extollite, Plaut. Ep. grex 2: neve tu umquam in gremium extollas liberorum ex te genus, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:46:155" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 46, 155</bibl> (Trag. v. 347 ed. Vahl.).— <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae sit scientia atque ars agricolarum quae circumcidat, amputet, erigat, extollat, adminiculetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:14:39" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 14, 39</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n17374.3" n="2" level="3"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to erect</hi> a building (anteand post-class.); without <case>acc.</case>, <hi rend="ital">to build</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:8:5:5" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 8, 5, 5</bibl>.—So trop.: <cit><quote lang="la">parentes fabri liberūm sunt, ei fundamentum supstruont liberorum, extollunt, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:2:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 2, 41</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n17374.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to raise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">elevate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exalt</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi illa antiqua libertas, quae extollere jam caput debebat?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:13:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 13, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortunam (opp. deprimere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:18:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 18, 41</bibl></cit> (v. deprimo): <cit><quote lang="la">inferiores (opp. summittere se),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:20:72" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 20, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem ad caelum,</quote> <trans><tr>to extol</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:25:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 12, 25, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem supra ceteros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 8</bibl></cit>: summam famam sibi, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Differ. 218</bibl> (Trag. v. 28 ed. Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">adolescentium animos praematuris honoribus ad superbiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne paterna nobilitas nepoti animos extolleret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:4:4" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 1, 4, 4</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">Sen. de Ira, 1, 7: meritum alicujus verbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:40:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 40, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nostram causam laudando,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 1, 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid in majus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 11, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">an mavis virtuperarier falso quam vero extolli?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 3, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hannibalis fortunam,</quote> <trans><tr>to praise</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:43:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 43, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostem verbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:25:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 25, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orationem amplificationibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:62" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 62</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">humilia (stilo),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:4:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:23:81" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Part. Or. 23, 81</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:8:345" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 8, 345</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus remissione sic urgetur, ut se nequeat extollere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:23:54" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 23, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se supra modum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:16" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vocem,</quote> <trans><tr>to begin to speak</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:11:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Luc. 11, 27</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17374.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To adorn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deck</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beautify</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(hortos) a Lucullo coeptos insigni magnificentia extollebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Baiarum suarum piscinas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 21</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17374.6" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To put off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">defer</hi> (only anteclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">res serias ex hoc die in alium diem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:2:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 2, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc malum in diem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:2:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 3, 2, 47</bibl></cit>: nuptias hodie, Caecil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 297, 28</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
extorpesco: <entryFree id="n17375" type="hapax" key="extorpesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-torpesco</orth>, <itype>pŭi, 3</itype>, <sense id="n17375.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to grow numb</hi> or <hi rend="ital">torpid</hi>, Venat. Vit. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:240" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 240</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
extorqueo: <entryFree id="n17376" type="main" key="extorque^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-torquĕo</orth>, <itype>si, tum, 2</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n17376.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to twist out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wrench out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wrest away</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n17376.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n17376.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">ferrum e manibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 2, 1, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:41:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 41, 98</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">arma e manibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:2:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 2, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:2:4" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 2, 4</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which: tibi sica de manibus extorta est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:6:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 6, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pedem mensulae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 136</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut inhaerentem atque incubantem Italiae extorqueret Hannibalem,</quote> <trans><tr>tear away</tr>, <tr>force away</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:6:57" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 6, 57</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17376.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n17376.4" n="1" level="3"> Of limbs, <hi rend="ital">to wrench out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">put out of joint</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dislocate</hi> (syn. luxo): <cit><quote lang="la">articulum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 104" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnibus membris extortus et fractus,</quote> <trans><tr>crippled</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:18:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 18, 9</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 66" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 66 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">prava extortaque puella,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:33" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in servilem modum lacerati atque extorti,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>dislocated by torture</tr>, <tr>tortured</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:38:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 38, 8</bibl></cit>; cf. <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">extorque, nisi ita factum'st,</quote> <trans><tr>put me to the torture</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:4:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 4, 37</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17376.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To obtain by force</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to extort</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">eripio, exprimo): ut pecunia omnis Stajeno extorta atque erepta sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:chapter=28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 28 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil exprimere ab egentibus, nihil ulla vi a miseris extorquere potuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Prov. Cons. 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vi et metu extortum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:35:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 35, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a Caesare per Herodem talenta Attica quinquaginta extorsistis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 6, 1, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obsidibus summa cum contumelia extortis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 54 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n17376.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to wrest out</hi> or <hi rend="ital">away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">obtain</hi> or <hi rend="ital">take away by force</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to tear away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to extort</hi> (syn.: eripio, demo, aufero, etc.): hoc est vim afferre, Torquate, sensibus: extorquere ex animis cognitiones <cb n="EXTR" /> verborum, quibus imbuti sumus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:5:16" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 5, 16</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sententias de manibus judicum vi quadam orationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:18:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 18, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suffragium populi per vim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">extorquebat enim vitam vis morbida membris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1225" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1225</bibl></cit> Lachm.: <cit><quote lang="la">opinionem veritas extorquebit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suam citius abiciet humanitatem quam extorquebit tuam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,033:5:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Lig. 5, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patientiam saepe tranquillissimis pectoribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Clem. 1:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Clem. 1, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi hunc errorem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 23, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui sic extorta voluptas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 139</bibl></cit>;
