cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 57</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum extorta mihi veritas esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:48:160" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 48, 160</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quoniam extorsisti, ut faterer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:7:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 7, 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
extorreo: <entryFree id="n17377" type="main" key="extorre^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-torrĕo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n17377.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to parch up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to scorch</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">si ardens febris extorret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 7, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
extorris: <entryFree id="n17378" type="main" key="extorris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">extorris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ex and terra</etym>, <sense id="n17378.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">driven out of the country</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exiled</hi>, <hi rend="ital">banished</hi> (class.; syn.: exsul, profugus, fugitivus, transfuga, desertor): hinc extorres profugerunt, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:51:section=120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 51, § 120</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">agere aliquem extorrem ab solo patrio ac diis Penatibus in hostium urbem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:30:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 30, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">extorris agro Romano,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:37:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 37, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">extorris patria, domo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 14:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 14, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agmen sedibus suis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:13:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 13, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">extorrem egentem perire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Nursini oppido,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:12" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agris et focis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:13:2" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 13, 2</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">brevi extorre hinc omne Punicum nomen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:41:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 41, 19</bibl></cit>: aliquem extorrem facere, Turp. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 14, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">is exsul extorrisque esto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:12:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 12, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
extorsio: <entryFree id="n17379" type="main" key="extorsi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">extorsĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>extorqueo</etym>, <sense id="n17379.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an extortion</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Matt. 8, 30</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">31</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
extortor: <entryFree id="n17380" type="main" key="extortor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">extortor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym><bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> I. B. 2</bibl>.</etym>, <sense id="n17380.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an extorter</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">bonorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ter.</author> Ph. 2, 3, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cypr.</author> Ep. 14, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
extortus: <entryFree id="n17381" type="main" key="extortus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">extortus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from extorqueo.</entryFree>
extra: <entryFree id="n17382" type="main" key="extra_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">extrā</orth> (old form EXTRAD repeatedly in the S. C. de Bacchan.; v. below, and cf. the letter D.), <pos>adv.</pos> and <sense id="n17382.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">praep.</hi> [contr. from exterā, sc. parte, from exter]. </sense><sense id="n17382.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi> (<hi rend="ital">comp.</hi> exterius, see below), <hi rend="ital">on the outside</hi>, <hi rend="ital">without</hi> (syn.: extrinsecus, foris; opp. intra, intus, in). </sense><sense id="n17382.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitiles (alvos apium) fimo bubulo oblinunt intus et extra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:16:16" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 16, 16</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum extra et intus hostem haberent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:69:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 69, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:18:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 6, 18, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:9" default="NO" valid="yes">9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">maceries levigatur extra intraque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:15:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 15, 2</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which without a copula: extra intra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:205" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 32, 38, § 205</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nil intra est oleam, nil extra est in nuce duri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et in corpore et extra esse quaedam bona,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:21:68" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 21, 68</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aut in animis aut in corporibus aut extra esse possunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:11:37" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Part. Or. 11, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea, quae extra sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 6, 26</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:59:147" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 59, 147</bibl>; and: illa, quae sunt extra, <hi rend="ital">outward goods</hi> (<foreign lang="greek">ta\ e)/cw</foreign>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 23 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sint extra licet usus belli,</quote> <trans><tr>remain aloof</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:48" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 10, 48</bibl></cit> Spald.—With verbs of motion: <cit><quote lang="la">ut nulla pars hujusce generis excederet extra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=5" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi jam nihil tale extra fertur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum extra fulgorem spargunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 8, 37, § 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad causam extra arcessitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:12:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 12, 4</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">extra petita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:11:44" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 11, 44</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi> in nearly the sense of the positive: <cit><quote lang="la">Exteriusque sitae (urbes) bimari spectantur ab Isthmo,</quote> <trans><tr>situated without</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:420" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 420</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vasa intrinsecus et exterius crasse picari (jubebat),</quote> <trans><tr>on the outside</tr>, <tr>externally</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:44:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 44, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17382.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, to indicate that which, being beyond or outside of a thing, forms an exception or addition to it, <hi rend="ital">except</hi>, <hi rend="ital">besides.</hi> </sense><sense id="n17382.4" n="1" level="3"> So freq. in the expression <hi rend="ital">extra quam</hi>, in conditional sentences usually <hi rend="ital">extra quam si</hi>, like praeterquam, <hi rend="ital">except that</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unless that</hi>, <hi rend="ital">except in case</hi> (orig. in the civil law lang.; elsewh. rare): VTEI. EA. BACANALIA. SEI. QVA. SVNT. EXTRAD. QVAM. SEI. QVID. IBEI. SACRI. EST, etc., S. C. de Bacch. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">respecting this senatusconsultum in Livy: ut omnia Bacchanalia diruerent: extra quam si qua ibi vetusta ara aut signum consecratum esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:18:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 18, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si addat exceptionem hanc: extra quam si quis, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:33:56" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 33, 56</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 6, 1, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:38:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 38, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:12:1:section=16" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 43, 12, 1, § 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">extra quam qui, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:34:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 34, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">postulat is, quicum agitur, a praetore exceptionem: extra quam in reum capitis praejudicium fiat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:20:59" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 20, 59</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17382.5" n="b" level="4"> Beyond the technical lang.: <cit><quote lang="la">negant, sapientem suscepturum ullam rei publicae partem, extra quam si eum tempus et necessitas coëgerit?</quote> <trans><tr>unless</tr>.</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 6</bibl></cit>: extra <cb n="EXTR" /> quam si nolint fame perire, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:57:172" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 57, 172</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n17382.6" n="2" level="3"> Additional, for the more usual praeterea, <hi rend="ital">besides</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extra</hi>, <hi rend="ital">additional</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaedam, inquit, pluris sunt quam venierunt, et ob hoc aliquid mihi extra pro illis, quamvis empta sint, debes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 6:15:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 6, 15, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n17382.7" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Praep.</hi> with <case>acc.</case> (rarely following its case: <cit><quote lang="la">urbem extra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 47</bibl></cit>; in late Lat. sometimes also with <case>abl.</case>, as extra fano, extra sanctuario, Hyg. de Lim.; cf. Salmas. ad <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Ver. 9, p. 431</bibl>), <hi rend="ital">outside of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">without</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beyond.</hi> </sense><sense id="n17382.8" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: aut intra muros aut extra, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 725</bibl> P. (Ann. v. 391 ed. Vahl.); <cit><quote lang="la">imitated by Horace: Iliacos intra muros peccatur et extra,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 16</bibl></cit>: quid sic te extra aedes exanimata eliminas? Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 39, 4</bibl> (Trag. v. 290 ed. Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">NEVE EXTRAD VRBEM SACRA QVISQVAM FECISE VELET, S. C. de Bacchan.: extra portam Collinam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:23:58" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 23, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">extra Peloponnesum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">extra provinciam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">extra ostium limenque carceris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:5:13" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 5, 13</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">extra limen Apuliae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 4, 10</bibl></cit> et saep.—With abstract substantives: <cit><quote lang="la">esse extra noxiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:3:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 3, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">extra noxiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:2:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 2, 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">extra noxam, extra famam noxae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:61:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 61, 9</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut extra ruinam sint eam, quae impendet,</quote> <trans><tr>beyond</tr>, <tr>apart from</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:11:24:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 11, 24, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">extra causam esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:32:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 32, 94</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">extra hanc contentionem certamenque nostrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:12:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 12, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">extra ordinem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:8:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Prov. Cons. 8, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:31:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 31, 85</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 6, 5, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">extra quotidianam consuetudinem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:85:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 85, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">extra numerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 1, 3, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:3:2:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Par. 3, 2, 26</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 59</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">extra modum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:11:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 11, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">extra jocum,</quote> <trans><tr>joking apart</tr>, <tr>seriously</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:16:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 16, 2</bibl></cit> et saep.: ne quo ad cenam exiret extra consilium meum, <hi rend="ital">without my advice</hi>, Titin. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 95, 2</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsi medium ingenium, magis extra vitia quam cum virtutibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">extra honorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:14" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 59, 60, § 150</bibl>. —With verbs of motion: <cit><quote lang="la">imperatores in medium exeunt extra turbam ordinum,</quote> <trans><tr>beyond</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">extra portam deducere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:5:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 3, 5, 78</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">extra portam perire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 2, 4, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fines terminique, extra quos egredi non possim,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 10, 35</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">extra cancellos egredi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit> § <cit><quote lang="la">36: extra modum sumptu et magnificentia prodire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:39:140" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 39, 140</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut extra tabulam non emineat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:7:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 6, 7, 9</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n17382.9" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> (acc. to I. B.), in indicating an exception or addition (= praeter). </sense><sense id="n17382.10" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Excepting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">except</hi>: optumam progeniem Priamo peperisti extra me (= me exceptā), Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:31:66" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 31, 66</bibl> (Trag. v. 83 ed. Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">extra unum te,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:203" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 203</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">extra unum Palaestrionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 2, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">extra unam aniculam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ter.</author> Ph. 1, 2, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">extra ducem paucosque praeterea reliqui primum in ipso bello rapaces, deinde, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vacationem militiae esse extra tumultum Gallicum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:19:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 5, 19, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad haec, quae interrogatus es, responde: extra ea cave vocem mittas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:32:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 32, 8</bibl></cit>.— * </sense><sense id="n17382.11" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Besides</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in addition to</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod Cato si voluit, extra familiam debuit dicere vilicum et vilicam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:18:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 18, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
extracludo: <entryFree id="n17383" type="main" key="extra_clu_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">extrā-clūdo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n17383.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to exclude</hi>, as syn. of excludo, Beda, 2334 P.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">extra-clūsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> <etym>cludo, claudo</etym>, <hi rend="ital">shut out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excluded</hi> (late Lat.): agger, locus, Front. ap. Goes. p. 39; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aggen.</author> ib. p. 60</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">regio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:ib. p. 189" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> ib. p. 189</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
extractorius: <entryFree id="n17384" type="main" key="extracto_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">extractōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>extraho</etym>, <sense id="n17384.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">drawing out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extractive</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">vis arundinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 11, 50, § 87</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
extractus: <entryFree id="n17385" type="main" key="extractus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">extractus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from extraho.</entryFree>
extraho: <entryFree id="n17386" type="main" key="extra^ho"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-trăho</orth>, <itype>xi, ctum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n17386.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to draw out</hi> or <hi rend="ital">forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to drag out</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n17386.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n17386.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">rete ex aqua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:4:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 4, 124</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">telum e corpore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:7:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 7, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gladium e vulnere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 13</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which: telum de vulnere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vivum puerum alvo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:340" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 340</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">filium exsecto ventre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:5:2:6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 5, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spinas, venena corpori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:245" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 18, 76, § 245</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:13" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 2, 2, § 13</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">anulum sibi deficienti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tit.:73" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tit. 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut sine labore hanc (aquam) extraxi!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 2, 5, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vires humerorum (natae) ad aratra extrahenda,</quote> <trans><tr>to draw forward</tr>, <tr>draw</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:63:159" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 63, 159</bibl></cit>.—With personal objects: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem e latebra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:17" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 17</bibl></cit>; cf.: extrahitur domo latitans Oppianicus<pb n="710" /> <cb n="EXTR" />  a Manilio, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:13:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 13, 39</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rure in urbem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senatores vi in publicum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 13, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostes invitos in aciem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:29:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 29, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem turba oppositis humeris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:5:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 5, 94</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17386.3" n="B" level="2"> Esp., med. t. t. </sense><sense id="n17386.4" n="1" level="3"> Dentis extrahere, i. e. by medicinal means, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 7, 26, § 79</bibl> (cf.: dentem evellere, i. e. by force).—</sense><sense id="n17386.5" n="2" level="3"> Of cuppingglasses: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguinem extrahere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 11 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n17386.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n17386.7" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to withdraw</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extricate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">release; to draw out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extract</hi>, <hi rend="ital">eradicate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbem ex periculis maximis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 4, 11</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">me inde,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ter.</author> Ph. 1, 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nescis, Parmeno, Quantum hodie profueris mihi et ex quanta aerumna extraxeris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:5:4:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 5, 4, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imbecilliores adjuvabit malisque opinionibus extrahet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 95" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 95 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se rebus humanis,</quote> <trans><tr>to take one's own life</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:21:1:23:section=3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 21, 1, 23, § 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(scelera) ex occultis tenebris in lucem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:16:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 16, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">secreta mentis (verberum vis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Hippol. 884" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Hippol. 884</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Epicurus ex animis hominum extraxit radicitus religionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:43:121" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 43, 121</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 34, 108</bibl>: cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">hunc errorem, quasi radicem malorum omnium, stirpitus philosophia se extracturam pollicetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:38:83" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 4, 38, 83</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17386.8" n="B" level="2"> In partic., of time, <hi rend="ital">to draw out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">protract</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prolong</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">res variis calumniis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se tergiversando in adventum ejus rem extracturum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:46:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 46, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">certamen usque ad noctem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:41:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 41, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pugnam in posterum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum in tertium annum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">somnum plerumque in diem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">has materias in infinitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:1:43" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 1, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicendi morā dies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:32:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 32, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">triduum disputationibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 33, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diem de die,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 2:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 2, 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">primum tempus noctis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:28:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 28, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aestatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:22:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 5, 22, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:9:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 9, 10</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">eludi atque extrahi se multitudo putare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:23:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 23, 13</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">populumque ducesque incertis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:3:575" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 3, 575</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mentem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 323</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
extramundanus: <entryFree id="n17387" type="main" key="extra_munda_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">extrā-mundānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n17387.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">beyond the world</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extramundane</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">intelligentia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 1, § 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">latitudines,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, § 202</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
extramuranus: <entryFree id="n17388" type="main" key="extra_mu_ra_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">extrā-mūrānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>murus</etym>, <sense id="n17388.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">without the walls</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">meretrices,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Heliog. 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">basilica,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Ep. 20, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
extranaturalis: <entryFree id="n17389" type="main" key="extra_na_tu_ra_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">extrā-nātūrālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n17389.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">beyond nature</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not natural</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 43</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
extraneo: <entryFree id="n17390" type="hapax" key="extra_ne^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">extrānĕo</orth>, <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>extraneus</etym>, <sense id="n17390.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to treat as a stranger</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disown</hi> a child: <cit><quote lang="la">extraneasse eam (filiam),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 335</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
extraneus: <entryFree id="n17391" type="main" key="extra_ne^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">extrānĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>extra</etym>, <sense id="n17391.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that is without</hi>, <hi rend="ital">external</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extraneous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">strange</hi>, <hi rend="ital">foreign</hi> (mostly post-Aug.; syn.: peregrinus, alienus, adventicius, externus). </sense><sense id="n17391.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">causa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 3, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cognomen,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 31, 42</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17391.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., with respect to one's family, <hi rend="ital">strange</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not related</hi>, <hi rend="ital">foreign.</hi>—Esp. </sense><sense id="n17391.3" n="A" level="2"> Leg. t. t.: heredes extranei, <hi rend="ital">not of one's blood or household</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ceteri, qui testatoris juri subjecti non sunt, extranei heredes appellantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 2:161" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 2, 161</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:45:3:11" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 45, 3, 11</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n17391.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">extrānĕus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a stranger</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut non tam in extraneum translatum quam in familiam reversum videretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:10" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">filiam extraneorum coetu prohibere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:69" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 69</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">finis vitae ejus nobis luctuosus, amicis tristis, extraneis etiam ignotisque non sine cura fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 43</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 4, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 4, 7, § 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:68:9 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 68, 9 al.</bibl>—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">extrā-nĕe</orth>, <hi rend="ital">strangely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impertinently</hi>: definire, Boëth. Arist. Top. 1, 14.</sense></entryFree>
extraordinarius: <entryFree id="n17392" type="main" key="extra^ordi^na_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">extră-ordĭnārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n17392.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">out of the common order</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extraordinary</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">fructuum species,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:1:28" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 1, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hinc illae extraordinariae pecuniae, quas nullo duce investigamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:39:section=100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 39, § 100</bibl></cit>: <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 70</bibl>, § <cit><quote lang="la">170: pecunia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Com. 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reus,</quote> <trans><tr>one to be tried out of the usual order</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 8, 8, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equites sinistrae alae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:31:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 31, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cohortes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:27:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 40, 27, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:47:4" default="NO" valid="yes">34, 47, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">porta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:27:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 40, 27, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:18:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 26, 18, 3</bibl></cit>: honor, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:32:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 32, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">petitio consulatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:63:226" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 63, 226</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperium, praesidium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:8:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 11, 8, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">munus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 5, 9, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cupiditates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:14:section=35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 14, § 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crimina,</quote> <trans><tr>respecting which the law contains no enactments</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 47</bibl></cit>, tit. 11: <cit><quote lang="la">cognitiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:13" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 50, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">coërcitio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:20:2" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 47, 20, 2</bibl></cit>.— <cb n="EXTR" /> <itype>Hence</itype>, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">extrăordĭnārĭē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">with excessive frequency</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">ut eum quem diligebat, extraordinarie nominaret,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Eph. I. ad 2, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
extrarius: <entryFree id="n17393" type="main" key="extra_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">extrārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>extra</etym>, <sense id="n17393.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">outward</hi>, <hi rend="ital">external</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extrinsic</hi> (rare but class.). </sense><sense id="n17393.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">lux,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:277" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 277</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utilitas aut in corpore posita est aut in extrariis rebus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:56:168" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 56, 168</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 59, 177</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aut in extrariam aut in ipsius qui periit voluntatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:2:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">defensio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 13, 19</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17393.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., as respects one's family, <hi rend="ital">strange</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unrelated;</hi> and <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a stranger</hi> (cf. extraneus): <cit><quote lang="la">hanc condicionem si cui tulero extrario,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:4:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 4, 1, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">extrarii (opp. mei),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. p. 359</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub extrario accusatore et legibus agente (opp. in domesticis disceptationibus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:4:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">extrarios reliquit heredes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:2:36" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 38, 2, 36</bibl></cit> et saep.—Connected with <hi rend="ital">ab</hi>: ut me esse in hac re ducat abs te extrarium? Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 103, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
extremitas: <entryFree id="n17394" type="main" key="extre_mi^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">extrēmĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype> (<sense id="n17394.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> extremitatium, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 2, 9, § 32</bibl>; cf. infra), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>extremus</etym>, <hi rend="ital">the extremity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">end</hi> of a thing (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">infinitas regiones, quarum nulla est ora, nulla extremitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:31:102" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 31, 102</bibl></cit>: mundus globosus est fabricatus, quod <foreign lang="greek">sfairoeide\s</foreign> Graeci vocant: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus omnis extremitas paribus in medio radiis attingitur,</quote> <trans><tr>outer circumference</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Univ. 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">circuli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 17, 14, § 73</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">extremitatem et quasi libramentum (esse), in quo nulla omnino crassitudo sit (opp. punctum and lineamentum),</quote> <trans><tr>superficies</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 36, 116</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">picturae,</quote> <trans><tr>the outer edge</tr>, <tr>outline</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 10, 36, § 68</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aethiopiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:188" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 30, 35, § 188</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacuum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 31, 7, 39, § 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corporis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 6, 17, § 61</bibl></cit>; cf. <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">febrium accessiones cum frigore extremitatum,</quote> <trans><tr>the extremities</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 1, 24, § 48</bibl></cit>.—As rhet. t. t.: <cit><quote lang="la">extremitates,</quote> <trans><tr>extremes</tr>, <tr>extreme opposites</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:15" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 15</bibl></cit>.—As gram. t. t., <hi rend="ital">the termination</hi>, Prisc. ad Julian. Ep. §§ 5, 6.</sense></entryFree>
extremo: <entryFree id="n17395" type="main" key="extre_mo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">extrēmo</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">extrēmum</orth>, v. exter, III. A. 2. a.</entryFree>
extremus: <entryFree id="n17396" type="main" key="extre_mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">extrēmus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. exter, III. A.</entryFree>
extrico: <entryFree id="n17397" type="main" key="extri_co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-trīco</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> (<sense id="n17397.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dep.</hi> form extricor, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:1:2:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 49</bibl>; <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>) [tricae], <hi rend="ital">to disentangle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extricate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to clear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">free</hi> (rare; not in Cic.; syn.: explico, enodo, expedio, enucleo, explano). </sense><sense id="n17397.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">extricata densis Cerva plagis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:5:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 5, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">margaritae extricatae,</quote> <trans><tr>unstrung</tr>, <tr>loose</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:9:2:27" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 9, 2, 27 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n17397.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">silvestris ager facile extricatur,</quote> <trans><tr>is cleared</tr>, <tr>made arable</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:11:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 11, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mercedem aut nummos unde unde extricat,</quote> <trans><tr>procures with difficulty</tr>, <tr>hunts up</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 88</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17397.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: putas eos non citius tricas Atellanas quam id extricaturos, <hi rend="ital">to unravel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clear up</hi>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 8, 29</bibl>: de aliquo nihil, Vat. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 10, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:22:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 22, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omne genus daemoniorum,</quote> <trans><tr>removes</tr>, <tr>drives out</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Tobiae, 6, 8</bibl></cit>.—In <hi rend="ital">dep.</hi> form: <cit><quote lang="la">extricabor aliqua ope,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:1:2:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 49</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
extricor: <entryFree id="n17398" type="main" key="extri_cor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">extrīcor</orth> <itype>āri</itype>, v. extrico <sense id="n17398.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
extrilidus: <entryFree id="n17399" type="hapax" key="extrilidus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">extrilidus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n17399.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unterrified</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dauntless</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hominem conspicimus impavidum et extrilidum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:1:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 1, 6</bibl></cit> Hertz. (al. extimidum).</sense></entryFree>
extrinsecus: <entryFree id="n17400" type="main" key="extrinse^cus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">extrin-sĕcus</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>‡ extrim as an adverbial form of exter</etym>, <sense id="n17400.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">from without</hi>, <hi rend="ital">from abroad.</hi> </sense><sense id="n17400.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop. (class.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: extra, foris): si qui tremerent vel ipsi per se motu mentis aliquo vel objecta terribili re extrinsecus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 15, 48</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in dicendo aliquid extrinsecus alicunde quaerere (opp. ex ipsis visceribus causae sumere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:78:318" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 78, 318</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">assumptis extrinsecus auxiliis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:4:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 4, 7</bibl></cit>; cf. also <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:39:163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 39, 163</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">spiritum adducere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:54:136" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 54, 136</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">humor allapsus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:27:58" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 27, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">excipere genus divinandi extrinsecus ex divinitate,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 11, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod habet extremum, id cernitur ex alio extrinsecus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 50, 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imminens bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:32:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 32, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum quid extrinsecus laesit, ut in vulneribus (opp. intra se ipsum corruptum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 6, 26</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n17400.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n17400.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Without</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the outside</hi> (cf. foris): <cit><quote lang="la">deinde eum (animum) circumdedit corpore et vestivit extrinsecus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 6</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 7:1:79" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 7, 1, 79</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:12" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">extrinsecus inaurata (columna),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:24:48" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 24, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jecur intrinsecus cavum, extrinsecus gibberum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 1</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so opp. introrsus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Tranq. 10" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Tranq. 10</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">opp. intus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:9:13" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 9, 13</bibl></cit>: extrinsecus <cb n="EXTU" /> custodes erant, App. de Mundo, p. 69: <cit><quote lang="la">quod eam tuetur, est id extrinsecus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:14:39" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 14, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plerique extrinsecus nesciunt,</quote> <trans><tr>the uninitiated</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=34" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 34</bibl></cit> Müll.—* </sense><sense id="n17400.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Irrelevantly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec etsi extrinsecus, non tamen intempestive videor hoc loco retulisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:6:17" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 6, 17</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17400.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Moreover</hi> = praeterea (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 9, 25</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n17401" type="main" key="extrinse^cus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">extrinsĕcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> (late Lat.), <sense id="n17401.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">outer</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">habitus pallii,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pall. 1</bibl></cit>; Gregor. Mag. Ep. 8, 40.</sense></entryFree>
extritus: <entryFree id="n17402" type="main" key="extri_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">extrītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from extero.</entryFree>
extro: <entryFree id="n17403" type="hapax" key="extro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">extro</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>extra, analog. to intro, āre</etym>, <sense id="n17403.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to go out from</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to quit</hi>: simul limen intrabo, illi extrabunt ilico, Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 104, 21</bibl> (R<bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> Com. Fragm. p. 165</bibl>).</sense></entryFree>
extrorsus: <entryFree id="n17404" type="main" key="extrorsu^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">extrorsŭs</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>extra + versus</etym>, <sense id="n17404.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">in an outward direction</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 168</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
extrudo: <entryFree id="n17405" type="main" key="extru_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-trūdo</orth>, <itype>si, sum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n17405.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to thrust out</hi> or <hi rend="ital">forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to drive out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">drive away</hi> (class.; syn. eicio). </sense><sense id="n17405.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">me ex aedibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:1:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 1, 1, 5</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which: me aedibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me foras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:1:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 1, 1, 68</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 5, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">a latebris suis extrusi hostes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">te in viam, simulac perpaululum gustaris, extrudam et eiciam,</quote> <trans><tr>will drive out</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:58:234" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 58, 234</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:14:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 14, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 16, 2, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">is tamquam extruderetur a senatu in Macedoniam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:10:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 10, 5, 10</bibl></cit>. —<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">illam extrudet cum hanc ducet domum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:2:1:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 2, 1, 63</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17405.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, with inanimate objects: <cit><quote lang="la">(ventus) extrudit saxa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:692" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 692</bibl></cit>: extruso mari aggere ac molibus, <hi rend="ital">kept out</hi>, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 12, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Euboea ad meridiem promontorium Geraeston et Capharea extrudit,</quote> <trans><tr>sends out</tr>, <tr>shoots out</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:7:9" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 7, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">merces,</quote> <trans><tr>to put off</tr>, <tr>to sell</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 11</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n17405.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to crowd out</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rerum novitate extrusa vetustas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:964" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 964</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
extruo: <entryFree id="n17406" type="main" key="extru^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">extrŭo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, v. exstruo.</entryFree>
extrusus: <entryFree id="n17407" type="main" key="extru_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">extrūsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from extrudo.</entryFree>
extuberatio: <entryFree id="n17408" type="main" key="extu_be^ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">extūbĕrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>extubero</etym>, <sense id="n17408.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a tumor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">swelling</hi> (post-Aug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 9, 45, § 104</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
extubero: <entryFree id="n17409" type="main" key="extu_be^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-tūbĕro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n17409.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [tuber] (post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n17409.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to swell out</hi> or <hi rend="ital">up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to rise as a swelling</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">radice foliosa, ex qua media veluti malum extuberat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 16, 56, § 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gemma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 8, 33, § 110</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17409.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to cause to swell up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to raise</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">defert montes, surrigit plana, valles extuberat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 6:4:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 6, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">extuberatus venter,</quote> <trans><tr>swollen</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 12, 15, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">25, 10, 13</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 27 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
extumeo: <entryFree id="n17410" type="hapax" key="extu^me^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-tŭmĕo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n17410.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to swell up</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">uterum illi numquam extumere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:2:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 1, 2, 97</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
extumidus: <entryFree id="n17411" type="hapax" key="extu^mi^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-tŭmĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n17411.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">raised</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">area,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:51:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 51, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
extumus: <entryFree id="n17412" type="main" key="extu^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">extŭmus</orth>, v. extimus.</entryFree>
extundo: <entryFree id="n17413" type="main" key="extundo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-tundo</orth>, <itype>tŭdi, tūsum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n17413.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to beat out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">strike out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">force out</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and post-Aug.; not in Cic. or Caes.). </sense><sense id="n17413.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">calcibus frontem extudit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:1:21:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 1, 21, 9</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 5:33:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 5, 33, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">frequens tussis sanguinem quoque extundit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 4, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17413.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">priusquam id extudi, cum illi subblandiebar,</quote> <trans><tr>squeezed out</tr>, <tr>extorted</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 3, 64</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ea demum extudit magis convicio quam precibus vel auctoritate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:2" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis nobis extudit hanc artem?</quote> <trans><tr>struck out</tr>, <tr>found out</tr>, <tr>devised</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:315" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 315</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eloquentiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:20:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 20, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitae mortalis honorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:328" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 328</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perseveranti postulatione extuderunt, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:5:2:10" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 5, 2, 10</bibl></cit>; so with <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:1:4:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 4, 4</bibl>: alios (discentes) continuatio extundit, in aliis plus impetus facit, <hi rend="ital">hammers out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">forms</hi> (the figure being taken from a sculptor), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:3:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 3, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic exsultantis Salios ... et lapsa ancilia caelo extuderat,</quote> <trans><tr>embossed</tr>, <tr>fashioned in relief</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:665" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 665</bibl></cit>: cum labor extuderit fastidia, <hi rend="ital">has driven off</hi> (= cum vi excusserit, removerit), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 2, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">unum librum extudit et elucubravit,</quote> <trans><tr>elaborated</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exturbo: <entryFree id="n17414" type="main" key="exturbo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-turbo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n17414.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to drive</hi> or <hi rend="ital">thrust out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to drive away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thrust away</hi> (class.; syn.: expello, eicio, deicio, everto, etc.). </sense><sense id="n17414.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem ex aedibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nos ex nostris aedibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4, 200</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines e possessionibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:25:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 25, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hominem e civitate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:22:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 22, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plebem ex agris (with expellere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:31:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 31, 84</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:5:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 5, 14</bibl>: cunctos <pb n="711" /> <cb n="EXUL" /> aedibus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:3:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 3, 76</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem focis patriis disque penatibus praecipitem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:8:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 8, 23</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Antiochus praeceps provincia exturbatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:30:section=67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 30, § 67</bibl></cit>: extorris regno, exturbatus mari, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 14, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortunis omnibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 31, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem foras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:3:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 3, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Marium urbe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:19:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 19, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnibus mala sterilitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:32" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 32</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17414.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of things as objects: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui oculos atque dentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:169" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 169</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pinus radicibus exturbata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 108</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">radix ex vino pota calculos quoque exturbat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 10, 42, § 109</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nervo exturbante sagittas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:16:482" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 16, 482</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17414.3" n="C" level="2"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">to put away</hi> a wife: <cit><quote lang="la">exturbat Octaviam, sterilem dictitans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 60 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in Silium ita exarserat, ut Silanam matrimonio ejus exturbaret,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>compelled him to divorce Silana</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17414.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">aegritudinem ex animo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 2, 1, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facti memoriam ex animo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:15:3:11" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 15, 3, 11</bibl></cit>: <hi rend="ital">Si.</hi> Numquid Tranio Turbavit? <hi rend="ital">Th.</hi> Immo exturbavit omnia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:4:3:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 4, 3, 38</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">spem pacis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:21:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 21, 8</bibl></cit>: mentem, <hi rend="ital">to disturb</hi> (= vexare), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 4, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">odiis tranquilla silentia noctis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:441" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 441</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
extussio: <entryFree id="n17415" type="main" key="extussi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-tussĭo</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">ētussĭo</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 5:10:103" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 5, 10, 103</bibl>), no <sense id="n17415.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ītum, 4</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to cough up</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vomicam excitat sic ut extussiatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 8 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 3, 35, § 72</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:16" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 2, 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
exuberantia: <entryFree id="n17416" type="main" key="exu_be^ranti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exūbĕrantĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>exubero</etym>, <sense id="n17416.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">superabundance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exuberance</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ruboris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:26:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 26, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">memoriae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:8:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 7</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">in lemm.</hi></sense></entryFree>
exuberatio: <entryFree id="n17417" type="hapax" key="exu_be^ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exūbĕrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n17417.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">superabundance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excess;</hi> in <number>plur.</number>, opp. defectiones, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 1, 4, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
exubero: <entryFree id="n17418" type="main" key="exu_be^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-ūbĕro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n17418.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose). </sense><sense id="n17418.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to come forth in abundance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to grow luxuriantly; to be abundant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to abound in.</hi> </sense><sense id="n17418.2" n="A" level="2"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus corpus in tam immodicum modum luxuriasset exuberassetque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:22:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 22, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alte spumis exuberat amnis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:465" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 465</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(frus) mox increscens ad medium noctis exuberat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:228" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 103, 106, § 228</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pomis exuberat annus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:516 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 516 al.</bibl></cit> —</sense><sense id="n17418.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex multa eruditione, ex pluribus artibus exundat et exuberat eloquentia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lucrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:40" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 40</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n17418.4" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to make full</hi> or <hi rend="ital">abundant</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae favorum ceras exuberant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:4:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 4, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">materia melior vindemiis exuberandis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:15:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 15, 5</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Scythae exuberant Persas,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>overwhelm by numbers of immigrants</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pall. 2</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">P. a.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">exuberans</orth>, ntis. </sense><sense id="n17418.5" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Superfluous</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc exuberantis quasi operis, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:5:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 5, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17418.6" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Extraordinary</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pernicitas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 19, 8, 11</bibl></cit>. —Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">exuberante</orth>, <hi rend="ital">superfluously</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> de Amic. 25, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
exuccus: <entryFree id="n17419" type="main" key="exuccus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exuccus</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">exuctus</orth>, v. exsuc-.</entryFree>
exudo: <entryFree id="n17420" type="main" key="exu_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exūdo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, v. exsudo.</entryFree>
exugo: <entryFree id="n17421" type="main" key="exu_go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exūgo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, v. exsugo.</entryFree>
exul: <entryFree id="n17422" type="main" key="exul"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exul</orth>, v. exsul.</entryFree>
exulceratio: <entryFree id="n17423" type="main" key="exulce^ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exulcĕrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>exulcero</etym>, <sense id="n17423.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a soreness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">festering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exulceration</hi> (post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n17423.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">si nulla exulceratio est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 22</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">vesicarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 3, 8, § 17</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n17423.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: verebar, ne haec non consolatio sed exulceratio esset, i. e. <hi rend="ital">exasperation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">aggravation</hi> of pain, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. ad Helv. 1:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Cons. ad Helv. 1, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
exulceratorius: <entryFree id="n17424" type="main" key="exulce^ra_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exulcĕrātōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n17424.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to festering</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ulceration</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">medicamentum,</quote> <trans><tr>against ulceration</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 7, 64, § 126</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exulceratrix: <entryFree id="n17425" type="main" key="exulce^ra_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exulcĕrātrix</orth> (also <orth extent="full" lang="la">exhulc-</orth>), <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n17425.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she who causes soreness</hi> or <hi rend="ital">exulceration</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vis septica et exulc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 12, 80, § 105</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exulcero: <entryFree id="n17426" type="main" key="exulce^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-ulcĕro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n17426.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make sore</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to cause to suppurate</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ulcerate</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n17426.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulices solent ea (sc. aures al.) exulcerare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:9:14" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 9, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cutem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ventrem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 21 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulvas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:9:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 9, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stomachum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:196" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 13, 54, § 196</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cicatrices,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 12, 90, § 112</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">panos nondum exulceratos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 2, 32, § 66</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnis agitatio exulcerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 15</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17426.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to make worse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to exasperate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">aggravate</hi> (syn.: corrumpo, perturbo): <cit><quote lang="la">ea, quae sanare nequeunt, exulcerant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:75:303" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 75, 303</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gratiam (opp. conciliare),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:42:156" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 42, 156</bibl></cit>: in rebus ab <cb n="EXUO" /> ipso rege clam exulceratis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 1, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 12, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut in exulcerato animo facile fictum crimen insideret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Deiot. 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ira exulcerati animi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:14:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 14, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exulo: <entryFree id="n17427" type="main" key="exu^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exŭlo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, v. exsulo.</entryFree>
exulto: <entryFree id="n17428" type="main" key="exulto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exulto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, v. exsulto.</entryFree>
exululo: <entryFree id="n17429" type="main" key="exu^lu^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-ŭlŭlo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n17429.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>). </sense><sense id="n17429.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to howl</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cry out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to howl violently</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nactusque silentia ruris Exululat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:233" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 233</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:8:171" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 8, 171</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">solutis Crinibus exululant matres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:12:599" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 12, 599</bibl></cit>. —In <hi rend="ital">dep.</hi> form: <cit><quote lang="la">dum stupet (Bacchis) Edonis exululata jugis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:1:42" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 1, 42</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n17429.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to call</hi> or <hi rend="ital">invoke with howlings</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cybeleia mater Concinitur Phrygiis exululata modis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:507" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 507</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exunctus: <entryFree id="n17430" type="main" key="exunctus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exunctus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from exungo.</entryFree>
exundantia: <entryFree id="n17431" type="main" key="exundanti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exundantĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>exundo</etym>, <sense id="n17431.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an overflow</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Hexaem. 2, 1, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
exundatio: <entryFree id="n17432" type="main" key="exunda_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exundātĭo</orth>, <itype>onis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n17432.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an overflowing</hi> of a river (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">fluminum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 3, 13, § 37</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
