exundo: <entryFree id="n17433" type="main" key="exundo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-undo</orth>, <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n17433.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> </sense><sense id="n17433.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to flow out</hi> or <hi rend="ital">over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to overflow</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose). </sense><sense id="n17433.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">fons,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:229" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 103, 106, § 229</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per quos (rivos) exundat piscina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:17:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 17, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">trunco cruor exundat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Agam. 903" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Agam. 903</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17433.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n17433.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To be washed up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thrown out</hi> by the waves: <cit><quote lang="la">tura balsamaque vi tempestatum in adversa litora exundant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 45</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17433.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To pour forth abundantly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to rush forth; to overflow with</hi> any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">flammarum exundat torrens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:14:62" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 14, 62</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">exundant diviso vertice flammae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:12:431" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 12, 431</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spiritus (morientis) exundans perflavit campum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:5:455" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 5, 455</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inde Medusaeis terram exundasse chelydris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:316" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 316</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exundans ingenii fons,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:119" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exundat et exuberat eloquentia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 30</bibl></cit>: temperare iram; eoque detracto quod exundat, ad salutarem modum cogere, <hi rend="ital">which superabounds</hi>, <hi rend="ital">is in excess</hi>, Sen. de Ira, 1, 7.—* </sense><sense id="n17433.6" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to pour forth abundantly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fumum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:2:631" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 2, 631</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exungo: <entryFree id="n17434" type="main" key="exungo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-ungo</orth>, no <sense id="n17434.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>unctum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to anoint</hi> (a Plautinian word): <cit><quote lang="la">eluas tu an exungare, ciccum non interduim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:7:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 2, 7, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exunctum, elutum in balineis,</quote> <trans><tr>spent on ointments</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exunguis: <entryFree id="n17435" type="main" key="exunguis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-unguis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n17435.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">without claws</hi> (postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">exunguis et excornis bestia (muraena),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pall. 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exungulo: <entryFree id="n17436" type="hapax" key="exungu^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-ungŭlo</orth>, <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n17436.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to lose the hoof</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 2, 57 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
exuo: <entryFree id="n17437" type="main" key="exu^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-ŭo</orth>, <itype>ŭi, ūtum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>ex and root av-, to go to, put on; Zend. avaiti, go into, ao-thra, shoe; Slav. and Lith. forms, v. Fick, Vergl. Wört. p. 17; cf. ind-uo</etym>, <sense id="n17437.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to draw out</hi> or <hi rend="ital">off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to pull</hi> or <hi rend="ital">strip off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">put off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">divest</hi> (class.; esp. freq. since the Aug. period). </sense><sense id="n17437.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">serpens exuit in spinis vestem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manticam umero,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 110</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">pharetram umero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:419" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 419</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">telum magno e vulnere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:9:287" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 9, 287</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ensem vaginā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clipeum reduci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:13:147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 13, 147</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vincula sibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:773" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 7, 773</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jugum,</quote> <trans><tr>to shake off</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:17:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 17, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alas,</quote> <trans><tr>to lay aside</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:690" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 690</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Trojanos cestus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 420</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">setosa duris exuere pellibus membra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:17:15" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 17, 15</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">magnos membrorum artus, magna ossa lacertosque Exuit,</quote> <trans><tr>strips</tr>, <tr>bares</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:423" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 423</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem veste,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:32" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">palmas vinclis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:153" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 153</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">digitos,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to strip of rings</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:109" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 109</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mensas,</quote> <trans><tr>to uncover</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:60:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 60, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si ex his te laqueis exueris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:58:section=151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 58, § 151</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se jugo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:13:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 13, 9</bibl></cit>. —In a Greek construction: <cit><quote lang="la">unum exuta pedem vinclis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:518" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 518</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cornua exuitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 52</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">si non saltas, exue igitur (sc. pallam),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:3:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 1, 3, 16</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n17437.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">to strip</hi>, <hi rend="ital">despoil</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deprive</hi> of any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">hostium copiis fusis armisque exutis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to be forced to throw off their arms and to flee</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 6, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostem armis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 51</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 88:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 88, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:21:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 21, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">exuti prope omnes armis diffugere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:61:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 61, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:28:11" default="NO" valid="yes">34, 28, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:395" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 395</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">impedimentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:14:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 14, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">7, 42, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">castris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:42:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 42, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes">41, 3, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:12:5" default="NO" valid="yes">41, 12, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:9:4" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 9, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sedibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem avitis bonis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 31</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem patrimonio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gramm. 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">montes,</quote> <trans><tr>to strip</tr>, <tr>lay bare</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4:3:50" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 4, 3, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se agro paterno avitoque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:23:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 23, 6</bibl></cit>: exuto <cb n="EXVI" /> Lepido, interfecto Antonio, <hi rend="ital">stripped bare</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">without legions</hi>, <hi rend="ital">without arms</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n17437.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to lay aside</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cast off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">divest one's self of</hi> any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">humanitatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,033:5:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Lig. 5, 14</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 13, 2, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sapientia vanitatem exuit mentibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 90" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 90 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mentitum colorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:76" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">silvestrem animum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vultus severos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:4:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 4, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">feritatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:281" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 3, 281</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mores antiquos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:8:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 8, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtutes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fidem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicitiam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tristitiam et arrogantiam et avaritiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jus fasque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">promissa,</quote> <trans><tr>to break one's word</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 13, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pacta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patriam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 5, 5</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">hominem exuens ex homine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:12:35" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 12, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magistrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 52 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—* </sense><sense id="n17437.4" n="(b)" level="5"> With a <hi rend="ital">subjectclause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi quidem ex animo exui non potest, esse deos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:3:7" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 3, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17437.5" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to make void of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to free from</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">se omnibus vitiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 11" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exupero: <entryFree id="n17438" type="main" key="exu^pe^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exŭpĕro</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, v. exsupero.</entryFree>
exurgeo: <entryFree id="n17439" type="main" key="exurge^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-urgĕo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype> (-guo, ĕre, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=80:16" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 80, 16</bibl>), <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n17439.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to squeeze out</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:3:69 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 3, 69 sq.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
exurgo: <entryFree id="n17440" type="main" key="exurgo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exurgo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, v. exsurgo.</entryFree>
exuro: <entryFree id="n17441" type="main" key="exu_ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-ūro</orth>, <itype>ussi, ustum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n17441.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to burn out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">burn up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consume</hi> (class.; syn.: incendo, accendo, inflammo, cremo). </sense><sense id="n17441.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">illic oculos exuram lampadibus ardentibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:2:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 2, 86</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">88</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:4:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 4, 4, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domi suae vivus exustus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:27:section=70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 27, § 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vicos complures,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Imp. Pomp. 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">classem Argivum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 39</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17441.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to dry up</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">loca exusta solis ardoribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 19:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 19, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paludem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:432" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 432</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:1:6:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 1, 6, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 107</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res exustae torrentibus auris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:410" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 410</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caseum (sol),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:8:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 8, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">segetem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 9, 7, § 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem (sitis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:917" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 917</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:16:7" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 16, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pyrrhus Italiam bellis saevissimis exurens,</quote> <trans><tr>laying waste</tr>, <tr>devastating</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 21, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17441.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n17441.4" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To set on fire</hi>, <hi rend="ital">kindle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inflame</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Venus) volt exurere divos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:4:2:5" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 4, 2, 5</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Agam. 665 sq" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Agam. 665 sq.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n17441.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To consume</hi>, <hi rend="ital">destroy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliis scelus exuritur igni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:742" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 742</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exustus flos veteris ubertatis,</quote> <trans><tr>dried up</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:4:16" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 4, 16</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exuscito: <entryFree id="n17442" type="main" key="exusci^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exuscĭto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, v. exsuscito.</entryFree>
exustio: <entryFree id="n17443" type="main" key="exusti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exustĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>exuro</etym>. <sense id="n17443.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A burning up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a conflagration</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">eluviones exustionesque terrarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:21:23" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 21, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:64:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 64, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quorum finis exustio est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Isa. 3, 7, 4</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 1, 1, § 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n17443.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A burning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scorching</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">solis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:223" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 24, 37, § 223</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exustus: <entryFree id="n17444" type="main" key="exustus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exustus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from exuro.</entryFree>
exutio: <entryFree id="n17445" type="main" key="exu_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exūtĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>exuo</etym>, <sense id="n17445.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an exclusion;</hi> transf.: <cit><quote lang="la">a venia exutio,</quote> <trans><tr>they who are excluded from divine forgiveness</tr>, <tr>the utterly reprobate</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> in Luc. 8, § 64</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exutus: <entryFree id="n17446" type="main" key="exu_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exūtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from exuo.</entryFree>
exuviae: <entryFree id="n17447" type="main" key="exu^vi^ae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exŭvĭae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>exuo</etym>, <sense id="n17447.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that which is stripped</hi>, <hi rend="ital">drawn</hi> or <hi rend="ital">taken off</hi> from the body, <hi rend="ital">clothing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">equipments</hi>, <hi rend="ital">arms</hi>, etc. (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>). </sense><sense id="n17447.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">induviae tuae atque uxoris exuviae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 1, 3, 9</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pyram Erige et arma viri ... exuviasque omnes ... super imponant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:496" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 496</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:8:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> E. 8, 91</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum fulmine et sceptro exuviisque Jovis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:94" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 94</bibl></cit>; cf. Fest. S. V. TENSA, p. 365, 1 Müll.: EXVVIAS FECIT, i. q. funus fecit, Inscr. in Bull. dell' <bibl default="NO"><author>Inst.</author> 1844, p. 90</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">The skin</hi> of an animal; <cit><quote lang="la">(coluber) positis novus exuviis,</quote> <trans><tr>his slough</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:473" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 473</bibl></cit>; of the lion's <hi rend="ital">hide</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 307</bibl>; the tiger's <hi rend="ital">hide</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 577</bibl>; the golden <hi rend="ital">fleece</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:19" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:8:65" default="NO">8, 65</bibl>.—Comic.: <cit><quote lang="la">bubulae,</quote> <trans><tr>thongs of ox-hide</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:4:1:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 4, 1, 26</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Hair</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">devotae flavi verticis exuviae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:66:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 66, 62</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Hippol. 1181" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Hippol. 1181</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n17447.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">spoils</hi> stripped from an enemy, as arms, booty, etc. (syn.: praeda, spolia, manubiae): locus (i. e. Rostra) exuviis nauticis et classium spoliis ornatus, * <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Imp. Pomp. 18, 55</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Hector) exuvias indutus Achilli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:275" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 275</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec arma exuviasque viri tua quercus habebit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 423</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostiles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:1:54" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 1, 54</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">bellorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:133" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 133</bibl></cit>.—*</sense><sense id="n17447.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu ornatus exuviis hujus, venis ad eum lacerandum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:18:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 18, 50</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exvaporo: <entryFree id="n17448" type="main" key="exva^po_ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exvăpōro</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, v. evaporo.</entryFree>
exveho: <entryFree id="n17449" type="main" key="exve^ho"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exvĕho</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, v. eveho.</entryFree>
exvibrisso: <entryFree id="n17450" type="main" key="exvi_brisso"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exvībrisso</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, v. vibrisso. <pb n="712" /> <cb n="FABA" /> <cb n="F." /></entryFree>
f: <entryFree id="n17451" type="main" key="F"><orth extent="full" lang="la">F</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">f</orth>, <itype>indecl.</itype> <gen>n.</gen> or (sc. littera) <gen>f.</gen> The sign <foreign lang="greek">v</foreign> is the Aeolic digamma, adopted by the Latins instead of 8, the form used by the Etruscans, Oscans, and Umbrians for this letter; in inscriptions, before A.U.C. 500, it is sometimes written <figure />. The ancient grammarians, misled by the shape, ascribed to F the power of the digamma; thus: <foreign lang="greek">v</foreign> Aeolicum digamma, quod apud antiquissimos Latinorum eandem vim quam apud Aeolis habuit, eum autem prope sonum quem nunc habet, significabat p cum aspiratione; sicut etiam apud veteres Graecos pro <foreign lang="greek">f</foreign>, p, et h, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> 1, 4, p. 12</bibl>. But it is certain that Lat. F never represents the sound of digamma, and etymologically corresponds to it in but a single root (frango; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">r(h/gnumi</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:Gr. Etym. p. 531" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> Gr. Etym. p. 531</bibl>; Corss. Ausspr. 1, 397 sq. Fick, however, denies any connection between these words, Vergl. Wört. p. 182; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:Gr. Etym. p. 511" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> Gr. Etym. p. 511</bibl>; <foreign lang="greek">r(i=gos</foreign>, Lat. frigus, was never digammated). The sound of F was nearly that of the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">f</foreign>, but rougher, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:4:14" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 4, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:29" default="NO">12, 10, 29</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> 1, 4, p. 14</bibl>; Mar. Vict. p. 2455 P. Initial F in Latin corresponds to an original Indo-European <sense id="n17451.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">bh</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dh</hi>, and <hi rend="ital">gh</hi>: 1. To <hi rend="ital">bh</hi>, as in fari, fama, Sanscr. root bha-; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">fa-, fhmi/</foreign>: ferre, Sanscr. bhar-; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">fe/rw</foreign>: fuga, Sanscr. bhug-, to bend; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">fugh/</foreign>; 2. To <hi rend="ital">dh</hi>, as in firmus, Sanscr. dhar-, to support: ferus, Sanscr. dhvar-, to destroy; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">qh/r</foreign> (<foreign lang="greek">fh/r</foreign>): fumus, Sanscr. dhumas, smoke; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">qu/ein</foreign>; 3. To <hi rend="ital">gh</hi>, as in far, farina, Sanscr. gharsh-, to rub: formus, Sanscr. ghar-, to burn; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">qermo/s</foreign>, etc. In situations not initial these original sounds commonly gave place in Latin to <hi rend="ital">b</hi>, or were weakened to <hi rend="ital">h</hi> (v. Corss. Ausspr. 1, 140 sqq.). In writing Greek words, <foreign lang="greek">f</foreign> was represented by p or b, the Latins having no means of expressing the aspiration (<hi rend="ital">p-h</hi>, not like Engl. <hi rend="ital">ph</hi> or <hi rend="ital">f</hi>) until the post-Aug. period; but in the later writings and inscr. <foreign lang="greek">f</foreign> is generally represented by <hi rend="ital">f</hi> (Corss. Ausspr. 1, 173; Roby, Lat. Gram. 1, p. 33). Respecting the use of the reversed F (!*?) for V, see under that letter. As an abbreviation, F stands for fili, functus, faciundum. F. C., faciundum curavit. FF., fecerunt. F. I., fieri jussit. FL. P., flamen perpetuus. F. P. C., filius ponendum curavit. F. M., fecit monumentum. F.A., filio amantissimo. F. C. H., fieri curavit heres. FR. or FRU., frumentum, frumentarius.</sense></entryFree>
faba: <entryFree id="n17452" type="main" key="fa^ba"><orth extent="full" lang="la">făba</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>for fag-va, Sanscr. root bhaj-, to divide, share; bhak-tam, food; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">fag-ei=n</foreign>, to eat; cf. fāgus</etym>, <sense id="n17452.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bean</hi>, Vicia faba, Linn.; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">ku/amos</foreign>, more correctly, perh., our <hi rend="ital">horse-bean.</hi> </sense><sense id="n17452.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop., <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 35, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:44:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 44, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:10:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 10, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 12, 30, § 117</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:133" default="NO" valid="yes">19, 8, 40, § 133</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:40" default="NO" valid="yes">27, 5, 23, § 40</bibl>: perque fabam repunt (grues) et mollia crura reponunt, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. G. 3, 76</bibl> (Ann. v. 545 ed. Vahl.); <cit><quote lang="la">not eaten by the Pythagoreans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:30:62" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 30, 62</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 58, 119</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:6:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 6, 63</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:11:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 11, 4</bibl>; and neither to be touched nor named by the Flamen Dialis, Fab. Pict. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:15:12" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 15, 12</bibl>; Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=87:13" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 87, 13</bibl> Müll.—</sense><sense id="n17452.2" n="B" level="2"> Prov. </sense><sense id="n17452.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">St.</hi> Repperi. <hi rend="ital">Ly.</hi> Quid repperisti? <hi rend="ital">St.</hi> Non quod pueri clamitant, In faba se repperisse, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 5, 11</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n17452.4" n="2" level="3"> Istaec in me cudetur faba, i. e. <hi rend="ital">I shall have to smart for it</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:3:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 3, 89</bibl> Don.—</sense><sense id="n17452.5" n="3" level="3"> Tam perit quam extrema faba, in proverbio est, quod ea plerumque aut proteritur aut decerpitur a praetereuntibus, Fest. S. V. TAM, p. 363, 17 Müll.—</sense><sense id="n17452.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of things of a similar shape: of <hi rend="ital">grains of wheat</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 10, 21, § 95</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">faba caprini fimi,</quote> <trans><tr>goat's dung</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:185" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 19, 12, 60, § 185</bibl></cit>.—As a measure, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 3, 12, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
fabaceus: <entryFree id="n17453" type="main" key="fa^ba_ce^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">făbācĕus</orth> (also <orth extent="full" lang="la">făbācĭus</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>faba</etym>, <sense id="n17453.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">consisting of beans</hi>, = fabalis (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">messis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Nov. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puls,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 12 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi> (sc. puls): <orth extent="full" lang="la">făbācĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 12, 30, § 118</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:5:6" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 5, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
fabacia: <entryFree id="n17454" type="main" key="fa^ba_ci^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">făbācĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. fabaceus.</entryFree>
fabaginus: <entryFree id="n17455" type="hapax" key="fa^ba_gi^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">făbāgĭnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>faba</etym>, <sense id="n17455.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of beans</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bean-</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">acus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 54, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fabalis: <entryFree id="n17456" type="main" key="fa^ba_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">făbālis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">făbūl-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n17456.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to beans</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bean-</hi>: seges, Varr. R. R. <cb n="FABE" /> 1, 31, 4: <cit><quote lang="la">stipulae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:725" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 725</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17456.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">făbālĭa</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">bean-stalks</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 37, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:23:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 23, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:10:9" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 10, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 25, 69, § 141</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:120" default="NO" valid="yes">18, 12, 30, § 120</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
fabaris: <entryFree id="n17457" type="main" key="Fa^ba^ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Făbăris</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n17457.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small tributary of the Tiber in the country of the Sabines</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Farfa</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:715" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 715</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">the same called Farfărus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:330" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 330</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fabarius: <entryFree id="n17458" type="main" key="fa^ba_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">făbārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>faba</etym>. <sense id="n17458.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to beans</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bean-</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pilum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 10, 5</bibl></cit>: Calendae, i. e. <hi rend="ital">of June</hi> (because then an offering was made of the first beans), acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">‡ negociatio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2515</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17458.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Făbārĭa</orth>, <hi rend="ital">an island of the German Ocean</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Borkurn</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 13, 27, § 97</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:121" default="NO" valid="yes">18, 12, 30, § 121</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n17458.2" n="III" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">făbārĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a female dealer in beans</hi>, Inscr. <bibl default="NO"><author>Donat.</author> 465, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
fabatarium: <entryFree id="n17459" type="hapax" key="fa^ba_ta_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">făbātārĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>fabatus</etym>, <sense id="n17459.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a vessel</hi> (perh. filled with bean-soup), <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Heliog. 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
fabatus: <entryFree id="n17460" type="main" key="fa^ba_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">făbātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>faba</etym>. <sense id="n17460.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Made of beans</hi>: puls, Fest. s. v. refriva, p. 277, 24 Müll.—</sense><sense id="n17460.1" n="II" level="1"> Fabatus, <hi rend="ital">a Roman surname</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 12, 2</bibl>; Asin. Poll. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:33:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 33, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
fabella: <entryFree id="n17461" type="main" key="fa_bella"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fābella</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>fabula</etym>, <sense id="n17461.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a brief narrative</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a short history</hi>, <hi rend="ital">story</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n17461.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil debet esse in philosophia commentariis fabellis loci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:38:80" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 38, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:2:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 2, 5, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in fabellam excedere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 77" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 77 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n17461.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n17461.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A short fable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a tale</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:7:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 7, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Haec (anus) tibi fabellas referat, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:3:85" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 3, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aniles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:6:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 6, 78</bibl></cit>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">narrare fabellam asello,</quote> <trans><tr>to preach to a stone</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 200</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17461.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A short play</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:16:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 16, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec tota fabella, quam est sine argumento!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:27:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 27, 64</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
faber: <entryFree id="n17462" type="main" key="fa^ber1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">făber</orth>, <itype>bri</itype> (<sense id="n17462.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> most freq. fabrum; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">jam ut censoriae tabulae loquuntur, fabrum et procum audeo dicere, non fabrorum et procorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:46:156" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 46, 156</bibl></cit>: fabrum, Caes. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 8</bibl>, C, 2; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:24:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 24, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:1 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 1, 1, § 1 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fabrorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:2:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 2, 54</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:56:section=147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 56, § 147</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:182 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 15, 51, § 182 al.</bibl>), <gen>m.</gen> <etym>Sanscr. root bha-, gleam, shine; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">fhmi/</foreign>, say, <foreign lang="greek">fai/nw</foreign>, show; cf. for</etym>, <hi rend="ital">a worker in wood</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stone</hi>, <hi rend="ital">metal</hi>, etc., <hi rend="ital">a forger</hi>, <hi rend="ital">smith</hi>, <hi rend="ital">artificer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">carpenter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">joiner</hi> (syn.: artifex, opifex, operarius), <foreign lang="greek">te/ktwn</foreign>. </sense><sense id="n17462.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop. </sense><sense id="n17462.2" n="A" level="2"> With <pos>adj.</pos> of material, etc., specifying the trade: <cit><quote lang="la">tamen ego me Phidiam esse mallem, quam vel optimum fabrum tignarium,</quote> <trans><tr>carpenter</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:73:257" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 73, 257</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">tignarius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4087</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">fabros tignarios dicimus non eos duntaxat, qui tigna dolant, sed omnes, qui aedificant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:16:235" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 16, 235</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut fortunati sunt fabri ferrarii, Qui apud carbones assident!</quote> <trans><tr>blacksmiths</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:6:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 2, 6, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fabrum aerariorum conlegium,</quote> <trans><tr>copper-smiths</tr>, <tr>braziers</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 1, 1, § 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">marmoris aut eboris fabros aut aeris amavit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">‡ eburarius, Inscr. ap. Spon. Misc. p. 222: ‡ intestinarius,</quote> <trans><tr>one who does the fine carved work in wood for the interior of a building</tr>, <tr>a joiner</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4182</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">‡ a Corinthiis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 4181</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">‡ oculariarius,</quote> <trans><tr>one who made silver eyes for statues</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 4185</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17462.3" n="B" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut arcessatur faber, ut istas compedis tibi adimam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:5:4:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 5, 4, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cogito, utrum me dicam medicum ducere an fabrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 5, 3, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hominem pro fabro aut pro tectore emere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:25:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 25, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fabri ad aedificandam rem publicam,</quote> <trans><tr>work-people</tr>, <tr>workmen</tr>, <tr>laborers</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 2, 5</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:19:section=48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 19, § 48</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex legionibus fabros delegit,</quote> <trans><tr>the workmen belonging to the army</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:11:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 11, 3</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">whose overseer was called praefectus fabrūm,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:24:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 24, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">His fabris crescunt patrimonia,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>these smiths know how to add to their patrimonies</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:116" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 116</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">faber volans, i. e. Icarus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:54" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 54</bibl></cit>.— Prov.: faber est quisque fortunae suae, <hi rend="ital">every man is the maker of his own fortune</hi>, Appius ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:de Republ. Ordin. 1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> de Republ. Ordin. 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n17463" type="main" key="fa^ber2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">făber</orth>, <itype>bra, brum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. faber</etym>, <sense id="n17463.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">workmanlike</hi>, <hi rend="ital">skilful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ingenious</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">ars,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:159" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 159</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:383" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 3, 383</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">levitas speculi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 282</bibl></cit>. —<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">signaculum faberrimum anuli aurei,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. p. 346</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">fā^bre</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in a workmanlike manner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">skilfully</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ingeniously</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc factum est fabre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 1, 2, 23</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:4:1:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 4, 1, 64</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">teres trabs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:14" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 14</bibl></cit>, <cb n="FABR" /> 320; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:35:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 35, 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sigillatum vitrum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 123</bibl></cit> (cf. fabrefacio).—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">facta navis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 11, p. 262 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aptare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 20, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n17464" type="main" key="fa^ber3" n="3"><orth extent="full" lang="la">făber</orth>, <itype>bri</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n17464.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the dory</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a sunfish</hi> (Zaeus faber, Linn.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 18, 32, § 86</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:148" default="NO" valid="yes">32, 11, 53, § 148</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:16:9" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 16, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,014:110" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Hal. 110</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
faberius: <entryFree id="n17465" type="main" key="Fa^be^ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Făbĕrĭus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, <sense id="n17465.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a Roman gens</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:25:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 25, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">15, 13, 3</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n17465.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Făbĕrĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Faberius</hi> (a debtor of Cicero): <cit><quote lang="la">negotium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:31:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 31, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 29, 3</bibl>; 12, 31, 2.</sense></entryFree>
fabius: <entryFree id="n17466" type="main" key="Fa^bi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Făbĭus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, <sense id="n17466.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a Roman gens</hi>, concerning which see <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 48</bibl>-50; among its distinguished members were, </sense><sense id="n17466.1" n="1" level="3"> Fabius Pictor, <hi rend="ital">a historian</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 12</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n17466.2" n="2" level="3"> Q. Fabius Maximus Cunctator, <hi rend="ital">the famous dictator in the second Punic war</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:3:9" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 3, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22</bibl> <hi rend="ital">passim.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n17466.3" n="3" level="3"> M. Fabius Quintilianus, <hi rend="ital">author of the rhetorical work</hi> Institutiones Oratoriae, <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Prof. 1, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:90" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 90</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n17466.4" n="4" level="3"> Paulus Fabius Persicus, <hi rend="ital">consul under Tiberius</hi>, A.U.C. 786, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 2:21:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 2, 21, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:14" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 14</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n17466.5" n="II" level="1"> Hence, </sense><sense id="n17466.6" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Făbĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a Fabius</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Fabian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lex, de ambitu and de plagiariis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:34:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 34, 71</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Perd. 3, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48</bibl>, tit. 15; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:17:2:51" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 17, 2, 51</bibl>: fornix, <hi rend="ital">a triumphal arch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">built by Q. Fabius Maximus Allobrogicus on the</hi> Sacra Via, <hi rend="ital">in the neighborhood of the</hi> Regia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:7:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 7, 17</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">called also Fornix Fabii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:66:267" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 66, 267</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and Fornix Fabianus, v. under B.: lupercus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 1, 26; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">under B.: tribus,</quote> <trans><tr>one of the rural tribes</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 6, 52</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17466.7" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Făbĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, the same: <cit><quote lang="la">fornix, i. q. Fabius fornix (v. above),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:7:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 7, 19</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">also called arcus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Const. Sap. 1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Const. Sap. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Fabianae artes,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>delay</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 34</bibl></cit>: ‡ Fabiani et ‡ Quintilian appellabantur luperci, a Fabio et Quintilio praepositis suis, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=87" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 87</bibl> Müll. —<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Făbĭāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">persons of the Fabian tribe</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:40" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 40</bibl>; also <hi rend="ital">the soldiers of Fabius</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Iphicr. 2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Iphicr. 2, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
fabrateria: <entryFree id="n17467" type="main" key="Fa_^bra_te^ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Fā^brātĕrĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n17467.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small town in Latium</hi>, <hi rend="ital">situated on the Via Latina</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">S. Giovanni in Carico</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:24:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 24, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:15:4" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 15, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:224" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 224</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Its inhabitants</hi> are called <orth extent="full" lang="la">Fabrāterni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:68:192" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 68, 192</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:19:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 19, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 9, § 64</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 101 sq.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
fabre: <entryFree id="n17468" type="main" key="fa_^bre_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fā^brē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <sense id="n17468.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">skilfully</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ingeniously;</hi> v. 2. faber <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
fabrefacio: <entryFree id="n17469" type="main" key="fa_^bre_fa^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fā^brē-făcĭo</orth>, <itype>fēci, factum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n17469.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make</hi>, <hi rend="ital">frame</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fashion</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">do skilfully</hi> (very rare; perh. to be written separately fabre facio). </sense><sense id="n17469.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">classem fabrefecit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Vir. Ill. 38:1" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Vir. Ill. 38, 1</bibl></cit> (dub., al. fabricavit): <cit><quote lang="la">fabrefieri ex auro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:31:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 31, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">levioribus et ad id fabrefactis navigiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:27:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 27, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">argenti aerisque fabrefacti vis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:21:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 26, 21, 8</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:52:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 34, 52, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 29, 1</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n17469.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">fallaciam,</quote> <trans><tr>to forge</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:5:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 5, 1, 8</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">fecit fabre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:4:1:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 4, 1, 64</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fabrefactus: <entryFree id="n17470" type="main" key="fa_^bre_factus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fā^brēfactus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from fa brefacio.</entryFree>
fabrefio: <entryFree id="n17471" type="main" key="fa_^bre_fi_o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fā^brēfīo</orth>, <itype>factus sum, fĭĕri</itype> <etym><hi rend="ital">pass.</hi> of fabrefacio</etym>, <sense id="n17471.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be made</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fashioned skilfully</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:31:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 31, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
fabrica: <entryFree id="n17472" type="main" key="fa_^bri^ca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fā^brĭca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>1. faber</etym>, <sense id="n17472.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the workshop of an artisan</hi> who works in hard materials (syn.: taberna, officina). </sense><sense id="n17472.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:2:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 2, 45</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 6, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Vulcanus, qui Lemni fabricae traditur praefuisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:22:55" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 22, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">armorum,</quote> <trans><tr>armory</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 2, 11</bibl></cit> (for which: <cit><quote lang="la">armorum officinae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 34 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>).—</sense><sense id="n17472.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the art</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trade</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">profession of such an artisan</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 1, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pictura et fabrica ceteraeque artes habent quendam absoluti operis effectum,</quote> <trans><tr>architecture</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:13:35" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 13, 35</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:51:161" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 51, 161</bibl>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">natura effectum esse mundum: nihil opus fuisse fabrica,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 20, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnis fabrica aeris et ferri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:60:150" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 60, 150</bibl></cit>: aeraria, ferrea, materiaria, <hi rend="ital">the art of working in brass</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:197 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 56, 57, § 197 sq.</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aerariae artis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:36:4:4" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 36, 4, 4</bibl></cit>; and: ejus fabricae, quam Graeci <foreign lang="greek">xalkeutikh\n</foreign> vocant, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:21:10" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 21, 10</bibl>.—In apposition with ars: <cit><quote lang="la">abies Graeco fabricae artis genere spectabilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:225" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 42, 82, § 225</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">servus arte fabrica peritus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:7:19" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 33, 7, 19 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fanum solerti fabrica structum,</quote> <trans><tr>with artistic skill</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 6, p. 174, 25</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17472.3" n="2" level="3"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">any skilful production</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a fabric</hi>, <hi rend="ital">building</hi>, etc.: admirabilis membrorum animantium, <pb n="713" /> <cb n="FABR" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:47:121" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 47, 121</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:35:127" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 35, 127</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 7, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 9, 2 al.</bibl>—Of man as the creature of God, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Hymn. de Rad. Dom. 45</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n17472.4" n="b" level="4"> In the comic writers, <hi rend="ital">a crafty device</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trick</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stratagem</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ei nos facetis fabricis et doctis dolis Glaucumam ob oculos obiciemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:1:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 1, 69</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:2:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cist. 2, 2, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nescio quam fabricam facit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:5:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 5, 2, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:2:3:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 2, 3, 132</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad senem fingere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:2:34 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 2, 34 al.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
fabricabilis: <entryFree id="n17473" type="main" key="fa_^bri^ca_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fā^brĭcābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>fabricor</etym>, <sense id="n17473.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that may be wrought</hi> or <hi rend="ital">formed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">materia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>August.</author> Gen. ad Lit. Op. Impf. 4, 15</bibl></cit>; cf. fabricabilis, <foreign lang="greek">e)rga/simos</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
fabricatio: <entryFree id="n17474" type="main" key="fa_^bri^ca_tio"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fā^brĭcātio</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n17474.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a making</hi>, <hi rend="ital">framing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">structure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">manner of construction</hi> (rare but class.). </sense><sense id="n17474.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">si erit tota hominis fabricatio perspecta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:54:133" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 54, 133</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auri,</quote> <trans><tr>working</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Sirach, 32, 8</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">aedificiorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">artificis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non sentiunt has injurias et contumelias fabricationis suae dei vestri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17474.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of speech, <hi rend="ital">structure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">skilful construction</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:42:167" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 42, 167</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
fabricator: <entryFree id="n17475" type="main" key="fa_^bri^ca_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fā^brĭcātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n17475.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an artificer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">framer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">forger</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contriver</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fabricator</hi> (rare but class.). </sense><sense id="n17475.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille fabricator tanti operis (mundi),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 2</bibl></cit>; so, mundi, Quint, 2, 16, 12; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 57</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">minutorum opusculorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 38, 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipse doli (i. e. equi lignei) fabricator Epeos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:264" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 264</bibl></cit>: deorum, i. e. <hi rend="ital">of statues of the gods</hi>, Firm. Math. 3, 6, 9.—</sense><sense id="n17475.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolor ac morbus leti fabricator uterque est,</quote> <trans><tr>causer</tr>, <tr>producer</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:472" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 472</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fabricatorius: <entryFree id="n17476" type="main" key="fa_^bri^ca_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fā^brĭcātōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n17476.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">creative</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">potentia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>August.</author> Civ. D. 12, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Gen. ad Lit. Op. Impf. 4, 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
fabricatrix: <entryFree id="n17477" type="main" key="fa_^bri^ca_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fā^brĭcātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>fabricator</etym>, <sense id="n17477.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she that contrives</hi>, <hi rend="ital">devises</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">produces</hi> (postclass.).—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">mortis fabricatrix voluptas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 6, 22, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">7, 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epit. 68, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
fabricatus: <entryFree id="n17478" type="hapax" key="fa_^bri^ca_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fā^brĭcātus</orth>, ūs. <gen>m.</gen> <etym>fabricor</etym>, <sense id="n17478.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a skilful production</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contrivance;</hi> trop., <hi rend="ital">device</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fabricatu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 3, 13 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
fabricensis: <entryFree id="n17479" type="main" key="fa^bri^censis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">făbrĭcensis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>fabrica</etym>, <sense id="n17479.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an armorer</hi> (post-class.), Cod. Th. 12, 1, 37; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 1, 9, 3 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 31, 6, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4079</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4186</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
fabricius: <entryFree id="n17480" type="main" key="Fa_bri^ci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Fābrĭcĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>faber</etym>, <sense id="n17480.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">name of a Roman gens. The most celebrated is</hi> C. Fabricius Luscinus, <hi rend="ital">leader of the Romans against Pyrrhus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and famous for his frugality</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and for his noble conduct towards Pyrrhus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:66:268" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 66, 268</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:22:86" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 22, 86</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:25:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 25, 60</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:4:4:3" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 4, 4, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:14" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:9:142" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 9, 142</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:153" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 12, 54, § 153</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n17480.1" n="II" level="1"> Hence, </sense><sense id="n17480.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Fābrĭcĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a Fabricius</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Fabrician</hi>: pons, <hi rend="ital">leading over the Tiber to the island of Aesculapius</hi>, <hi rend="ital">built by one</hi> L. Fabricius, now <hi rend="ital">Ponte di quattro capi</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 36</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n17480.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Fābrĭcĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, the same: venenum, <hi rend="ital">prepared by</hi> C. Fabricius, <hi rend="ital">a friend of</hi> Oppianicus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:66:189" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 66, 189</bibl> (cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 16, 47</bibl>).</sense></entryFree>
fabrico: <entryFree id="n17481" type="main" key="fa^bri^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">făbrĭco</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, v. fabricor.</entryFree>
fabricor: <entryFree id="n17482" type="main" key="fa_^bri^cor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fā^brĭcor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype> (archaic <sense id="n17482.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> fabricarier, Poëta ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:63:159" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 63, 159</bibl>), <hi rend="ital">v. dep. a.</hi>, and (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose) <orth extent="full" lang="la">făbrĭ-co</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>fabrica</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to make out of wood</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stone</hi>, <hi rend="ital">metal</hi>, etc., <hi rend="ital">to frame</hi>, <hi rend="ital">forge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">construct</hi>, <hi rend="ital">build.</hi> </sense><sense id="n17482.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n17482.2" n="(a)" level="5"> Form <hi rend="ital">fabricor</hi>: heu Mulciber, arma ignavo es invictā fabricatus manu, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 5</bibl> (R<bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> Trag. Rel. p. 208</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">ii, qui signa fabricantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:41:147" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 41, 147</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Capitolii fastigium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:46:180" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 46, 180</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gladium, id. Rab. Post, 3, 7: Jovi fulmen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:19:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 19, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">naves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pontes et scalas fabricati,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(mundum) globosum est fabricatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 6</bibl></cit> Orell. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi> et saep.— </sense><sense id="n17482.3" n="(b)" level="5"> Form <hi rend="ital">fabrico</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hunc (cratera) fabricaverat Alcon,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:683" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 683</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">pugnabant armis, quae post fabricaverat usus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ratem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:6:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 6, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fabricavit deceris Liburnicas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:37" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vasa fabricabis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:27:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 27, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,004:32:16 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Num. 32, 16 al.</bibl>—In <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fabricata fago pocula,</quote> <trans><tr>carved</tr>, <tr>made</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:670" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 670</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">simulacra ex auro vel argento fabricata,</quote> <trans><tr>cast</tr>, <tr>molten</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:32" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in amphitheatro ligneo intra anni spatium fabricato,</quote> <trans><tr>built</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tela reponuntur manibus fabricata Cyclopum,</quote> <trans><tr>forged</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:259" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 259</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:16:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 16, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:2:2" default="NO">3, 2, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:79:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 79, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in nostros fabricata est machina muros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 46</bibl></cit>: di qui <cb n="FABU" /> hominis manu fabricati sunt, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,005:4:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Deut. 4, 28</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n17482.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">to prepare</hi>, <hi rend="ital">form</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fashion.</hi> </sense><sense id="n17482.5" n="(a)" level="5"> Form <hi rend="ital">fabricor</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc affirmare potes, Luculle, esse aliquam vim cum prudentia et consilio scilicet, quae finxerit, vel, ut tuo verbo utar, quae fabricata sit hominem?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 27, 87</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quanto quasi artificio natura fabricata esset primum animal omne, deinde hominem maxime,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 10, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opus est fabricanda ad fulmina nubi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:365" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 365</bibl></cit> Lachm. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.;</hi> imitated: <cit><quote lang="la">fabricantes fulmina nubes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 1, 853</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ea ipsa dii immortales ad usum hominum fabricati paene videantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:2:4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 2, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:45:178" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 45, 178</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">prandium opipare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 7, p. 192, 31</bibl></cit>: quod nihil esset clarius <foreign lang="greek">e)nargei/a</foreign>, ut Graeci: <cit><quote lang="la">(perspicuitatem aut evidentiam nos, si placet, nominemus fabricemurque, si opus erit, verba), etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 6, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fabricare quidvis, quidvis comminiscere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:1:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 1, 89</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">compara, fabricare, finge quod lubet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:4:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 4, 4, 42</bibl></cit>. —<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">age modo, fabricamini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:8:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 8, 52</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17482.6" n="(b)" level="5"> Form <hi rend="ital">fabrico</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">philosophia animum format et fabricat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 16:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 16, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui fabricaverat illum (Platonem),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 1, 772</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne fabricate moras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:16:671" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 16, 671</bibl></cit>.—In <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum illa verba fabricentur et memoriae insidant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:7:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 7, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fabricula: <entryFree id="n17483" type="main" key="fa_^bri^cu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fā^brĭcŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>fabrica</etym>, <sense id="n17483.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small workshop</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 8, 28</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
fabrificatio: <entryFree id="n17484" type="hapax" key="fabri^fi^ca_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fabrĭfĭcātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>faber-facio</etym>, <sense id="n17484.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a making</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contriving</hi>, <hi rend="ital">producing</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
