fabrilis: <entryFree id="n17485" type="main" key="fa_^bri_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fā^brīlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>faber</etym>, <sense id="n17485.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to an artificer</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">scalprum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:49:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 49, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opera ad fabrilia surgere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:415" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 415</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dextra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:175" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 175</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vincula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:9:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 9, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gluten,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 8, 7</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">glutinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:182" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 11, 49, § 182</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fumus gratiam affert vinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 14, 1, 3, § 16</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">hence, uva,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>smoke-dried</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 4:3" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 6:38" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 6, 38</bibl></cit>: erratum, <hi rend="ital">of the sculptor</hi> or <hi rend="ital">artist</hi>, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 1, 17</bibl>.—In the <hi rend="ital">neutr. subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">fabrīlĭa</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <hi rend="ital">mechanical tools</hi> or <hi rend="ital">implements</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tractant fabrilia fabri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 116</bibl></cit>.—* <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">fā^brīlĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">skilfully</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in a workmanlike manner</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">opifex fabriliter aptans Composuit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Apoth. 583</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fabriliter: <entryFree id="n17486" type="main" key="fa_^bri_li^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fā^brīlĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. fabrilis <sense id="n17486.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
fabrio: <entryFree id="n17487" type="hapax" key="fa_^bri^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fā^brĭo</orth>, <itype>īvi, 4</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>faber</etym>, <sense id="n17487.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prepare</hi> = fabricor, Ven. Carm. 2, 12, 23.</sense></entryFree>
fabula: <entryFree id="n17488" type="main" key="fa_bu^la1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fābŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>fari</etym>, <sense id="n17488.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a narration</hi>, <hi rend="ital">narrative</hi>, <hi rend="ital">account</hi>, <hi rend="ital">story; the subject of common talk.</hi> </sense><sense id="n17488.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: narratio, fasti, annales, res gestae, historia): additur fabulae, quo vulgo Sabini aureas armillas brachio laevo habuerint, pepigisse eam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:11:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 11, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poëticae (opp. incorrupta rerum gestarum monumenta), id. praef. § 6: Ummidius, qui tam (non longa est fabula) dives, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 95</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mutato nomine de te fabula narratur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 1, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">asinaeque paternum Cognomen vertas in risum et fabula flas,</quote> <trans><tr>the common talk</tr>, <tr>town's talk</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 13, 9</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">heu me, per urbem Fabula quanta fui!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:11:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 11, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fabula (nec sentis) tota jactaris in urbe,</quote> <trans><tr>you are talked of all over the city</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:8:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 8, 1, 21</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:70" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 70</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Dom. 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:14" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">habes omnes fabulas urbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:18:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 18, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nova fabula,</quote> <trans><tr>the news</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:145" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 145</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">semper formosis fabula poena fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:32:26" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 32, 26</bibl></cit> (3, 30, 26 M.): <cit><quote lang="la">a diverticulo repetatur fabula,</quote> <trans><tr>let us return to our story</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:15:72" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 15, 72</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17488.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">conversation</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">ut fabulas quoque eorum et disputationes et arcana semotae dictionis penitus exciperem,</quote> <trans><tr>conversations</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeceptores cum auditoribus suis fabulas habent,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 29</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum inter fabulas privatas sermo esset ortus, quanti, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>in private conversation</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Heliog. 25</bibl></cit>.—With a <hi rend="ital">dependent clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne id accidat, quod cuipiam Thraco venisse usu, fabula est,</quote> <trans><tr>is related</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:12:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 12, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17488.3" n="2" level="3"> In vulg. lang. (like the Germ. Geschichte), <hi rend="ital">affair</hi>, <hi rend="ital">concern</hi>, <hi rend="ital">matter</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed quid ego aspicio? quae haec fabula'st?</quote> <trans><tr>what sort of an affair is this?</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:5:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 5, 2, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 4, 8</bibl>.</sense><sense id="n17488.4" n="II" level="1"> In partic. (freq. and class.), <hi rend="ital">a fictitious narrative</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a tale</hi>, <hi rend="ital">story</hi> (syn.: apologus, narratio): narrationum tris accepimus species, fabulam, quae versatur in tragoediis<cb n="FABU" />  atque carminibus non a veritate modo, sed etiam a forma veritatis remota, argumentum ... historiam, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:4:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 4, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec res agetur nobis, vobis fabula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:prol. 52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. prol. 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">peregrino narrare fabulas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:1:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 5, 1, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">num igitur me cogis etiam fabulis credere? quae delectationis habeant quantum voles ... auctoritatem quidem nullam debemus nec fidem commenticiis rebus adjungere, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:55:113" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 55, 113</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">fictis fabulis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">antiquitas recepit fabulas, fictas etiam nonnumquam incondite,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 10</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">a fabulis ad facta venire,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">minor fabulis habetur fides,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saepe fabulis fidem firmare (consuerant),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:1" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Rhet. 1 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">Liv. praef. § 6: non fabula rumor Ille fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:561" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 561</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fabulam inceptat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:4:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 5, 4, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid tamen ista velit sibi fabula, ede,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:5:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 5, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fabulae!</quote> <trans><tr>mere stories! stuff! nonsense!</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:3:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 3, 95</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:3:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> And. 1, 3, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne convivialium fabularum simplicitas in crimen duceretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 11 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sufficiunt duae fabulae, an tertiam poscis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:20:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 20, 9</bibl></cit>.—In apposition: <cit><quote lang="la">jam te premet nox fabulaeque Manes (= fabulosi, inanes),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:4:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 4, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">civis et manes et fabula fies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:152" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 152</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nos jam fabula sumus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 4, 3, 14</bibl></cit>.—So of <hi rend="ital">idle tales</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ineptas et aniles fabulas devita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,015:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Tim. 4, 7</bibl></cit> al.—</sense><sense id="n17488.5" n="B" level="2"> Of particular kinds of poetry. </sense><sense id="n17488.6" n="1" level="3"> Most freq., <hi rend="ital">a dramatic poem</hi>, <hi rend="ital">drama</hi>, <hi rend="ital">play</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">ludus, cantus, actio, etc.): in full, fabula scaenica,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 28, 1, 4</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">or, theatralis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 14, 6, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fabula ad actum scenarum composita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 9</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:73 sq" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 73 sq.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Livianae fabulae non satis dignae, quae iterum legantur. Atque hic Livius primus fabulam, C. Clodio Caeci filio et M. Tuditano Cos. docuit,</quote> <trans><tr>produced</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:18:72" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 18, 72</bibl></cit>; v. doceo, II. <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>; cf.: fabulam dare, under do, II. H.; so, <cit><quote lang="la">facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:8" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque histrioni ut placeat, peragenda fabula est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 19, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">securus, cadat an recto stet fabula talo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 176</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neve minor neu sit quinto productior actu Fabula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:190" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 190</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">M. Pacuvii nova fabula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:7:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 7, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Terentii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Attae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 80</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">in fabulis stultissima persona,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:26:100" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 26, 100</bibl></cit> et saep.— <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">non solum unum actum, sed totam fabulam confecissem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:14:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 14, 34</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17488.7" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A fable</hi> (cf. apologus): <cit><quote lang="la">fabularum cur sit inventum genus Brevi docebo, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:3, prol. 33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 3, prol. 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (res) vel apologum, vel fabulam vel aliquam contineat irrisionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:17:25" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 17, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nota illa de membris humanis adversus ventrem discordantibus fabula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:11:19" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 11, 19</bibl></cit> (shortly before, fabella) et saep.—Prov.: Lupus in fabula (like the Engl., <hi rend="ital">talk of the devil</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and he will appear</hi>), of a person who comes just as we are talking about him, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 1, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:33:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 33, 4</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">lupus in sermone,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:4:1:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 4, 1, 71</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
<entryFree id="n17489" type="main" key="fa^bu^la2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">făbŭla</orth>, v. fabulus.</entryFree>
fabularis: <entryFree id="n17490" type="main" key="fa_bu^la_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fābŭlāris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. fabula, II.</etym>, <sense id="n17490.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fabulous</hi> = fabulosus: <cit><quote lang="la">historia fabularis,</quote> <trans><tr>fabulous history</tr>, <tr>legendary tale</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:70" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 70</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Censor.</author> de Die Nat. 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
fabulatio: <entryFree id="n17491" type="main" key="fa_bu^la_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fābŭlātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>fabulor</etym>, <sense id="n17491.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">narration discourse</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">forensis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 6, 189</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:118:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 118, 85</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
fabulator: <entryFree id="n17492" type="main" key="fa_bu^la_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fābŭlātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n17492.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a narrator</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a story-teller</hi> (post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n17492.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">elegantissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 122" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 122 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lectoribus aut fabulatoribus arcessitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:78" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 78</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:10:11" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 10, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Baruch, 3, 23</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n17492.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A fabulist</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aesopus ille e Phrygia fabulator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:29:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 29, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fabulinus: <entryFree id="n17493" type="main" key="Fa_bu^li_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Fābŭlīnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n17493.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a deity that helped children learning to talk</hi>: cum primo fari incipiebant, sacrificabant divo Fabulino, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 532, 27</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
fabulis: <entryFree id="n17494" type="main" key="fa^bu_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">făbūlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, v. fabalis.</entryFree>
fabullus: <entryFree id="n17495" type="main" key="Fabullus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Fabullus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n17495.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a friend of Catullus</hi>, Plin. N. H. praef. § 1.</sense></entryFree>
fabulo: <entryFree id="n17496" type="main" key="fa_bu^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fābŭlo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, v. fabulor.</entryFree>
fabulor: <entryFree id="n17497" type="main" key="fa_bu^lor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fābŭlor</orth>, <itype>ātus</itype> (archaic <sense id="n17497.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inf. praes.</hi> fabularier, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:1:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 3, 1, 77</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:1:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 1, 60</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 60</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:1:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 3, 1, 36</bibl>; also <hi rend="ital">act.</hi> form fabulaverit, Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 232, 26</bibl> dub.: fabulabere, R<bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> v. 147</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fabulem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:5:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 5, 33</bibl></cit> Fleck.), 1, <hi rend="ital">v. dep. a.</hi> [fabula], <hi rend="ital">to speak</hi>, <hi rend="ital">converse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">talk</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chat</hi> (mostly ante- and post-class.; esp. <pb n="714" /> <cb n="FACE" /> freq. in Plaut.; not in Cic.; syn.: aio, inquam, dico, loquor, etc.). </sense><sense id="n17497.1" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: ut pro viribus tacere ac fabulari tute noveris, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 475, 3</bibl> (Trag. v. 182 ed. Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">clare advorsum fabulabor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 144</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reliqua alia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 3, 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut aperte tibi nunc fabuler,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ter.</author> Ph. 4, 3, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod omnes homines fabulantur per vias, Mihi esse filiam inventam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid,</quote> <trans><tr>to say</tr>, <tr>utter</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 39 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(ars medendi) ictum fulmine Aesculapium fabulata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 1, 1, § 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter sese,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:2:2:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:22" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Dom. 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">stabant Fronto et Festus fabulantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:13:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 13, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter fabulandum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:1:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 15, 1, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17497.2" n="B" level="2"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">to speak</hi> a language: <cit><quote lang="la">qui Obsce et Volsce fabulantur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Titin.</author> Com. v. 104</bibl></cit> Rib.</sense></entryFree>
fabulose: <entryFree id="n17498" type="main" key="fa_bu^lo_se_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fābŭlōsē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <sense id="n17498.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fabulously</hi>, v. fabulosus <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
fabulositas: <entryFree id="n17499" type="main" key="fa_bu^lo_si^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fābŭlōsĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>fabulosus</etym>, <sense id="n17499.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fabulous invention;</hi> Gr. <foreign lang="greek">muqopoii+/a</foreign> (post-Aug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:174" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 52, 53, § 174</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:91" default="NO" valid="yes">36, 13, 19, § 91</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 474</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
fabulosus: <entryFree id="n17500" type="main" key="fa_bu^lo_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fābŭlōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>fabula, II.</etym>, <sense id="n17500.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fabulous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">celebrated in fable</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">quae loca fabulosus Lambit Hydaspes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:22:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 22, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">palumbes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fab. aut commenticia res,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:81" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carmina Graecorum,</quote> <trans><tr>rich in fables</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:1:2" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fabulosum arbitror de strigibus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:232" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 39, 95, § 232</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi totum de Tyndaridis fabulosum videtur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:16" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 2, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fabulosa et externis miraculis adsimulata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 11</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">anulus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 1, 4, § 8</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mons Atlas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 1, 1, § 5</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">incredible</hi>, <hi rend="ital">great</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fabulous</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum fabulosa multitudine,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 23, 6, 7</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">fābŭ-lōse</orth>, <hi rend="ital">fabulously</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">insulae fabulose narratae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 11, 53, § 143</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fabulose multa de hominum aevo referens ... et reliqua fabulosius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:153" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 48, 49, § 153</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fabulosius canere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 23, 6</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">narrata colonia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 1, 1, § 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fabulus: <entryFree id="n17501" type="main" key="fa^bu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">făbŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>faba, perh. <hi rend="ital">masc.</hi> in analogy with <foreign lang="greek">ku/amos</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n17501.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small bean</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 70, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:31:4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 31, 4</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">Gell, 4, 11, 1 and 10: fabulis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:5:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 5, 4, 8</bibl></cit> (where a nom. fabula is sometimes unnecessarily assumed).</sense></entryFree>
facelare: <entryFree id="n17502" type="main" key="fa^ce_la_re"><orth extent="full" lang="la">făcēlāre</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, v. faselaria.</entryFree>
facelinus: <entryFree id="n17503" type="main" key="Fa^ce^li_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Făcĕlīnus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Phac-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Făcĕ-lītis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Phac-</orth>), or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Fascĕlis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Phasc-</orth>), <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym><foreign lang="greek">fa/kelos</foreign>, a bundle of fagots</etym>, <sense id="n17503.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Taurian Diana</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sedes Dianae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:14:260" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 14, 260</bibl></cit> dub.; v. Gerlach ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0043,001:page=11" default="NO"><author>Lucil.</author> p. 11</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 116</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 261" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 261</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
facesso: <entryFree id="n17504" type="main" key="fa^cesso"><orth extent="full" lang="la">făcesso</orth>, <itype>cessi, ītum, 3</itype>, <sense id="n17504.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. intens. a.</hi> and <gen>n.</gen> <etym>facio, like capesso from capio</etym>. </sense><sense id="n17504.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to do eagerly</hi> or <hi rend="ital">earnestly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to despatch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perform</hi>, <hi rend="ital">execute</hi>, <hi rend="ital">accomplish.</hi> </sense><sense id="n17504.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen. (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): latrones dicta facessunt, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 306, 23</bibl> (Ann. v. 60 ed. Vahl.): dicta, Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 306, 26</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">jussa facessunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:295" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 295</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">matris praecepta facessit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:548" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 4, 548</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mille facesse jocos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:367" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 367</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dictum facessas doctum,</quote> <trans><tr>bring to an end</tr>, <tr>be done with</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:1:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 2, 1, 24</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17504.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic., in a bad sense, <hi rend="ital">to bring on</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cause</hi>, <hi rend="ital">occasion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">create</hi> (Ciceron.): <cit><quote lang="la">de temeritate eorum, qui tibi negotium facesserent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 10, 1</bibl></cit>: cf. in the <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si cui forte hac lege negotium facessetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:57:158" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 57, 158</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:64:section=142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 64, § 142</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">innocenti periculum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:14:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 14, 45</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 43</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem facesso,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:4:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 4, 17</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17504.4" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, sc. se, <hi rend="ital">to go away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">retire</hi>, <hi rend="ital">depart</hi> (class.): vos facessite, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 306, 29</bibl> (Trag. v. 191 ed. Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">ab omni societate rei publicae paulisper facessant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:13:39" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 13, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">propere ex urbe, ab ore atque oculis populi Romani,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:17:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 17, 8</bibl></cit>: aedibus, Titin. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 306, 31</bibl>: cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">propere urbe finibusque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:58:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 58, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hinc,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:58:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 58, 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0404,001:ib. 307:3" default="NO"><author>Afran.</author> ib. 307, 3</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">hinc Tarquinios,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:47:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 47, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">operae facessant, servitia sileant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 38 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facessere interim privatam amicitiam jubet, cum mandata patriae intercedant,</quote> <trans><tr>to be at an end</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:34:4" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 34, 4</bibl></cit>.—In a play upon the two meanings (cf. I. A.): <hi rend="ital">Tr.</hi> Ego opinor rem facesso. <hi rend="ital">Gr.</hi> Si quidem sis pudicus, hinc facessas, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:4:19 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 4, 19 sq.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
facete: <entryFree id="n17505" type="main" key="fa^ce_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">făcētē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. facetus <sense id="n17505.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
facetia: <entryFree id="n17506" type="main" key="fa^ce_ti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">făcētĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>facetus; cf.: argutiae, deliciae</etym>, <sense id="n17506.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a jest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">witticism; drollery</hi>, <hi rend="ital">piece of humor.</hi> </sense><sense id="n17506.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi> (ante- and post-class.): <cb n="FACE" /> haec facetiast, amare inter se rivalis duos, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:5:4:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 5, 4, 47</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">jocularis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 1:1:21" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 1, 1, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facetia sermonis Plauto congruentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:3:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facetiae habere, res divinas deridere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. 56, p. 310, 27</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n17506.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">făcētĭae</orth>, ārum. </sense><sense id="n17506.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A witty</hi> or <hi rend="ital">clever thing</hi> in action or behavior (Plautin.): <cit><quote lang="la">mulier, quoi facetiarum cor corpusque sit plenum et doli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:186" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 186</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fecisti, here, facetias, quom, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:5:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 5, 2, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17506.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Wit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">witty sayings</hi>, <hi rend="ital">witticisms</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pleasantry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">drollery</hi>, <hi rend="ital">humor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">facetiousness</hi> (class.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: sal, dicacitas, cavillatio, lepos, urbanitas, comitas): (sales), quorum duo genera sunt, unum facetiarum, alterum dicacitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:26:87" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 26, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum duo genera sint facetiarum ... illa a veteribus superior cavillatio, haec altera dicacitas nominata est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:54:218" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 54, 218</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facetiis autem maxime homines delectari, si quando risus conjuncte, re verboque moveatur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 61, 248</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">P. Scipio omnes sale facetiisque superabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:34:128" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 34, 128</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">festivitate et facetiis C. Julius et superioribus et aequalibus suis omnibus praestitit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 48, 177</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sale tuo et lepore et politissimis facetiis pellexisti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:57:243" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 57, 243</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">accedat oportet lepos quidam facetiaeque,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 5, 17</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">dulces Latini leporis facetiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:17:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 17, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facetiarum quidam lepos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:34:159" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 34, 159</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facie magis quam facetiis ridiculus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Att 1, 13, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego mirifice capior facetiis, maxime nostratibus (corresp. to sales),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 15, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">asperis facetiis illusus,</quote> <trans><tr>sarcasms</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 68</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">acerbae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per facetias incusare aliquem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
facetior: <entryFree id="n17507" type="main" key="fa^ce_ti^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">făcētĭor</orth>, <itype>āri</itype>, <sense id="n17507.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi> [facetus], <hi rend="ital">to talk wittily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be facetious</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 3, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
facetus: <entryFree id="n17508" type="main" key="fa^ce_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">făcētus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>root fa- of fari; Sanscr. bhā-, shine, appear; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">fa</foreign>- in <foreign lang="greek">fhmi/, fai/nw</foreign>; strengthened făc, as in fax, facies</etym>, <sense id="n17508.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">well-made</hi>, <hi rend="ital">choice</hi>, <hi rend="ital">elegant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fine.</hi> </sense><sense id="n17508.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (very rare): nae illi sunt pedes faceti ac deliciis ingredienti molles, Brutus ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:20" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">facetis victibus vivere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:1:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 1, 43</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17508.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n17508.3" n="A" level="2"> Of behavior, <hi rend="ital">fine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">courteous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">polite</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gentle</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">vir facetus atque magnificus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:2:2:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 2, 2, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mulier commoda et faceta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 2, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut cuique est aetas, ita quemque facetus adopta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 6, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">est qui (ambulet tunicis) subductis usque facetus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>who thinks to be very fine</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 2, 26</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17508.4" n="B" level="2"> Of speech. * </sense><sense id="n17508.5" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Elegant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">molle atque facetum Vergilio annuerunt gaudentes rure Camenae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:10:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 10, 44</bibl></cit>; cf.: decoris hanc et excultae cujusdam elegantiae appellationem (<hi rend="ital">faceti</hi>) puto, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:20" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 20</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n17508.6" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Merry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">witty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">jocose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">humorous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">facetious</hi> (the predominant signif. of the word). </sense><sense id="n17508.7" n="a" level="4"> Of persons: dulcem et facetum festivique sermonis atque in omni sermone simulatorem, quem <foreign lang="greek">ei)/rwna</foreign> Graeci nominarunt, Socratem accepimus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:30:108" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 30, 108</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">elegantes, faceti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:16:63" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 16, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">esse quamvis facetum atque salsum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:56:228" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 56, 228</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in altercando cum aliquo aculeo et maledicto facetus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:47:173" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 47, 173</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imitatores et narratores faceti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:54:219" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 54, 219</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">etiam quodam loco facetus esse voluisti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:8:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 8, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conviva joco mordente facetus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:9:10" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 9, 10</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n17508.8" n="b" level="4"> Of inanim. and abstr. things: <cit><quote lang="la">duplex omnino est jocandi genus: unum illiberale, petulans, flagitiosum, obscenum, alterum elegans, urbanum, ingeniosum, facetum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:29:104" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 29, 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ironia faceta et elegans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:85:292" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 85, 292</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">faceta et urbana innumerabilia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:56:227" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 56, 227</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 8, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dictum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 54, 219</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">joci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:39:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 39, 2</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: Quo facetior videare, Lucil. ap. Fest. s. v. REDARGUISSE, p. 273, 10 Müll. —<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aristophanes facetissimus poëta veteris comoediae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:15:37" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 15, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">argutiae facetissimi salis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 10, 37, § 117</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">făcēte</orth>, </sense><sense id="n17508.9" n="1" level="3"> (Acc. to II. A.) <hi rend="ital">Finely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">properly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">elegantly</hi> (anteclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">hanc ego rem exorsus sum facete et callide,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 4, 1, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:1:1:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 1, 1, 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:3:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 1, 3, 114</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">facete dictum,</quote> <trans><tr>well said! good!</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:1:2:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 1, 2, 73</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:2:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 2, 57</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 1, 37</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n17508.10" n="2" level="3"> (Acc. to II. B.) <hi rend="ital">Wittily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pleasantly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">humorously</hi>, <hi rend="ital">facetiously</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">numquam tam male est Siculis, quin aliquid facete et commode dicant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:43:section=95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 43, § 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facete et urbane Stoicos ridere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:11:39" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 11, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa colligere ridicule ac facete,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:57:243" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 57, 243</bibl></cit>: praeclare et <cb n="FACI" /> apposite et facete scripsit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:23:11" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 23, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Cicero) plura quam quisquam dixit facete,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 4</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nos ab isto nebulone facetius eludimur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:44:128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 44, 128</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">disputare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:54:217" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 54, 217</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">noster hic facetissime tres de jure civili libellos tribus legendos dedit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:55:223" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 55, 223</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ludere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 9:22:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 22, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
facies: <entryFree id="n17509" type="main" key="fa^ci^es"><orth extent="full" lang="la">făcĭes</orth>, <itype>ēi</itype> (old form facies, rarely facii, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:8:14:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 8, 14, 1</bibl>: <sense id="n17509.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">facie,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:4:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 4, 36</bibl></cit>; <case>dat.</case> facie, facii, Gell. l. l.; <number>plur.</number> very rare; <case>nom.</case> and <case>acc.</case> facies, <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Thren. 5, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,049:42:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Jer. 42, 12</bibl>; <case>dat.</case> faciebus, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Eph. 3, 5</bibl>), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>root fa- of fari, strengthened fac-; cf. fax, facetus</etym>. </sense><sense id="n17509.1" n="I" level="1"> Orig., <hi rend="ital">make</hi>, <hi rend="ital">form</hi>, <hi rend="ital">configuration</hi>, <hi rend="ital">figure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shape.</hi> </sense><sense id="n17509.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen. (= universa corporis forma; cf.: figura, species): Quidam faciem esse hominis putant os tantum et oculos et genas, quod Graeci <foreign lang="greek">proswpon</foreign> dicunt: quando <hi rend="ital">facies</hi> sit forma omnis et modus et factura quaedam corporis totius, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:29" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 29</bibl>: Sardinia in Africo mari facie vestigii humani, Sall. H. ap. Gell. l. l.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:2:151 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 2, 151 sq.</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 52, 27 sq.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non est formosa, cujus crus laudatur aut brachium, sed illa, cujus universa facies admirationem singulis partibus abstulit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 33" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 33</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1169 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1169 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 87</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n17509.3" n="2" level="3"> Of things: <hi rend="ital">Dae.</hi> Dicito, quid insit, et qua facie, memorato onmia ... <hi rend="ital">Pa.</hi> Sunt crepundia. <hi rend="ital">Dae.</hi> Qua facie sunt? <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:4:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 4, 105</bibl> and 111: <cit><quote lang="la">curvata in montis faciem circumstetit unda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:361" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 361</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec facies Trojae, cum caperetur, erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:3:26" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 3, 26</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">urbium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 17 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">antequam Vesuvius faciem loci verteret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arboris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 14, 31, § 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vehiculi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:30:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 30, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alia illi caeli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 17, 21, § 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ossa contusa in faciem pulveris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:18:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 18, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">longa quibus facies ovis erit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 4, 12</bibl></cit> et saep. —</sense><sense id="n17509.4" n="3" level="3"> Prov.: verte omnes tete in facies, i. e. <hi rend="ital">resort to every expedient</hi> (an expression borrowed from, and alluding to, the changes of Proteus), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:891" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 891</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n17509.5" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">face</hi>, <hi rend="ital">visage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">countenance</hi> (most freq. in class. Lat.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: os, vultus, frons, lineamenta): facies homini tantum: ceteris os aut rostra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 51, § 138</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in facie vultuque nostro cum sint decem aut paulo plura membra, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 1, 1, § 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non quaeruntur ea, quae nobis non possumus fingere, facies, vultus, sonus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:28:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 28, 127</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prorsus in facie vultuque vecordia inerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 15:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 15, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qua facie, qua statura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:16:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 16, 41</bibl></cit>: uretur facies; <cit><quote lang="la">urentur sole capilli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:9:15" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 9, 15</bibl></cit>: cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:5:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 5, 43</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sumit utrumque Inde habitum facies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:9:20" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 9, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">peregrina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 4, 2, 9</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">affers faciem novam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 29, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">liberali (homo),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 2, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">egregiā (virgo),</quote> <trans><tr>of rare beauty</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:2:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 1, 2, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hispida,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:10:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 10, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cicatricosa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:1:61" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 1, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adversa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:13:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 13, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">curvo nec faciem litore demovet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:5:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 5, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de facie quidem nosti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:32:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 32, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">recta facie loqui,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>boldly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:401" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 401</bibl></cit> et saep.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cura dabit faciem, facies neglecta peribit,</quote> <trans><tr>a beautiful face</tr>, <tr>beauty</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 105</bibl></cit>.— Prov.: perfricare faciem, <hi rend="ital">to lay aside shame</hi>, Plin. H. N. praef. § 4; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:160" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 160</bibl>.</sense><sense id="n17509.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">external form</hi>, <hi rend="ital">look</hi>, <hi rend="ital">condition</hi>, <hi rend="ital">appearance</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">set qua faciest tuus sodalis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:4:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 4, 113</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:7:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 2, 7, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fateantur, in Maeandrii persona esse expressam faciem civitatis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 22, 13</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">(C. Popilius) senatus faciem secum attulerat auctoritatemque Populi Romani,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:8:8:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 8, 8, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">una senum facies, cum voce trementia membra, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:198" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 198</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus rebus immutata facies urbis erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 31:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 31, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">formam quidem ipsam et tamquam faciem honesti vides,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:5:14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 5, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:88" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 6, 88</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:1:42" default="NO">4, 1, 42</bibl> Spald.: <cit><quote lang="la">quarum (causarum) varia ac nova semper est facies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:4:28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 4, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plures eloquentiae facies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:69" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 10, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(inventiunculae) facie ingenii blandiuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:5:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 5, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec ulla facies mali erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:11:22" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 11, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad istam faciem est morbus qui me macerat,</quote> <trans><tr>has that form</tr>, <tr>is of such a nature</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:1:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 1, 1, 73</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17509.7" n="2" level="3"> In partic., in Tac. for the class. species, <hi rend="ital">external appearance</hi>, as opposed to reality, <hi rend="ital">a pretence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pretext;</hi> publici consilii facie (= specie), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 13, 28</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 20, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n17509.8" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose, for the class. aspectus, <hi rend="ital">look</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sight</hi>, <hi rend="ital">aspect</hi>: quae scelerum <pb n="715" /> <cb n="FACI" /> facies? <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:560" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 560</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">subita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:367" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 367</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">decora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:56:5" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 56, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">memoranda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 35:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 35, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">foeda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 82:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 82, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vineae unam faciem contexunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:6:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 5, 6, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exceptio, quae prima facie justa videatur,</quote> <trans><tr>at first sight</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 4:1" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prima facie,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:16:1:13" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 16, 1, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 87:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 87, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 5:10:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Contr. 5, 10, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
facile: <entryFree id="n17510" type="main" key="fa^ci^le^"><orth extent="full" lang="la">făcĭlĕ</orth>, <sense id="n17510.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adv., easily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unquestionably</hi>, <hi rend="ital">readily</hi>, etc., v. facilis <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
facilis: <entryFree id="n17511" type="main" key="fa^ci^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">făcĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> (archaic forms <sense id="n17511.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">nom. sing.</hi> facil, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:2:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 2, 53</bibl>; <pos>adv.</pos> facul, like difficul, simul; v. under <pos>adv.</pos> 2, and cf. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=87" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 87</bibl> Müll.), [facio, properly, that may be done or made; hence, pregn.], <hi rend="ital">easy to do</hi>, <hi rend="ital">easy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">without difficulty.</hi> </sense><sense id="n17511.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n17511.2" n="A" level="2"> Prop., constr. <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, with <hi rend="ital">ad</hi> (and the <hi rend="ital">gerund</hi>), the <hi rend="ital">supine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>, and the <case>dat.</case> </sense><sense id="n17511.3" n="(a)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">nulla est tam facilis res, quin difficilis siet, quam invitus facias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 6, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">facilis et plana via (opp. difficilis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 2, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae facilia ex difficillimis animi magnitudo redegerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 27 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also: mihi in causa facili atque explicata perdifficilis et lubrica defensionis ratio proponitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">justa res et facilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:prol. 33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. prol. 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facilis et prompta defensio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:56:237" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 56, 237</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">facilis et expedita distinctio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:10:33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 10, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facilia, proclivia, jucunda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:27:95" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Part. Or. 27, 95</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">proclivi cursu et facili delabi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ascensus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aditus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 25</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <cit><quote lang="la">descensus Averno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 126</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Imp. Pomp. 14, 41</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">celerem et facilem exitum habere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 22 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lutum,</quote> <trans><tr>easy to work</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:1:40" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 1, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fagus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:229" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 43, 84, § 229</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">humus,</quote> <trans><tr>easy to cultivate</tr>, <tr>mellow</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:6:5" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 6, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arcus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:109" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 109</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jugum,</quote> <trans><tr>easy to climb</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit>(5), 10, 4: <cit><quote lang="la">somnus,</quote> <trans><tr>easy to obtain</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:11:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 11, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 21, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">irae,</quote> <trans><tr>easily excited</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:173" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 173</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saevitia,</quote> <trans><tr>easily overcome</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:12:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 12, 26</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">aurae,</quote> <trans><tr>gentle</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:16:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 16, 123</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jactura,</quote> <trans><tr>easily borne</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:646" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 646</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cera,</quote> <trans><tr>easily shaped</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:169" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 169</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">victus,</quote> <trans><tr>copious</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:460" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 460</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">iter multo facilius atque expeditius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui censemus cursum ad deos faciliorem fuisse quam Scipioni?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:4:14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 4, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">faciliore et commodiore judicio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 3, 8</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod est facillimum, facis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 2, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">concordia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hujus summae virtutis facillima est via,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:71" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in quibus (ceris) facillima est ratio delendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:3:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 3, 31</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n17511.4" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ad</hi> and the <hi rend="ital">gerund</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nulla materies tam facilis ad exardescendum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:45:190" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 45, 190</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad subigendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:41" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad credendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:32:78" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 32, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">palmae ad scandendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 4, 7, § 29</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">faciliora ad intelligendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:3:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 3, 8</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec ad judicandum sunt facillima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:6:30" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 6, 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 20</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n17511.5" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ad</hi> and <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">faciles ad receptum angustiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 12, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mens ad pejora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:2:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">credulitas feminarum ad gaudia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 4</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mediocritas praeceptoris ad intellectum atque imitationem facilior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:3:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 3, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17511.6" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">supine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">facile inventust,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:2:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 2, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res factu facilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:3:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 3, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cuivis facile scitu est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 3, 1, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facilis victu gens,</quote> <trans><tr>abounding in resources</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:445" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 445</bibl></cit> Wagn.: <cit><quote lang="la">(Cyclops) nec visu facilis nec dictu affabilis ulli,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 621</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sapiens facilis victu fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 90:11" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 90, 11</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil est dictu facilius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ter.</author> Ph. 2, 1, 70</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">factu facillimum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 14, 1</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">materia facilis est, in te et in tuos dicta dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:17:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 17, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facilis vincere ac vinci vultu eodem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:33:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 33, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facilis corrumpi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Roma capi facilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:656" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 656</bibl></cit>.—So esp. freq. in the <hi rend="ital">neuter</hi>, facile est, with a <hi rend="ital">subject-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">id esse verum, cuivis facile est noscere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod illis prohibere erat facile,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:50:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 50, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque erat facile nostris, uno tempore propugnare et munire,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 45, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:4:20" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 4, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec origines persequi facile est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 6, § 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quīs facile est aedem conducere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:31" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:4:103" default="NO">4, 103</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">plerumque facilius est plus facere quam idem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:2:10" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 2, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:6:7" default="NO">12, 6, 7</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">stulta reprehendere facillimum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:71" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 71</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:81" default="NO">11, 1, 81</bibl>.—（<foreign lang="greek">z</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">facilius est, ut esse aliquis successor tuus possit, quam ut velit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:44:3" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 44, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:87:5" default="NO" valid="yes">87, 5</bibl>; cf. with <hi rend="ital">quod</hi>: facile est quod habeant conservam<cb n="FACI" />  in villa, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:10:6" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 10, 6</bibl>.—（<foreign lang="greek">h</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra facilis pecori,</quote> <trans>i.e. <tr>suitable</tr>, <tr>proper</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:223" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 223</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">campus operi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:17:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 17, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facilis divisui (Macedonia),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:30:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 45, 30, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque Thraces commercio faciles erant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:58:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 58, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines bello faciles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juvenis inanibus,</quote> <trans><tr>easily susceptible</tr>, <tr>open to</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 2, 27</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">facilis capessendis inimicitiis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 11</bibl></cit>. —（<foreign lang="greek">q</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">Hispania frugum facilis,</quote> <trans><tr>fertile in</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Laud. Seren. 54</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n17511.7" n="b" level="4"> Adverbially, in facili, ex (e) facili, and rarely, de facili, <hi rend="ital">easily</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum exitus haud in facili essent,</quote> <trans><tr>not easy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:8:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 8, 9</bibl></cit> Drak.: <cit><quote lang="la">in facili,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Clem. 1:7" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Clem. 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:274" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 28, 68, § 274</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:26:3:8" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 26, 3, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita adducendum, ut ex facili subsequatur,</quote> <trans><tr>easily</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 9 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex facili tolerantibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 15 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>: ex facili, Cel. 6, 1, 1; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 4, 15, § 60</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which: e facili,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:356" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 356</bibl></cit>: de facili ab iis superabuntur, Firm. Math. 5, 6.—</sense><sense id="n17511.8" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n17511.9" n="a" level="4"> Of persons that do any thing with facility, <hi rend="ital">ready</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quick.</hi>— Constr. with <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in</hi>, and simple <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">facilis et expeditus ad dicendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:48:180" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 48, 180</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermone Graeco promptus et facilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:71" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 71</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">promptus et facillis ad extemporalitatem usque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tit.:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tit. 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">faciles in excogitando et ad discendum prompti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:1:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exiguo faciles,</quote> <trans><tr>content</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:615" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 1, 615</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17511.10" n="b" level="4"> Of things, <hi rend="ital">easily moving</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:310" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 310</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:536" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 536</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cervix,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:Spect. 23" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> Spect. 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">canes, i. e. agiles,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Nemes.</author> Cyneg. 50</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n17511.11" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n17511.12" n="A" level="2"> Of character, <hi rend="ital">easy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">good-natured</hi>, <hi rend="ital">compliant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">willing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">yielding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">courteous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">affable</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">facilis benevolusque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:5:1:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 5, 1, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">comes, benigni, faciles, suaves homines esse dicuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:16:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 16, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facilis et liberalis pater,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:29:73" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N.
