D. 3, 29, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lenis et facilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facilis et clemens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:67" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facilem populum habere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facilem stillare in aurem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:122" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 122</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">di,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 8</bibl></cit>. —With <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">facilem se in rebus cognoscendis praebere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:11:section=32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 11, § 32</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">facilis in causis recipiendis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:57:207" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 57, 207</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">faciles in suum cuique tribuendo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 21, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">faciles ad concedendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:52:107" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 52, 107</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic habeas faciles in tua vota deos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:16:282" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 16, 282</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">faciles aurem praebere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:21:15" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 21, 15</bibl></cit> (3, 14, 5 M.): <cit><quote lang="la">O faciles dare summa deos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:505" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 505</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">facilis impetrandae veniae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:15:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 15, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alloquii facilis (al. alloquiis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:407" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 5, 407</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">comi facilique naturā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gramm. 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facili ac prodigo animo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vit. 7</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">facilior aut indulgentior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:21" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:1:27" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 1, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:11:2" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 11, 2</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid dicam de moribus facillimis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:3:11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 3, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17511.13" n="B" level="2"> Of fortune, <hi rend="ital">favorable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prosperous</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">res et fortunae tuae ... quotidie faciliores mihi et meliores videntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 6, 5, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 11, 2</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi> in four forms: <hi rend="ital">facile</hi>, <hi rend="ital">facul</hi>, <hi rend="ital">faculter</hi>, and <hi rend="ital">faciliter.</hi> </sense><sense id="n17511.14" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">făcĭlĕ</orth> (the class. form). </sense><sense id="n17511.15" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">easily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">without trouble</hi> or <hi rend="ital">difficulty</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">facile cum valemus recta consilia aegrotis damus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 1, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis haec non vel facile vel certe aliquo modo posset ediscere?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:57:232" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 57, 232</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitia in contraria convertuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:45" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 45</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cave putes, aut mare ullum aut flammam esse tantam, quam non facilius sit sedare quam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:42" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 42 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo facilius otio perfruantur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 5</bibl></cit>: id hoc facilius eis persuasit, quod, etc., Caes, B. G. 1, 2, 3.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut optimi cujusque animus in morte facillime evolet tamquam e custodia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:4:14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 4, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facillime fingi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:9:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 9, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facillime decidit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mederi inopiae frumentariae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:24:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 24, 6</bibl></cit> et saep.— </sense><sense id="n17511.16" n="(b)" level="5"> To add intensity to an expression which already signifies a high degree, <hi rend="ital">certainly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unquestionably</hi>, <hi rend="ital">without contradiction</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beyond dispute</hi>, <hi rend="ital">by far</hi>, <hi rend="ital">far</hi> (often in Cic.; <cit><quote lang="la">elsewh. rare): virum unum totius Graeciae facile doctissimum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:9:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Post. 9, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facile deterrimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:33:81" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 33, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genere et nobilitate et pecunia facile primus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 6, 15</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">virtute, existimatione, nobilitate facile princeps,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 5, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facile princeps,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:42:87" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 42, 87</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 6, 10, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Univ. 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:14:1" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 14, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">facile praecipuus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:68" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facile hic plus mali est, quam illic boni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <hi rend="ital">Pe.</hi> Sed tu novistin' fidicinam? <hi rend="ital">Fi.</hi> Tam facile quam me, <hi rend="ital">as well as I do myself</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:3:4:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 3, 4, 68</bibl>.—With verbs that denote<cb n="FACI" />  superiority (vincere, superare, etc.): <cit><quote lang="la">post illum (Herodotum) Thucydides omnes dicendi artificio, mea sententia, facile vicit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:13:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 13, 56</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:19:59" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 19, 59</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 23</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also: stellarum globi terrae magnitudinem facile vincebant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 16</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:33:150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 33, 150</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sisenna omnes adhuc nostros scriptores facile superavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:2:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 2, 7</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:11:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 11, 43</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">facile palmam habes!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:2:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 2, 80</bibl></cit>.— In naming a large amount, <hi rend="ital">quite</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fully</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">huic hereditas facile ad HS. tricies venit testamento propinqui sui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:14:section=35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 14, § 35</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17511.17" n="(g)" level="5"> With a negative, non facile or haud facile, to add intensity, <hi rend="ital">not easily</hi>, i.e. <hi rend="ital">hardly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mira accuratio, ut non facile in ullo diligentiorem majoremque cognoverim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:67:238" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 67, 238</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed haud facile dixerim, cur, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">de iis haud facile compertum narraverim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 17:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 17, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus imbutus malis artibus haud facile libidinibus carebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 13:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 13, 5</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n17511.18" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Readily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">willingly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">without hesitation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">facile omnes perferre ac pati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 35</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">te de aeternitate dicentem aberrare a proposito facile patiebar,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:33:81" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 33, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">disertus homo et facile laborans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:19:66" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 19, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego unguibus facile illi in oculos involem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 3, 6</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">locum habeo nullum, ubi facilius esse possim quam Asturae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:26:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 26, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17511.19" n="c" level="4"> (Acc. to facilis, II. B.) <hi rend="ital">Pleasantly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">agreeably</hi>, <hi rend="ital">well</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">propter eas (nugas) vivo facilius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:5:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 5, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum animo cogites, Quam vos facillime agitis, quam estis maxume Potentes, dites, fortunati, nobiles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:4:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 4, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facillime agitare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:Ter. 1" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. Ter. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi Crassus animadvertit, suas copias propter exiguitatem non facile diduci,</quote> <trans><tr>not safely</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:23:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 23, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17511.20" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">făcul</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">anteclass.</orth>), <hi rend="ital">easily</hi>: nobilitate facul propellere iniquos, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 111, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0116,001:ib. 21" default="NO"><author>Pac.</author> ib. 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">haud facul, ut ait Pacuvius, femina una invenietur bona,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0404,001:ib. 22" default="NO"><author>Afran.</author> ib. 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">advorsam ferre fortunam facul,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0400,001:ib. 24" default="NO"><author>Att.</author> ib. 24</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17511.21" n="3" level="3"> ‡ <orth extent="full" lang="la">fă-culter</orth>, acc. to the statement of Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=87:1" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 87, 1</bibl> Müll.; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 3, § 325</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n17511.22" n="4" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">făcĭlĭter</orth> (post-Aug.; predominating in Vitruvius; censured by <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:17" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 6, 17</bibl>), <hi rend="ital">easily</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferrum percalefactum faciliter fabricatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 1, 4, 3</bibl></cit> et saep.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 3, § 325</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
facilitas: <entryFree id="n17512" type="main" key="fa^ci^li^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">făcĭlĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>facilis</etym>, <sense id="n17512.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">easiness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ease</hi>, <hi rend="ital">facility</hi> in doing any thing. </sense><sense id="n17512.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. (mostly post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">haec in bonis rebus, quod alii ad alia bona sunt aptiores, facilitas nominetur, in malis proclivitas,</quote> <trans><tr>inclination</tr>, <tr>disposition</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:12:28" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 12, 28</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aetatis illius (i. e. puerilis) facilitas,</quote> <trans><tr>capability</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:12:11" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 12, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">audendi facilitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:6:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 6, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pariendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:167" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 24, 95, § 167</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oris,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>easy enunciation</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:7:26" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 7, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corporis,</quote> <trans><tr>a tendency to blush</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 11" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">soli,</quote> <trans><tr>facility in working</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:178" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 19, 49, § 178</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">picea tonsili facilitate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 16, 10, 18, § 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(smaragdi) ad crassitudinem sui facilitate translucida,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>facility in transmitting the rays of light</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 5, 16, § 63</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n17512.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n17512.3" n="A" level="2"> Of speech, <hi rend="ital">facility</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fluency of expression</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">Fabianus disputabat expedite magis quam concitate, ut possis dicere, facilitatem esse illam, non celeritatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 40" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae in oratore maxima sunt, ingenium, inventio, vis, facilitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:2:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 2, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:5:1" default="NO">10, 5, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:7:20" default="NO">10, 7, 20</bibl>; 11, 1, 42; <bibl default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gramm. 23 al.</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10</bibl>, cap. 7.—</sense><sense id="n17512.4" n="B" level="2"> (Acc. to facilis, II. A.) Of character. </sense><sense id="n17512.5" n="1" level="3"> In a good sense, <hi rend="ital">willingness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">readiness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">good-nature</hi>, <hi rend="ital">courteousness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">affability</hi> (freq. in Cic.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: lenitas, humanitas): male docet te mea facilitas multa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:1:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 1, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si illius comitatem et facilitatem tuae gravitati severitatique asperseris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:31:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 31, 66</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:18:66" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 18, 66</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro tua facilitate et humanitate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:24:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 24, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facilitas in audiendo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:7:section=21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 7, § 21</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">facilitas et lenitudo animi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:25:88" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 25, 88</bibl></cit> Orell. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">facilitas indulgentiaque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:72" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facilitate par infimis esse,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Imp. Pomp. 14, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermonis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:40:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 12, 40, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magis id facilitate quam alia ulla culpa mea contigit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:4:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 4, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">actio facilitatem significans,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 43, 184</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17512.6" n="2" level="3"> In a bad sense, <hi rend="ital">levity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">heedlessness</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:29" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 29</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">fornicationis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Jerem. 3, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
faciliter: <entryFree id="n17513" type="main" key="fa^ci^li^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">făcĭlĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <sense id="n17513.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">easily</hi>, v. facilis <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> 4.</sense></entryFree>
facinorosus: <entryFree id="n17514" type="main" key="fa^ci^no^ro_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">făcĭnŏrōsus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">facinĕrosus</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>facinus</etym>, <sense id="n17514.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">criminal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">villainous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">atrocious</hi>,<pb n="716" /> <cb n="FACI" />  <hi rend="ital">vicious</hi> (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">quintum genus est parricidarum, sicariorum, denique omnium facinorosorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:10:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 2, 10, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 6, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:58:237" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 58, 237</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 3, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">injuriosa facinorosaque vita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:14:40" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 14, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">impius et facinorosus animus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:24:2:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 24, 2, 1</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">facinorosior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:16:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 16, 4</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">facinorosissimi sicarii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:38:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 38, 81</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,024:8:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Macc. 8, 34</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">făcĭ-nŏrōse</orth>, <hi rend="ital">viciously</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scandalously</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>August.</author> Inn. 76, 1</bibl>; id. cont. Sec. Resp. Jul. 5, 64.</sense></entryFree>
facinus: <entryFree id="n17515" type="main" key="fa^ci^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">făcĭnus</orth>, <itype>ŏris</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>facio</etym>, <sense id="n17515.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a deed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">act</hi>, <hi rend="ital">action</hi> (class., most freq. in the special signif.). </sense><sense id="n17515.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">factum, res gestae): Atridae duo fratres cluent fecisse facinus maximum, Cum Priami patriam Pergamum ... subegerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 9, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 4, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 1, 1, 2</bibl>: tuum nefarium facinus pejore facinore operire, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:24:12" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 24, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nefario facinore admisso,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:38:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 38, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnum et memorabile,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:3:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 3, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeclarissimum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 55, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic pulcherrimum facinus adivi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:6:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 6, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulcherrimum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:6:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Perd. 6, 19</bibl></cit>: rectissimum, Anton. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 13, 17 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: quantum, Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 9, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suasit amor facinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:90 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 90 al.</bibl></cit>—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">inaudita et singularia facinora sceleris, audaciae, perfidiae, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:72:section=189" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 72, § 189</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mirabilia facinora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:42:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 42, 109</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenii egregia facinora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 2, 2</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n17515.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> in Plautus for <hi rend="ital">thing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nimis mirum est facinus, quomodo haec hinc potuerit transire!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:4:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 4, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod facinus video? etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:1:2:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 1, 2, 73</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17515.3" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">a bad deed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">misdeed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">outrage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">villainy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">crime</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">culpa, peccatum, delictum, flagitium, scelus, crimen, etc.): facinus est vincire civem Romanum, scelus verberare, prope parricidium necare: quid dicam in crucem tollere?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:66:section=170" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 66, § 170</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">scelus et facinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:16:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 16, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad vim, facinus caedemque delecti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:28:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 28, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec in facinore, nec in libidine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:27:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 27, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil facinoris, nihil flagitii praetermittere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:13:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 13, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne facinus facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:29:95" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 29, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jacere humi ad facinus obeundum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:10:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 10, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">committere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 3, 10, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:60:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 60, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in se admittere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 3, 9, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 13, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">patrare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 18:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 18, 8</bibl></cit>: ad omne facinus impellere aliquem, Cic. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 424, 31</bibl> (Rep. 6, 1 ed. Mos.): <cit><quote lang="la">crimen facinusque libidinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:294" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 294</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">transi gymnasia atque audi facinus majoris abollae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of a teacher</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:115 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 115 al.</bibl></cit>—Esp. in exclamations: <cit><quote lang="la">O facinus indignum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:7:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 7, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 2, 1, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">O indignum facinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 1, 1, 25</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:12:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 12, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 13 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl>—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">furiae vindices facinorum et sceleris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:18:66" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 18, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo flagitiis atque facinoribus coopertus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 23:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 23, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">talia facinora impune suscepisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 31:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 31, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17515.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, concr. (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>), <hi rend="ital">an instrument of villainy</hi>, said of the poisoned cup: <cit><quote lang="la">facinusque excussit ab ore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:423" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 423</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

Andron. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 475, 16</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Subj.</hi>: faciatur, Titin. ib.—<hi rend="ital">Inf.</hi>: fiere, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 75</bibl> P.; Ann. v. 15, ed. Vahl.; Laev. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:7:10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 7, 10</bibl>.—On the long i of fit, v. Ritschl, prol. p. 184, and cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:prol. 25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. prol. 25</bibl>: ut fit in bello) [prob. root bha-; Sanscr. bhasas, light; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">fa</foreign>-, in <foreign lang="greek">fai/nw, fhmi/</foreign>; cf. fax, facetiae, facilis, Corss. Ausspr. 1, 423.—But Curt. refers facio to root <foreign lang="greek">qe-</foreign> (strengthened THEK), Griech. Etym. p. 64], <hi rend="ital">to make</hi> in all senses, <hi rend="ital">to do</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perform</hi>, <hi rend="ital">accomplish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prepare</hi>, <hi rend="ital">produce</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bring to pass</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cause</hi>, <hi rend="ital">effect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">create</hi>, <hi rend="ital">commit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perpetrate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">form</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fashion</hi>, etc. (cf. in gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">ago, factito, reddo, operor, tracto): verbum facere omnem omnino faciendi causam complectitur, donandi, solvendi, judicandi, ambulandi, numerandi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:16:218" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 16, 218</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n17516.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi> </sense><sense id="n17516.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n17516.3" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: ut faber, cum quid aedificaturus est, non ipse facit materiam, sed ea utitur, quae sit parata, etc. ... Quod si non est a deo materia facta, ne terra quidem et aqua et aër et ignis a deo factus est, Cic. N. D. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 2, 8</bibl> (Cic. ed. Bait. 7, p. 121): <cit><quote lang="la">sphaera ab Archimede facta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fecitque idem et sepsit de manubiis comitium et curiam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aedem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pontem in Arari faciundum curat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 13, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">castra,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 48, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 15, 4, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">faber vasculum fecit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:10:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 10, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">classem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:21:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 21, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cenas et facere et obire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:13:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 13, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignem lignis viridibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:17:section=45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 17, § 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poëma,</quote> <trans><tr>to compose</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:29:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 29, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carmina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:28" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">versus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:38" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermonem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 8, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">litteram,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: ludos, <hi rend="ital">to celebrate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exhibit</hi> = edere, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 15, 10</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">also i. q. ludificari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:4:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 4, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sementes,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to sow</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">messem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:10:28" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 10, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecuniam,</quote> <trans><tr>to make</tr>, <tr>acquire</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:6:section=17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 6, § 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manum (with parare copias),</quote> <trans><tr>to collect</tr>, <tr>prepare</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:12:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 12, 33</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">cohortes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:87:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:4:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 3, 4, 78</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 2, 77</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea, quantum potui, feci, ut essent nota nostris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 1, 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facito, ut sciam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non potuisti ullo modo facere, ut mihi illam epistolam non mitteres,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 21, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si facis ut patriae sit idoneus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:71" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut nihil ad te dem litterarum facere non possum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 8, 14, 1</bibl></cit>; so with <hi rend="ital">ut non</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:77:section=190" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 77, § 190</bibl> (Zumpt, Gram. § 539).—</sense><sense id="n17516.5" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> = efficere, curare, <hi rend="ital">to cause</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">nulla res magis talis oratores videri facit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:38:142" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 38, 142</bibl></cit>;
