Munro ad loc.); 1153: vereor ne a te rursus dissentiam. <hi rend="ital">M.</hi> Non facies, Quinte, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:15:33" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 15, 33</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">so after scribam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:16:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 16, 16, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nominaverunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:28:50" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 28, 50</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">after disserere: tu mihi videris utrumque facturus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 11, 22</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">after fingere: ut facit apud Platonem Socrates,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">necesse erit uti epilogis, ut in Verrem Cicero fecit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:54" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 1, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui dicere ac facere doceat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:3:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 3, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">faciant equites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:14" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:37:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 37, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">petis ut libellos meos recognoscendos curem. Faciam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:26:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 26, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 1, 4</bibl> et saep. (cf. the use of facio, as <hi rend="ital">neutr.</hi>, to resume or recall the meaning of another verb, v. II. E. infra; between that use and this no line can be drawn).</sense><sense id="n17516.7" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n17516.8" n="1" level="3"> With a double object, <hi rend="ital">to make</hi> a thing into something, <hi rend="ital">to render</hi> it something: <cit><quote lang="la">senatum bene firmum firmiorem vestra auctoritate fecistis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:6:7:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 6, 7, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">te disertum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 39</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">iratum adversario judicem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:51:220" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 51, 220</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">heredem filiam,</quote> <trans><tr>to appoint</tr>, <tr>constitute</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:43:section=111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 43, § 111</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem regem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:9:6" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 9, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem ludos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:2:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 2, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem absentem rei capitalis reum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:38:section=93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 38, § 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animum dubium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Imp. Pomp. 10, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">injurias irritas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:26:section=63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 26, § 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vectigalia sibi deteriora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:36:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 36, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hi consules facti sunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 5, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">disciplina doctior facta civitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">di ex hominibus facti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 10</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tua virtute nobis Romanos ex amicis amicissimos fecisti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 10, 2</bibl></cit>.—In <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo tibi sumere depositum clavum fierique tribuno?</quote> <trans><tr>to become a tribune</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:6:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 6, 25</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17516.9" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">to value</hi>, <hi rend="ital">esteem</hi>, <hi rend="ital">regard</hi> a person or thing in any manner (like the Engl. <hi rend="ital">make</hi>, in the phrase <hi rend="ital">to make much of</hi>).—Esp. with <hi rend="ital">gen. pretii</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in quo perspicere posses, quanti te, quanti Pompeium, quem unum ex omnibus facio, ut debeo, plurimi, quanti Brutum facerem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 10, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">te quotidie pluris feci,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">voluptatem virtus minimi facit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:13:42" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 13, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolorem nihili facere,</quote> <trans><tr>to care nothing for</tr>, <tr>to despise</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 27, 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihili facio scire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:2:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 2, 2, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">negat se magni facere, utrum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:38" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parum id facio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 85:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 85, 31</bibl></cit>: si illi aliter nos faciant quam aequum sit. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:1:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 1, 1, 43</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n17516.10" n="3" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to make</hi> a thing <hi rend="ital">the property of</hi> a person, <hi rend="ital">subject</hi> it to him: omnia, quae mulieris fuerunt,<cb n="FACI" />  viri fiunt, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:4:23" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Top. 4, 23</bibl>.—Esp.: facere aliquid dicionis alicujus, <hi rend="ital">to reduce to subjection under</hi> a person or power: <cit><quote lang="la">omnem oram Romanae dicionis fecit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:60:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 60, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicionis alienae facti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:25:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 25, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:27:14" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 27, 14</bibl>; cf.: ut munus imperii beneficii sui faceret, <hi rend="ital">to make it</hi> (<hi rend="ital">seem</hi>) <hi rend="ital">his own bounty</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:13:4:9" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 13, 4, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne delecto imperatore alio sui muneris rempublicam faceret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 52</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17516.11" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To represent</hi> a thing in any manner, <hi rend="ital">to feign</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assert</hi>, <hi rend="ital">say.</hi>—Constr. with <case>acc.</case> and <pos>adj.</pos> or <hi rend="ital">part.</hi>, or with <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> </sense><sense id="n17516.12" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Acc.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">part.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in eo libro, ubi se exeuntem e senatu et cum Pansa colloquentem facit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 60, 218</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Xenophon facit ... Socratem disputantem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 12, 31</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ejus (Socratis) oratio, qua facit eum Plato usum apud judices,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 40 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> al.—</sense><sense id="n17516.13" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Acc.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui nuper fecit servo currenti in via decesse populum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:prol. 31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. prol. 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fecerat et fetam procubuisse lupam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:630" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 630</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 109</bibl>, v. Bach ad h. l.: <cit><quote lang="la">poëtae impendere apud inferos saxum Tantalo faciunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:16:35" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 16, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem (Herculem) Homerus apud inferos conveniri facit ab Ulixe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:16:41" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 16, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Plato construi a deo mundum facit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 8, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Plato Isocratem laudari fecit a Socrate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,041:6:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Opt. Gen. 6, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:38:142" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 38, 142</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">M. Cicero dicere facit C. Laelium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:5:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caput esse faciunt ea, quae perspicua dicunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fia. 4, 4, 8</bibl></cit>, v. Madv. ad h. l.—</sense><sense id="n17516.14" n="(g)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">In double construction</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Polyphemum Homerus cum ariete colloquentem facit ejusque laudare fortunas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:39" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 39 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n17516.15" n="5" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To make believe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to pretend</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">facio me alias res agere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 15, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum verbis se locupletem faceret,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me unum ex iis feci, qui, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:27:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 27, 65</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17516.16" n="6" level="3"> Hypothetically in the <hi rend="ital">imper.</hi> fac, <hi rend="ital">suppose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assume</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fac, quaeso, qui ego sum, esse te,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:23:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 23, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">fac potuisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fac animos non remanere post mortem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:34:82" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 34, 82</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 29, 70</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fac velit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,003:2:241" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Ach. 2, 241</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fac velle,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:540" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 540</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n17516.17" n="7" level="3"> In mercant. lang., <hi rend="ital">to practise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exercise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">follow</hi> any trade or profession: <cit><quote lang="la">cum mercaturas facerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:28:section=72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 28, § 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">naviculariam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 5, 18</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">46: argentariam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 5, 49</bibl></cit>, § 155; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 4, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">topiariam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:1:2:section=5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 1, 2, § 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haruspicinam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:18:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 6, 18, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeconium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">piraticam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Post. Red. in Sen. 5, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">medicinam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:1:14:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 1, 14, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17516.18" n="8" level="3"> In relig. lang., like the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">r(e/zein</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">to perform</hi> or <hi rend="ital">celebrate</hi> a religious rite; <hi rend="ital">to offer sacrifice</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make an offering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to sacrifice</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">res illum divinas apud eos deos in suo sacrario quotidie facere vidisti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:8:section=18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 8, § 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacra pro civibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:24:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Balb. 24, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacrificium publicum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:14:56" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 14, 56</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">a sacris patriis Junonis Sospitae, cui omnes consules facere necesse est, consulem avellere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:41:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 41, 90</bibl></cit>.—With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum faciam vitulā pro frugibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:3:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 3, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">catulo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:22:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 22, 4</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass. impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum pro populo fieret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:13:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 13, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus diis decemviri ex libris ut fieret, ediderunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 3, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17516.19" n="9" level="3"> In gram., <hi rend="ital">to make</hi>, <hi rend="ital">form</hi> in inflecting: <cit><quote lang="la">cur aper apri et pater patris faciat?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 6, 13</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:15" default="NO">15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:27" default="NO">27</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sic genitivus Achilli et Ulixi fecit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:63" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 5, 63</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:26" default="NO">1, 6, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">eadem (littera) fecit ex duello bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:4:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 4, 15</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17516.20" n="10" level="3"> In late Lat., (se) facere aliquo, <hi rend="ital">to betake one's self</hi> to any place: <cit><quote lang="la">intra limen sese facit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> 5, p. 159, 25</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">without se: homo meus coepit ad stelas facere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad illum ex Libya Hammon facit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pall. 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17516.21" n="11" level="3"> Peculiar phrases. </sense><sense id="n17516.22" n="a" level="4"> Quid faciam (facias, fiet, etc.), with <case>abl.</case>, <case>dat.</case>, or (rare) with <hi rend="ital">de</hi>, <hi rend="ital">what is to be done with</hi> a person or thing? quid hoc homine facias? <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:13:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 13, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:16:section=40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 16, § 40</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nescit quid faciat auro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:2:3:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 2, 3, 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid tu huic homini facias?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:11:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 11, 30</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quid enim tibi faciam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 7, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: quid faceret huic conclusioni, i. e. <hi rend="ital">how should he refute</hi>, etc., <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 30, 96</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid facias illi?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">miserunt Delphos consultum quidnam facerent de rebus suis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Them. 2</bibl></cit>: quid fecisti scipione? <hi rend="ital">what have you done with the stick?</hi> or, <hi rend="ital">what has become of it?</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:5:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 5, 4, 6</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 4, 9</bibl>.—In <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid Tulliolā meā fiet?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:14:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 14, 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid illo fiet? quid me?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 6, 1, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid fiet artibus?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 33, 107</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid mihi fiet?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:536" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 536</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid de illa fiet fidicina igitur?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:1:2:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 48</bibl></cit>: de fratre quid <cb n="FACI" /> fiet? <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:9:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 9, 39</bibl>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid faciat Philomela? fugam custodia claudit?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:572" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 572</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid facerem? neque servitio me exire licebat, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:1:41 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 1, 41 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n17516.23" n="b" level="4"> Fit, factum est aliquo <hi rend="ital">or</hi> aliqua re, <hi rend="ital">it happens to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">becomes of</hi> a person or thing: <cit><quote lang="la">volo Erogitare, meo minore quid sit factum filio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:5:1:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 5, 1, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec quid deinde iis (elephantis) factum sit, auctores explicant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 6, 6, § 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid eo est argento factum?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:1:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 1, 106</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n17516.24" n="(b)" level="5"> Esp., si quid factum sit aliquo, <hi rend="ital">if any thing should happen to one</hi> (i. q. si quid acciderit humanitus), euphemistically for <hi rend="ital">if one should die</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quid eo factum esset, in quo spem essetis habituri?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Imp. Pomp. 20, 59</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">eum fecisse aiunt, sibi quod faciendum fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:1:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 1, 23</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n17516.25" n="c" level="4"> Ut fit, <hi rend="ital">as it usually happens</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as is commonly the case</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">praesertim cum, ut fit, fortuito saepe aliquid concluse apteque dicerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:53:177" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 53, 177</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">queri, ut fit, incipiunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:23:section=56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 23, § 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum se uxor, ut fit, comparat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:10:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 10, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fecit statim, ut fit, fastidium copia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 1, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17516.26" n="d" level="4"> Fiat, an expression of assent, <hi rend="ital">so be it! very good!</hi> fiat, geratur mos tibi, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:5:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 5, 146</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:1:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 1, 1, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 2, 2, 138</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:4:3:44 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 4, 3, 44 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n17516.27" n="e" level="4"> Dictum ac factum, <hi rend="ital">no sooner said than done</hi>, <hi rend="ital">without delay</hi>, <hi rend="ital">at once;</hi> v. dictum under dico, A. d.—</sense><sense id="n17516.28" n="12" level="3"> In certain phrases the ellipsis of facere is common, e. g. finem facere: <cit><quote lang="la">Quae cum dixisset, Cotta finem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:40:94" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 40, 94</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 4, 1 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl>—With nihil aliud quam, quid alium quam, nihil praeterquam, which often = an emphatic Engl. <hi rend="ital">only</hi> (but not in Cic.): <cit><quote lang="la">Tissaphernes nihil aliud quam bellum comparavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Ages. 2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Ages. 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per biduum nihil aliud quam steterunt parati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 46</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:20" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:83" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 83</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 63</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:26" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 26</bibl>.—So with nihil amplius quam, nihil prius quam, nihil minus quam, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:11" default="NO" valid="yes">35, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:3" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 3</bibl>.</sense><sense id="n17516.29" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi> </sense><sense id="n17516.30" n="A" level="2"> With adverbs, <hi rend="ital">to do</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deal</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">act</hi> in any manner: <cit><quote lang="la">recta et vera loquere, sed neque vere neque recte adhuc Fecisti umquam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:5:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 5, 2, 7</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">v. recte under rego: bene fecit Silius, qui transegerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:24:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 24, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">seu recte seu perperam,</quote> <trans><tr>to do right or wrong</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 8, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Dalmatis di male faciant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 11 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facis amice,</quote> <trans><tr>in a friendly manner</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:2:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 2, 9</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">per malitiam,</quote> <trans><tr>maliciously</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:7:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Com. 7, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">humaniter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperite,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:1:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tutius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:68" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">voluit facere contra huic aegre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 1, 10</bibl></cit>: bene facere, <hi rend="ital">to profit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">benefit</hi> (opp. male facere, <hi rend="ital">to hurt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">injure</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:8:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 8, 25</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 7, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 2, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:5:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 5, 2, 23</bibl>; v. also under benefacio and benefactum.—</sense><sense id="n17516.31" n="B" level="2"> Facere cum or ab aliquo, <hi rend="ital">to take part with</hi> one, <hi rend="ital">to side with</hi> one; and opp. contra (or adversus) aliquem, <hi rend="ital">to take part against</hi> one: <cit><quote lang="la">si respondisset, idem sentire et secum facere Sullam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:13:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 13, 36</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum illo consulem facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 6, 8, 2</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">secum consules facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:35:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 35, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auctoritatem sapientissimorum hominum facere nobiscum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:36:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 36, 104</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">rem et sententiam interdicti mecum facere fatebatur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 28, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum veritas cum hoc faciat,</quote> <trans><tr>is on his side</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 30, 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">commune est, quod nihilo magis ab adversariis quam a nobis facit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:48:90" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 48, 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes damnatos, omnes ignominia affectos illac (a or cum Caesare) facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 7, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae res in civitate duae plurimum possunt, eae contra nos ambae faciunt in hoc tempore,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque minus eos cum quibus steterint quam adversus quos fecerint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eum. 8, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum aliquo non male facere,</quote> <trans><tr>to be on good terms with</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:762" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 762</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17516.32" n="C" level="2"> In late Lat. facere cum aliqua = vivere cum aliqua, <hi rend="ital">to live in matrimony</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be married</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4646</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n17516.33" n="D" level="2"> Ad aliquid, alicui, or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be good</hi> or <hi rend="ital">of use for</hi> any thing; <hi rend="ital">to be useful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of service</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">chamaeleon facit ad difficultatem urinae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 18, 21, § 46</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 122" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 122</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad talem formam non facit iste locus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:16:190" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 16, 190</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:6:128" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 128</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:2:16 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 2, 16 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">radix coronopi coeliacis praeclare facit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 19, 22, § 48</bibl></cit>; so with <case>dat.</case>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Plin. Val.</author> 2, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3</bibl> (4), 1, 20: <cit><quote lang="la">facit autem commode ea compositio, quam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:5:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 5, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:17:13" default="NO">8, 17, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec caelum, nec aquae faciunt, nec terra, nec aurae,</quote> <trans><tr>do not benefit me</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:8:23" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 8, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mire facit in peroratione confessio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:173" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 173</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:171" default="NO">171</bibl>; cf. with a <hi rend="ital">subject-clause</hi>: plurimum facit, totas diligenter<pb n="718" /> <cb n="FACI" />  nosse causas, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:4:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 4, 8</bibl>: ad aliquid or alicui signifies also <hi rend="ital">to suit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fit</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non faciet capiti dura corona meo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:1:19" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 1, 19</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:16:189" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 16, 189</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n17516.34" n="E" level="2"> Like the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">poiei=n</foreign> or <foreign lang="greek">dra=n</foreign>, and the Engl. <hi rend="ital">to do</hi>, instead of another verb (also for esse and pati): <cit><quote lang="la">factum cupio (sc. id esse),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:4:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 4, 4, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">factum volo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:3:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 3, 3, 91</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:2:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 3, 2, 104</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">an Scythes Anacharsis potuit pro nihilo pecuniam ducere, nostrates philosophi facere non potuerunt?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:32:90" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 32, 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil his in locis nisi saxa et montes cogitabam: idque ut facerem, orationibus inducebar tuis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:1:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 1, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Demosthenem, si illa pronuntiare voluisset, ornate splendideque facere potuisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">cur Cassandra furens futura prospiciat, Priamus sapiens hoc idem facere nequeat?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:39:85" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 39, 85</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 33, 107</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:16:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 16, 13</bibl>; Planc. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:18:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 18, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Chabr. 3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Chabr. 3, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:4:3 al" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 3 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vadem te ad mortem tyranno dabis pro amico, ut Pythagoreus ille Siculo fecit tyranno (here also with the case of the preceding verb),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 24 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> (v. Madv. ad h. l. p. 278): <cit><quote lang="la">jubeas (eum) miserum esse, libenter quatenus id facit (i. e. miser est),</quote> <trans><tr>what he is doing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in hominibus solum existunt: nam bestiae simile quiddam faciunt (i. q. patiuntur or habent),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 14</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">ne facias quod Ummidius quidam (= ne idem experiaris, ne idem tibi eveniat),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 94</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n17516.35" n="F" level="1"> Facere omitted, especially in short sentences expressing a judgment upon conduct, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">at stulte, qui non modo non censuerit, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:27:101" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 27, 101</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n17516.36" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">factus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> </sense><sense id="n17516.37" n="A" level="2"> As adjective ante-class. and very rare: <cit><quote lang="la">factius nihilo facit, sc. id, i. e. nihilo magis effectum reddit,</quote> <trans><tr>is no nearer bringing it about</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 3, 6</bibl></cit>; cf. Lorenz ad loc.—Far more freq., </sense><sense id="n17516.38" n="B" level="2"> In the <hi rend="ital">neutr.</hi> as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">factum</orth>, <itype>i</itype> (<hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> factūm, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:31:66" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 31, 66</bibl> Trag. 81), <hi rend="ital">that which is done</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a deed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">act</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exploit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">achievement</hi> (syn.: res gestae, facinus). </sense><sense id="n17516.39" n="1" level="3"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">depingere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:5:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 1, 5, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facere factum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:7:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 7, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 139</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicta et facta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:4:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 4, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 4, 5, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">opus facto est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:4:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 4, 5, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ecquod hujus factum aut commissum non dicam audacius, sed, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:26:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 26, 72</bibl></cit>: meum factum probari abs te triumpho gaudio, Caes. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 16</bibl>, A. 1; <cit><quote lang="la">14, 9, 2: quod umquam eorum in re publica forte factum exstitit?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 14, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeclarum atque divinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:44:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 44, 114</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">egregium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:16:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 10, 16, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:10:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 10, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">factum per se improbabile,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:4:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 4, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:22" default="NO">6, 1, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">illustre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Arist. 2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Arist. 2, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">illustria et gloriosa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:11:37" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 11, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">forte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:14:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 8, 14, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dira,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:533" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 533</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nefanda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:14:16 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 14, 16 al.</bibl></cit>; but also with the <pos>adv.</pos>: <cit><quote lang="la">recte ac turpiter factum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:80:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 80, 5</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">multa huius (Timothei) sunt praeclare facta sed haec maxime illustria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,013:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Timoth. 1, 2</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">v. Zumpt, Gram. § 722, 2: dimidium facti, qui coepit, habet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo facto aut dicto adest opus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 15</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">famam extendere factis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:468" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 468</bibl></cit>: non hominum video. non ego facta boum, <hi rend="ital">doings</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">works</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:10:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 10, 60</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n17516.40" n="2" level="3"> In partic., bonum factum, like the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">a)gaqh\ tu/xh</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a good deed</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">well done</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fortunate</hi> (ante-class. and post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">bonum factum'st, edicta ut servetis mea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:prol. 16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. prol. 16</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 44</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc factum est optimum, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:2:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 2, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">majorum bona facta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 40</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 65</bibl>. —At the commencement of edicts, <bibl default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caesar, 80</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vit. 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Vir. Ill. 49:17" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Vir. Ill. 49, 17</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pudic. 1</bibl>.—(But in the class. per. factum in this sense is a participle, and is construed with an <pos>adv.</pos>: <cit><quote lang="la">bene facta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 8:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 8, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 85:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 85, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:26:64" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 26, 64</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">recte, male facta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:18:62" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 18, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">male facto exigua laus proponitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:Agr. 2:2:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. Agr. 2, 2, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:43:322" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 43, 322</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:7:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 7, 13</bibl>; cf. Krebs, Antibarb. p. 460).—* </sense><sense id="n17516.41" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">facteon</orth>, <itype>a word jestingly formed by Cicero, after the analogy of the Greek</itype>, for faciendum: quare, ut opinor, <foreign lang="greek">filosofhte/on</foreign>, id quod tu facis, et istos consulatus non flocci facteon, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:16:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 16, 13</bibl> Orell. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi> (for facteon, Ernesti has <foreign lang="greek">e)ate/on</foreign>).</sense></entryFree>
